=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)#rfc_5F11665|Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)]] expired 2025-01-01 01:01 ===
* Id: 5F11665
* User: Voorts
* Date: 2024-12-15 21:14:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1263301935|POLICY 1263301935}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1269477830|POLICY 1269477830}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
 

Should [[Wikipedia:Administrators#Restoration of admin tools]] be amended to:
* '''Option 1'''{{snd}}Require former administrators to request restoration of their tools at the [[WP:BN|bureaucrats' noticeboard]] (BN) if they are eligible to do so (i.e., they do not fit into any of the exceptions).
* '''Option 2'''{{snd}}<s>Clarify</s> <ins>Maintain the status quo</ins> that former administrators who would be eligible to request restoration via BN may instead request restoration of their tools via a voluntary [[WP:RfA|request for adminship]] (RfA).
* '''Option 3'''{{snd}}Allow bureaucrats to SNOW-close RfAs as successful if (a) 48 hours have passed, (b) the editor has right of resysop, and (c) a SNOW close is warranted.

'''Background''': This issue arose in one [[Wikipedia:Requests for adminship/Worm That Turned 2|recent RfA]] and is currently being discussed in an [[Wikipedia:Requests for adminship/Hog Farm 2|ongoing RfA]]. [[User:Voorts|voorts]] ([[User talk:Voorts|talk]]/[[Special:Contributions/Voorts|contributions]]) 21:14, 15 December 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Department of Politics and International Studies, University of Cambridge#rfc_84D297B|Talk:Department of Politics and International Studies, University of Cambridge]] expired 2025-01-01 21:02 ===
* Id: 84D297B
* User: Chetsford
* Date: 2024-12-02 20:11:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1260827836|SOC 1260827836}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1266696525|SOC 1266696525}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
A [[Talk:Department_of_Politics_and_International_Studies,_University_of_Cambridge#Sentiment_check:_Resolution_of_notable_people_section|recent, informal discussion]] produced a lot of opinions but no clear consensus. 

Should the [[Department_of_Politics_and_International_Studies,_University_of_Cambridge#Notable_people|"notable people" section]] in this article be: 
*'''A:''' Deleted 
*'''B:''' Kept as a bulleted list of notable people 
*'''C:''' Converted to prose description / narrative list of notable people 
*'''D:''' Converted to prose description / narrative list and limited to the following people: ______, ______, _______, etc. 
*'''E:''' Something else

(I included the above options as those that appear to have been supported by at least one person in the informal discussion. My apologies if I missed or misrepresented something.) [[User:Chetsford|Chetsford]] ([[User talk:Chetsford|talk]]) 20:11, 2 December 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of tallest buildings and structures in the Birmingham Metropolitan Area, West Midlands#rfc_0407189|Talk:List of tallest buildings and structures in the Birmingham Metropolitan Area, West Midlands]] expired 2025-01-03 02:01 ===
* Id: 0407189
* User: Beland
* Date: 2024-12-04 01:45:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|1261069740|ECON 1261069740}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1261069745|MEDIA 1261069745}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|1266974747|ECON 1266974747}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1266974748|MEDIA 1266974748}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Which, if any, subsections of [[List of tallest buildings and structures in the Birmingham Metropolitan Area, West Midlands#Approved, proposed and emergent]] should be deleted? Should buildings in these sections with and without Wikipedia articles be treated differently? In favor of deletion is an interpretation of [[WP:CRYSTAL]] which says uncertain future events like building construction are out of scope for Wikipedia, especially for emergent proposals, which have not yet sought planning approval and it's unclear have a 50% probability of actually happening due to government rejection or financial difficulties. Against deletion is the argument that it's useful for research purposes to document the proposals and even though the proposals might not get built, they are referenced to reliable sources; approved designs are specific and more likely to get built. After this RFC is complete, the article may be split due to size, depending on what is kept. -- [[User:Beland|Beland]] ([[User talk:Beland|talk]]) 01:45, 4 December 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Court of the Lions#rfc_11EE12E|Talk:Court of the Lions]] expired 2025-01-09 22:01 ===
* Id: 11EE12E
* User: R Prazeres
* Date: 2024-12-10 21:22:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1262338969|MEDIA 1262338969}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1268457172|MEDIA 1268457172}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the following revision/expansion be accepted or rejected?

It concerns the paragraph introducing the quoted excerpt in the section currently titled [[Court of the Lions#Excerpt of Ibn Zamrak's poem on the basin|"Excerpt of Ibn Zamrak's poem on the basin"]] (about an inscription carved into the courtyard's fountain). It currently reads as:
{{blockquote|''The poet and minister [[Ibn Zamrak]] wrote a poem to describe the beauty of the courtyard. It also describes the fountain's hydraulic system.{{sfn|Irwin|2004|p=52}}{{sfn|L√≥pez|2011|p=134}} It is carved around the rim of the basin:{{Sfn|Puerta V√≠lchez|2015|p=169}}''}}

The proposed expansion would read as:
{{blockquote|''Carved around the rim of the basin is a poem of twelve verses by the vizier and poet [[Ibn Zamrak]]. Six of the verses originate, with minor modifications, from a longer ''[[qasida]]'' of 146 verses that Ibn Zamrak composed for the banquet honoring the circumcision of Muhammad V's son, Abd Allah.{{Sfn|Puerta V√≠lchez|2015|p=168}} Verses from the same ''qasida'' are also included in the Hall of the Two Sisters.{{Sfn|Puerta V√≠lchez|2015|p=168}} The first part of the poem refers specifically to the fountain{{Sfn|Puerta V√≠lchez|2015|p=169}} and alludes to how its hydraulic system functioned.{{sfn|Irwin|2004|p=52}}{{sfn|L√≥pez|2011|p=134}} Below is an excerpt (verses 3 to 7):{{Sfn|Puerta V√≠lchez|2015|p=169}}''}}

If accepted, further copy-edits or suggestions about wording are also welcome. If relevant for context, the reasons for starting this RfC are [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Court_of_the_Lions&diff=prev&oldid=1259353924 this edit] and [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Court_of_the_Lions&diff=next&oldid=1259353924 this revert], along with the [[Talk:Court of the Lions#Poem source and details|discussion above]]. [[User:R Prazeres|R Prazeres]] ([[User talk:R Prazeres|talk]]) 21:22, 10 December 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_CFA931E|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2025-01-10 13:01 ===
* Id: CFA931E
* User: JJPMaster
* Date: 2025-01-09 23:53:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1268476727|MEDIA 1268476727}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1268575719|MEDIA 1268575719}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The ''London Standard'', formerly known as the ''[[Evening Standard]]'', has 18,703 links on the English Wikipedia. Its reliability has not been discussed since 2018, and there is currently no consensus on its reliability. Therefore, '''what is the reliability of the ''London Standard''?'''
* Option 1: [[WP:GREL|Generally reliable]]
* Option 2: [[WP:MREL|Marginally reliable, or additional considerations apply]]
* Option 3: [[WP:GUNREL|Generally unreliable]]
* Option 4: Publishes false or fabricated information, and should be [[WP:DEPREC|deprecated]]
[[User:JJPMaster|JJP]]<sub>[[User talk:JJPMaster|Mas]]<sub>[[Special:Contributions/JJPMaster|ter]]</sub></sub> ([[She (pronoun)|she]]/[[Singular they|they]]) 23:53, 9 January 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Weather#rfc_C5636E5|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Weather]] expired 2025-01-10 15:01 ===
* Id: C5636E5
* User: EF5
* Date: 2024-12-16 18:56:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1265549412|SCI 1265549412}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1269656333|SCI 1269656333}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should we have notability standards for individual tornado articles? We already have informal inclusion criteria for "Tornadoes of YYYY" articles. Below is a preliminary proposal for such criteria, with the hope that it can evolve into a formal guideline that can possibly be referenced in future AfD discussions.

[[File:Symbol recycling vote.svg|20px|alt=recycle]] '''Previous discussions:''' [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Weather/Archive 5#New tornado articles and the news|New tornado articles and the news]], [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Weather/Archive 4#Proposal - Criteria for inclusion on Tornadoes of XXXX articles|Proposal - Criteria for inclusion on Tornadoes of XXXX articles]]

This has been nagging at me for a while now, and since another editor has talked to me about this issue, I think we bring this up. Since we have a sort of "inclusion criteria" for "Tornadoes of YYYY" articles, I suggest we come up with notability criteria for individual tornadoes as well. See [[User:EF5/My tornado criteria]] for what this may look like.


This is my very primitive way of determining the notability of several tornado articles I've written, and am hoping that it could be integrated into a refined set-in-stone WPW policy that could be used in actual AfDs. I'd assume that the table will be gotten rid of and turned into a list. This has been discussed in the past, but never really came to anything. Maybe it could be... [[WP:NTORNADO]] (with it's own project page)? Starting an RfC, since obviously community input is needed. Also pinging {{ping|Departure‚Äì}}, who suggested this. :) [[User:EF5|<span style="color:#A188FC;">'''E'''</span>]]<sub>[[User talk:EF5|<span style="color:#A188FC;">'''F'''</span>]]</sub><sup>[[User:EF5/Creations|<span style="color:#A188FC;">'''5'''</span>]]</sup> 18:56, 16 December 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Vital articles/Level/3#rfc_592281E|Wikipedia talk:Vital articles/Level/3]] expired 2025-01-11 01:01 ===
* Id: 592281E
* User: Remsense
* Date: 2025-01-10 04:26:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/WikiProjects_and_collaborations|prev|1268520170|PROJ 1268520170}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/WikiProjects_and_collaborations|prev|1268683571|PROJ 1268683571}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should a globally visible RfC be required to make changes to the list of Level 3 Vital articles?

''' RfC discussion '''

* '''Require RfC'''{{snd}}to be blunt, I'm a bit concerned by the potential for counterproductive changes resulting from restless tinkering based on particularized interpretations of what the VA system is for and basic misreadings of its guidelines. This list has been fairly stable over the years, and while mere longevity is usually weak consensus, for a system whose results are so widely visible to editors it is distinctly less so. I think there is far more likelihood with the present system for a weak consensus localized here to do damage than to make efficient improvements to the list of what we consider the 1000 most vital articles, meant to stably guide the work of editors. At present, the overwhelming majority of proposals are not approved. Even though a supermajority is required for approval, the low turnout puts a considerable onus on individual editors to keep noticing and opposing clearly defective or lazy proposals, which is a waste of time. <span style="border-radius:2px;padding:3px;background:#1E816F">[[User:Remsense|<span style="color:#fff">'''Remsense'''</span>]]<span style="color:#fff">&nbsp;‚Ä•&nbsp;</span>[[User talk:Remsense|<span lang="zh" style="color:#fff">'''ËÆ∫'''</span>]]</span> 04:26, 10 January 2025 (UTC)}}

Do the following violate [[WP:NOT]]? A) [[List of British Airways destinations#List|List of everywhere British Airways has flown over its history]], and B) [[Heathrow Airport#Airlines and destinations|list of everywhere it flies from Heathrow Airport as of today]].

=== [[Talk:Capital accumulation#rfc_FFDFB78|Talk:Capital accumulation]] expired 2025-01-16 10:01 ===
* Id: FFDFB78
* User: Des Vallee
* Date: 2025-01-13 05:58:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|1269762028|ECON 1269762028}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|1269777532|ECON 1269777532}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
|result = <small>([[Wikipedia:Non-admin closure|non-admin closure]])</small> Semi-involved closure, this RFC has been open for 9 days, and in that time the consensus has become clear that "Capital accumulation" and "Wealth accumulation" are the same general topic, and used interchangeably. All editors who came to comment from the RFC are in agreement on this, {{u|Avatar317}} maintains they are separate topics. Complete consensus is in agreement now that the terms "capital accumulation" and "wealth accumulation" can be used interchangeability for individual or societal capital. [[User:Des Vallee|Des Vallee]] ([[User talk:Des Vallee|talk]]) 05:58, 13 January 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Capital accumulation#rfc_6AE5A29|Talk:Capital accumulation]] expired 2025-01-16 23:01 ===
* Id: 6AE5A29
* User: Des Vallee
* Date: 2025-01-13 05:58:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|1269884593|ECON 1269884593}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|1269893102|ECON 1269893102}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
|result = <small>([[Wikipedia:Non-admin closure|non-admin closure]])</small> Semi-involved closure, this RFC has been open for 9 days, and in that time the consensus has become clear that "Capital accumulation" and "Wealth accumulation" are the same general topic, and used interchangeably. All editors who came to comment from the RFC are in agreement on this, {{u|Avatar317}} maintains they are separate topics. Complete consensus is in agreement now that the terms "capital accumulation" and "wealth accumulation" can be used interchangeability for individual or societal capital. [[User:Des Vallee|Des Vallee]] ([[User talk:Des Vallee|talk]]) 05:58, 13 January 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Elon Musk#rfc_2AA1862|Talk:Elon Musk]] expired 2025-01-25 09:01 ===
* Id: 2AA1862
* User: Firecat93
* Date: 2024-12-26 08:33:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1265316780|BIO 1265316780}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1271710381|BIO 1271710381}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Musk is the wealthiest person in the world. He has been described as an oligarch by prominent commentators, academics, and experts. 

Should a variant of the following sentence be included in the lead?

''Due to his considerable influence over American government policy, politics, media, industry, and public discourse, some academics and politicians have characterized Musk as an American oligarch.[https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/paul-krugman-elon-musk-sam-bankman-fried-oligarchs-twitter-ftx-2022-12][https://www.barrons.com/news/twitter-names-elon-musk-to-board-further-lifting-shares-01649176807][https://thehill.com/homenews/campaign/4960488-fiona-hill-musk-trump-profits-power/][https://www.barrons.com/news/twitter-names-elon-musk-to-board-further-lifting-shares-01649176807][https://www.theatlantic.com/technology/archive/2024/12/elon-musk-x-congress-shutown/681120/][https://slate.com/business/2024/11/donald-trump-election-elon-musk-bill-gates-american-oligarcy-wealthy-donors-politics.html][https://www.newsweek.com/bernie-sanders-issues-oligarchy-warning-about-elon-musk-2004263]''

Does this addition have any support? Are there any other suggestions? (Some editors have argued that Musk should directly be referred to as an oligarch in the lead. I now agree with those that oppose doing so per [[WP:UNDUE]].)
[[User:Firecat93|Firecat93]] ([[User talk:Firecat93|talk]]) 08:33, 26 December 2024 (UTC)}}

hey so this shouldn't even be an RfC, sorry for wasting your time, but I've been arguing with this one editor, so if you're not busy, well this editor wants "'''Jackson's legacy is controversial. And I'm just confused because no other politician, no other president of the United States of America or any other country has public opinion of them on the very first paragraph of their article. Yeah he was racist, most early presidents were, he lived hundreds of years ago lol. George Washington was a slave owner, gonna mention he was racist in the first paragraph of his article? No. Some argue he's more controversial so that's why his page is like that. Hitler is controversial. {{rfcquote|text=
The opening to the [[Abdel Fattah el-Sisi]] article read: 

'''Abdel Fattah Saeed Hussein Khalil El-Sisi'''{{Efn|{{langx|ar|ÿπÿ®ÿØ ÿßŸÑŸÅÿ™ÿßÿ≠ ÿ≥ÿπŸäÿØ ÿ≠ÿ≥ŸäŸÜ ÿÆŸÑŸäŸÑ ÿßŸÑÿ≥Ÿäÿ≥Ÿä}}}} (born 19 November 1954) is an Egyptian politician, [[dictator]],<ref name="dictator">
Sources that categorize Sisi as a dictator:
{{bulleted list|{{Cite news |title=Egypt‚Äôs rushed election shows Abdel-Fattah al-Sisi is nervous |url=https://www.economist.com/middle-east-and-africa/2023/10/03/egypts-rushed-election-shows-abdel-fattah-al-sisi-is-nervous |access-date=2024-12-27 |work=The Economist |issn=0013-0613 |quote="Last month Abdel-Fattah al-Sisi, Egypt‚Äôs military dictator..."}}|{{Cite web |last=Dunne |first=Michele |date=2019-04-08 |title=Why Is Trump Helping Egypt‚Äôs Dictator Entrench His Power? |url=https://www.politico.com/magazine/story/2019/04/08/donald-trump-abdel-fattah-al-sisi-egypt-226579/ |access-date=2024-12-27 |website=POLITICO Magazine |language=en}}
|{{Cite web |title=President Trump, Condemn This Sham Egyptian Election {{!}} The Washington Institute |url=https://www.washingtoninstitute.org/policy-analysis/president-trump-condemn-sham-egyptian-election |access-date=2024-12-27 |website=www.washingtoninstitute.org |language=en |quote="...issued a statement praising the Egyptian dictator's magnificent work for the country"}}
|{{Cite news |title=A Blank Check for Egypt's Dictator |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2014-06-26/u-dot-s-dot-gives-egypts-dictator-a-blank-check?embedded-checkout=false |access-date=2024-12-27 |work=Bloomberg.com |language=en}}
|{{Cite web |last=Toosi |first=Nahal |date=2021-07-12 |title=In D.C. visit, Egypt spy boss claims U.S. agreed ‚Äî in writing ‚Äî to jail American activist |url=https://www.politico.com/news/2021/07/12/egypt-spy-boss-jail-american-498983 |access-date=2024-12-27 |website=POLITICO |language=en |quote="...Abdel Fattah El-Sisi, the Egyptian dictator who has imprisoned tens of thousands of dissidents."}}{{Cite web |last=Lawler |first=Dave |date=2019-04-23 |title=Egypt's President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi could rule until 2030 after winning referendum |url=https://www.axios.com/2019/04/23/sisi-referendum-rule-egypt-2030-constitution |access-date=2024-12-27 |website=Axios |language=en |quote="He has now cemented his status as Egypt's dictator without losing his position as a U.S. ally."}}
|{{Cite web |last=Greenwald |first=Glenn |date=2015-03-31 |title=Obama Personally Tells the Egyptian Dictator That U.S. Will Again Send Weapons (and Cash) to His Regime |url=https://theintercept.com/2015/03/31/obama-lifts-freeze-weapons-transfer-egyptian-dictator/ |access-date=2024-12-27 |website=The Intercept |language=en-US}}
|{{Cite web |last=Williams |first=Jennifer |date=2017-04-03 |title=Egypt‚Äôs president is a bloodthirsty dictator. Trump thinks he‚Äôs done a ‚Äúfantastic job.‚Äù |url=https://www.vox.com/world/2017/4/3/15160358/trump-egypt-abdel-fattah-el-sisi-white-house |access-date=2024-12-27 |website=Vox |language=en-US}}|{{Cite news |date=2020-12-01 |title=Egypt President Abdul Fattah al-Sisi: Ruler with an iron grip |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-19256730 |access-date=2024-11-22 |work=BBC News |language=en-GB}}|{{Cite news |title=Egypt is again under military rule, but Sisi lacks Nasser's appeal |url=https://www.economist.com/special-report/2021/08/24/egypt-is-again-under-military-rule-but-sisi-lacks-nassers-appeal |access-date=2024-11-25 |url-access=subscription|work=The Economist |issn=0013-0613|archive-url=https://archive.today/2021.08.26-144020/https://www.economist.com/special-report/2021/08/24/egypt-is-again-under-military-rule-but-sisi-lacks-nassers-appeal|archive-date=2021-08-26|url-status=live}}|{{Citation |last=Grewal |first=Sharan |title=Egypt: A Coup against Democracy |date=2023-07-25 |work=Soldiers of Democracy? |pages=136‚Äì176 |url=https://academic.oup.com/book/46755/chapter-abstract/414394851?redirectedFrom=fulltext |access-date=2024-11-25 |publisher=Oxford University PressOxford |doi=10.1093/oso/9780192873910.003.0007 |isbn=0-19-287391-1}}|{{Cite web |date=2024-03-15 |title=EU Deal with Egypt Rewards Authoritarianism, Betrays 'EU Values' {{!}} Human Rights Watch |url=https://www.hrw.org/news/2024/03/15/eu-deal-egypt-rewards-authoritarianism-betrays-eu-values |access-date=2024-12-14 |language=en}}}}</ref> and retired military officer who has been serving as the [[List of presidents of Egypt|sixth]] and current [[president of Egypt]] since 2014.<ref name=":5">{{Cite web |date=2024-03-15 |title=EU Deal with Egypt Rewards Authoritarianism, Betrays 'EU Values' {{!}} Human Rights Watch |url=https://www.hrw.org/news/2024/03/15/eu-deal-egypt-rewards-authoritarianism-betrays-eu-values |access-date=2024-12-14 |language=en}}</ref>

(The word dictator been been removed for now while the RfC discussion takes place)

Should Sisi be referred to as a dictator? Some of these options are not mutually exclusive, so more than one can be selected:
*'''A.''' Yes he should be, in a similar way as described above or found in the the leads of [[Teodoro Obiang Nguema Mbasogo]], [[Kim Jong Un]], [[Hafez al Assad]], [[Pinochet]]
*'''B.''' No he should not be, but he should be described as an authoritarian ruler, leader of an authoritarian regime, or leader of a military dictatorship somewhere in the lead, similar to the leads of [[Zine El Abidine Ben Ali]], [[Mohammed bin Salman]], [[Ilham Aliyev]], [[Isaias Afwerki]]
*'''C.''' No he should not be, but some variation of "Many observers see Sisi as a dictator" should be included in the lead.
*'''D. ''' No he should not be, and he should '''not''' be described as an authoritarian ruler. Instead, different arguments regarding his form of rule should be summarized in the body.
*'''E.''' Other (please elaborate)
[[User:Firecat93|Firecat93]] ([[User talk:Firecat93|talk]]) 16:55, 27 December 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Kshatriya#rfc_4A05208|Talk:Kshatriya]] expired 2025-01-26 19:01 ===
* Id: 4A05208
* User: Dympies#top
* Date: 2024-12-27 18:45:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1265603427|SOC 1265603427}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1272006219|SOC 1272006219}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Following content was added  by me in [[Kshatriya#Modern era]] in recent past[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Kshatriya&diff=prev&oldid=1257092371], should this statement be restored : 
*{{tq|Though many communities claimed Kshatriya status,<ref>{{cite book|title=Dalits, Subalternity and Social Change in India|url=https://books.google.co.in/books?id=dHd0DwAAQBAJ&pg=PT22&dq=Many+communities+claimed+kshatriya+status|publisher=Routledge|quote=By the 1990s, [[:Other Backward Class|OBCs]] in North India had acquired education, government jobs, land and economic resources and political power that edged them towards "sanskritization". Many of them started claiming Kshatriya status and looked for a social and religious identity closer to that of the upper caste Hindus.|editor=Ashok K. Pankaj, Ajit K. Pandey|year=2018}}</ref> the [[Rajput]]s were most successful in attaining it.<ref>
*{{cite web|website=Britannica encyclopaedia|quote=In different parts of India, certain caste groups have sought respectability within the varna system by claiming membership in a particular varna. Typical and most successful was the claim of the Rajputs that they were the Kshatriyas, or nobles, of the second varna|title=Jati|url=https://www.britannica.com/topic/jati-Hindu-caste|access-date=6 November 2024}}
*{{cite book|page=133|title=Hindutva and Singapore Confucianism as Projects of Political Legitimation|author=Amod Jayant Lele|publisher=Cornell University Press |year=2001 |url=https://books.google.co.in/books?newbks=1&newbks_redir=0&id=zpJOAAAAYAAJ&dq=Many+jatis+have+tried+to+claim+Kshatriya+status&focus=searchwithinvolume&q=Varying|quote=Many jatis have tried to claim Kshatriya status, with varying degrees of success, the most successful being the Rajputs.}}
*{{cite journal|title=Women, Violence, Sovereignty:‚ÄúRakshasa‚Äù Marriage by Capture in Modern Indian Political Thought|author=Luna Sabastian|journal=Modern Intellectual History|year=2022|url=https://www.cambridge.org/core/journals/modern-intellectual-history/article/women-violence-sovereignty-rakshasa-marriage-by-capture-in-modern-indian-political-thought/294BE31A36548DB69E13BD9FF9C31815|publisher=Cambridge University Press|page=769|doi=10.1017/S1479244321000391|quote=It was duly observed among the Rajputs, India‚Äôs most successful claimants to Kshatriya status in the present age, to the point where ‚ÄúRajput‚Äù even came to appropriate the meaning and assimilative function of ‚ÄúKshatriya.‚Äù}}
*{{cite book | last=Mayer | first=A. | title=Caste and Kinship in Central India: A Village and its Region | publisher=University of California Press | year=2023 | isbn=978-0-520-31349-1 | url=https://books.google.co.in/books?id=bMPLEAAAQBAJ | access-date=2024-11-07 |quote=The Rajputs, of course, are the prime Kshatriya caste. Some maintain that they are descendants of the only people who did not deny their true Kshatriya status and managed to escape from Parasurama; others say that they changed their name to Rajput to deceive Parasurama, but alone of the Kshatriyas kept on with their martial occupation. They appear in any case to have the strongest claim to Kshatriya status.|page=63}}
*{{cite book|title=Recasting Caste: From the Sacred to the Profane|author=Hira Singh|quote=One, the decline of the Vaishyas and two, the emergence of the Rajputs, originally a diverse group who successfully claimed the Kshatriya identity, with the compliance of the Brahmans in return for land grants and other material gains.|publisher=SAGE Publications|page=108|year=2014|isbn=8132119800|url=https://books.google.co.in/books?id=ZPinAwAAQBAJ&pg=PA108&dq=Rajputs+successfully+Kshatriya}}
*{{cite book|title=Encyclopedia of the World's Minorities|url=https://books.google.co.in/books?id=yXYKAgAAQBAJ&pg=PA600&dq=Encyclopedia+of+the+World%27s+Minorities+the+Rajputs+of+Rajasthan+were+a+major+force+in |editor=Carl Skutsch| publisher=Routledge |year=2013 |quote=During this time, the Rajputs of Rajasthan were a major force in medieval Indian society and politics. Their origin are not known, but it is thought that they came from abroad. In either case they acquired lunar and solar connections and kshatriya status.|isbn=1135193959 |page=600}}
*{{cite book|title=The First Spring: The Golden Age of India|isbn=8184755694|publisher=Penguin UK|year=2011|author=Abraham Eraly|quote=Numerous ruling families all over the subcontinent were thus invested with the Kshatriya status over the centuries. In North India, many of the migrants and tribesmen who became Kshatriyas by this process came to be known as Rajputs, a people entirely unknown before the sixth century CE, but who, by the early medieval times, came to be regarded as the very epitome of the Kshatriya varna. These people were evidently metamorphosed as Kshatriyas by Brahminical rites.|url=https://books.google.co.in/books?id=5JnBfFVb2XIC&pg=PT486&dq=These+people+were+evidently+metamorphosed+as+Kshatriyas+by+Brahminical+rites}}
*{{cite book|title=A Global History of Pre-Modern Warfare: Before the Rise of the West, 10,000 BCE‚Äì1500 CE|author=Kaushik Roy|publisher=Routledge|year=2021|isbn=1000432122|url=https://books.google.co.in/books?id=yE85EAAAQBAJ&pg=PT13&dq=Rajputs+acquired+the+kshatriya+status|quote=Rajput- Originally known as thakurs, who were high caste landowners and became the hereditary warrior community. They acquired Kshatriya status (second highest caste in the fourfold Hindu hierarchical varna system).}}</ref>
}}

=== [[Talk:Imelda Marcos#rfc_1262963|Talk:Imelda Marcos]] expired 2025-01-26 21:01 ===
* Id: 1262963
* User: TDKR Chicago 101
* Date: 2024-12-27 20:28:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1266507217|BIO 1266507217}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1266785928|MEDIA 1266785928}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1272026987|BIO 1272026987}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1272026994|MEDIA 1272026994}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
It's been three years since the [[Talk:Imelda Marcos/Archive 4#Photo|last discussion was held]] in regards to the infobox image. As I believed so back then, the current image (which was reached by consensus albeit) is unflattering and as one user noted above, it's a bit creepy. I created a [[:File:Imelda Romualdez Marcos 2 (cropped).jpg|cropped close up]] so you can see what I'm talking about. Her eyes are half-open, quality isn't the best and if this is truly the 'best' picture that captures what she's known for (as stated in the last discussion three years ago in terms of her outfits), then perhaps it's best to asses an infobox image based on quality over what she's 'known' for. If this is the best picture that shows her during her 'comeback' (as stated in last discussion), then once again, I must emphasize the quality of the picture (awkward lighting, unflattering eye pose, not the best in quality). These are the current images at commons that are best suited for an infobox image. As noted in other talk page discussions, when the subject of an article passes away, their infobox image is also replaced with a black and white picture ''or'' of one that captures them in their 'prime' so to speak. Although (as of now) Marcos is still alive, I feel that Option B is in better quality than the current picture, shows her as her time as First Lady (much like other first lady articles) and will depict her in her prime when she passes away (not a huge factor now, but worth thinking about). Pinging previous contributors to the discussion three years ago for good measure: {{ping|Chieharumachi}}, {{ping|Crisantom}}, {{ping|Object404}}, {{ping|Unilimited247}}, {{ping|Lochglasgowstrathyre}} [[User:TDKR Chicago 101|TDKR Chicago 101]] ([[User talk:TDKR Chicago 101|talk]]) 20:28, 27 December 2024 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Verifiability/SPS RfC#rfc_0D5B171|Wikipedia talk:Verifiability/SPS RfC]] expired 2025-01-26 23:01 ===

This RfC is to determine the consensus about (1) whether the current explanation of "self-published" in [[WP:SPS]] generally serves us well, perhaps with small improvements, or if it should be revised in some significant way, and (2) how editors interpret "self-published," in order to help us revise the explanation if needed.

=== [[Talk:Sinfest#rfc_B627BD1|Talk:Sinfest]] expired 2025-01-28 07:01 ===
* Id: B627BD1
* Date: 2025-01-27 22:29:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1272355670|MEDIA 1272355670}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1272355673|POL 1272355673}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1272355676|POLICY 1272355676}}
* RFC Text:

Imagine a Wiki article on a previously well known restaurant. The article can cite reliable sources in the culinary media about the restaurant and its Chef Owner and the food as it enjoyed a period of time in the spotlight. Like many restaurants, that time long since elapsed but the positive coverage can still be located in the archives of reliable sources.

Then, some time after that initial coverage faded, the chef/owner took a strange turn. He started crafting and serving food that nearly every diner considers vile. In fact, he crafts it out of human waste and now cultivates a much smaller clientele of people who enjoy consuming human waste. The restaurant that garnered positive press arguably no longer exists.

But we have a problem. Since the reliable media no longer covers this restaurant, there are no reliable sources that can be used to update the Wikipedia article. A few food bloggers have commented but despite their popularity and reputation among diners, they do not meet Wikipedia's reliability standards. The obvious answer is to delete the article as it is now entirely an inaccurate portrayal of the restaurant. But now the policy about deletion slams down and says no because the restaurant was once notable. So the article stays.

And the closed loop of Wikipedia policies leaves an an absurd situation completely unresolvable. Wikipedia is hosting an article that is hopelessly outdated and completely inaccurate. A diner seeking out a reservation is in for a horrendous experience, but Wikipedia can do nothing about this because these policies in tandem REQUIRE the encyclopedia to host an inaccurate article.

That's the situation with Sinfest. I don't dispute that the interpretations of policy is accurate, but the resulting situation is absurd and leaves an ENCYCLOPEDIA hosting an article that is at best incomplete and at worse completely inaccurate with no recourse. This is a perfect test case for the need to change this platform to keep up with the rapidly shifting nature of attention in today's media economy.  
:In my mind, if the article cannot be updated to reflect the current status of what it is describing due to a lack of reliable sources describing precisely how it has drastically changed, then allowing the article to remain up does the average reader a disservice and it could be argued that the article's subject is no longer noteworthy enough to merit inclusion in Wikipedia. It is better to have no article than a woefully outdated, misleading one. Contrary to what others have said, things are not necessarily permanently notable, particularly given the ephemeral nature of the internet.--[[User:Rosicrucian|Rosicrucian]][[User Talk:Rosicrucian|<sup>Talk</sup>]] 22:29, 27 January 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Sinfest#rfc_E3F50C8|Talk:Sinfest]] expired 2025-01-28 08:01 ===
* Id: E3F50C8
* User: Le Blue Dude
* Date: 2025-01-28 06:23:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Sinfest the comic is unambiguously anti-Semitic. This is a neutral and true fact. Sinfest the article makes no mention of this fact. There is a dearth of reliable media mentioning this fact. The article has become severely misleading as a result. How to fix? [[User:Le Blue Dude|Le Blue Dude]] ([[User talk:Le Blue Dude|talk]]) 06:23, 28 January 2025 (UTC)}}

{{rfcquote|text=
How should [[WP:WikiVoice|Wikipedia's voice]] describe the current for-profit/non-profit status of Grand Canyon University?
*'''Option 1''': Do not describe GCU as presently "for-profit" or "non-profit" in Wikipedia's voice (such as in [[Special:Permalink/1266013357|this revision]]); or
*'''Option 2''': Describe GCU in [[WP:WikiVoice|Wikipedia's voice]] as presently a "for-profit" institution (such as in [[Special:Permalink/1265490784|this revision]]);
*'''Option 3''': Describe GCU in Wikipedia's voice as presently a "non-profit" institution.

=== [[Talk:List of artists using bees#rfc_E313389|Talk:List of artists using bees]] expired 2025-01-29 21:01 ===
* Id: E313389
* User: Artgraduatez
* Date: 2025-01-29 17:00:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1272636291|POLICY 1272636291}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1272688073|POLICY 1272688073}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
 

üìå ''Hello, fellow editors,''  

I have recently improved this article by adding ''reliable sources, correcting formatting issues, and ensuring compliance with Wikipedia's guidelines'' (''[[WP:RS]]'', ''[[WP:NPOV]]'', ''[[WP:V]]'').  

I would appreciate input on the following:  
- ''Notability'' ‚Äì Does the article meet Wikipedia‚Äôs inclusion standards?  
- ''Sources'' ‚Äì Are the references strong and independent?  
- ''Neutrality & Formatting'' ‚Äì Any areas needing improvement?  

Thank you for your time and expertise! üôÇ  
''‚Äì [[User:Artgraduatez|Artgraduatez]] ([[User talk:Artgraduatez|talk]]) 17:00, 29 January 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_5DC5768|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2025-01-30 20:01 ===
* Id: 5DC5768
* User: Nederlandse Leeuw#top
* Date: 2025-01-02 23:38:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1270469503|BIO 1270469503}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1270469506|HIST 1270469506}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1273366279|BIO 1273366279}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1273366285|HIST 1273366285}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The following genealogy sources are currently considered [[Wikipedia:GUNREL|Generally unreliable]] at [[WP:RSP]] (A), or in repeated inquiries at [[WP:RSN]] (B and C):
* '''A: Geni.com'''
* '''B: Medieval Lands / MedLands by Charles Cawley'''
* '''C: genealogy.eu / genealogy.euweb.cz by Marek Miroslav'''
:Long after being listed / labelled generally unreliable, these unreliable sources are still being (re-)added to hundreds to tens of thousands of articles. 
:They should be:
* '''Option 1: listed as [[Wikipedia:GUNREL|Generally unreliable]]''' (change nothing to A; add B and C at [[WP:RSP]] as such)
* '''Option 2: [[Wikipedia:DEPREC|Deprecated]]''' (list them as such at [[WP:RSP]])
* '''Option 3: [[Wikipedia:SPB|Blacklisted]]''' (not mutually exclusive with option 1 or 2)
[[User:Nederlandse Leeuw|NLeeuw]] ([[User talk:Nederlandse Leeuw#top|talk]]) 23:38, 2 January 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Human#rfc_F09B8FB|Talk:Human]] expired 2025-01-31 02:01 ===
* Id: F09B8FB
* User: Interstellarity
* Date: 2025-01-30 21:50:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1272925557|SCI 1272925557}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1272965433|SCI 1272965433}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I would like to initiate an RFC on what the lead image should be on the infobox. I expect that a substantial amount of editors will express their support to keep the current image. I intend to support whatever consensus comes out of this discussion. I am opening this RFC to try to settle the debate on the lead image that has lasted for several years now. I am neutral on whether or not we should change the image. There hasn‚Äôt been an RFC for this for a substantial amount of time, but there have been mini discussions on this issue. If other editors want to suggest their own images, they are more than welcome to. My hope is that regardless of whatever the result of this RFC, other editors will abide by the consensus and that if the issue comes up again, unless something substantial happens to humanity, which is unlikely, that this consensus holds for least a decade or more. [[User:Interstellarity|Interstellarity]] ([[User talk:Interstellarity|talk]]) 21:50, 30 January 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Australia's Funniest Home Videos#rfc_2BACCF7|Talk:Australia's Funniest Home Videos]] expired 2025-02-01 06:01 ===
* Id: 2BACCF7
* Date: 2025-01-02 05:42:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1266785928|MEDIA 1266785928}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1273192705|MEDIA 1273192705}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I would like to start a [[WP:RFC|request for comment]] on the usage of a "closing songs" table in this article.

I originally [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Australia%27s_Funniest_Home_Videos&diff=prev&oldid=1266133774 removed the table] on 30 December for several reasons, which I will go into detail about below. It was then [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Australia%27s_Funniest_Home_Videos&diff=prev&oldid=1266555690 reinstated] on 1 January by who I believe is a sockpuppet of a long-term vandal on Wikipedia (I go into more detail about this vandal below). I then [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Australia%27s_Funniest_Home_Videos&diff=next&oldid=1266555745 removed it again], mostly because of the Wikipedia guideline that states that [[WP:BANREVERT|edits from banned and blocked users can be reverted for any reason]], but also because the IP user failed to give a reason why it should be kept. It was then reinstated today on 2 January by user {{user|NickHrvo}}. 

In order to not prolong an edit war and to prevent any violations of our [[Wikipedia:3RR|three revert rule]], I have decided to start this RfC. 

There are a few reasons as to why I believe this table should be removed:
* It is largely unsourced, and likely to not be sourced in the future, due to the nature of the table. In particular, any sources would likely be the show itself. The show itself is a [[WP:PRIMARY|primary source]], which are largely discouraged from use on Wikipedia.
* The unsourced nature of the table serves as an opening for [[WP:HOAX|hoaxes]] and [[WP:Vandalism|vandalism]]. In particular, this table is frequently edited by the [[WP:LTA/TFD|Teenage Fairytale Dropouts vandal]], who is a long-term vandal of Wikipedia. They add songs to this table that are either hoaxes or difficult to verify.
* It is overly detailed and contains information likely to only be relevant to fans of this show. On Wikipedia, this information is called [[WP:FANCRUFT|fancruft]]. A list of "closing songs" is simply unnecessary for the purpose of Wikipedia, which is to provide general information about many topics (including this show).

I will notify a few WikiProjects, along with NickHrvo, about this discussion so that they can participate if they so wish, and especially so NickHrvo can provide why he believes the table should be kept. [[:User:Wizzito|<span class="tmpl-colored-link {{#if:|mw-no-invert|}}" style="color: hotpink; text-decoration: inherit;">wizzito</span>]] &#124; [[:User talk:Wizzito|<span class="tmpl-colored-link {{#if:|mw-no-invert|}}" style="color: navyc; text-decoration: inherit;">say hello!</span>]] 05:42, 2 January 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of military engagements during the Israel‚ÄìHamas war#rfc_94896CB|Talk:List of military engagements during the Israel‚ÄìHamas war]] expired 2025-02-01 18:01 ===
* Id: 94896CB
* User: WeatherWriter
* Date: 2025-01-02 17:45:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1266888289|HIST 1266888289}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1266888294|RELI 1266888294}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1266888298|SOC 1266888298}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1273301229|HIST 1273301229}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1273301234|RELI 1273301234}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1273301240|SOC 1273301240}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There have been several discussions opened in the past regarding this article's content and overall scope. Several wars have a list of military engagements and battles. Examples include: [[List of military engagements of World War I|World War I ("Military engagements")]], [[List of World War II battles|World War II ("Battles")]], [[List of military engagements during the Russian invasion of Ukraine|Russian invasion of Ukraine ("Military engagements")]], [[List of engagements during the Sudanese civil war (2023‚Äìpresent)|Sudanese civil war ("Engagements")]].

The [[Israel‚ÄìHamas war]] is no different with this article. However, unlike all the other list of military engagement articles, this article has a ton of clean-up templates including lack of sourcing, MOS, and scope issues.

So, with all that background, let's have a discussion on what the '''''scope''''' of this article should include, or more specifically, '''what is a "[[Engagement (military)|military engagement]]" during the Israel-Hamas war?''' Are ''"Battle of ...."'' engagements? Are airstrikes engagements? Should the article's scope be redefined away from "military engagements" to just "engagements"? Ect... '''The [[User:WeatherWriter|Weather Event Writer]]''' ([[User talk:WeatherWriter|Talk Page)]] 17:45, 2 January 2025 (UTC)}}

{{rfcquote|text=
Should [[MOS:CENTURY]] specify the start of a century or millennium as a year ending in 1 (e.g. the 20th century as 1901‚Äì2000), as a year ending in 0 (e.g. the 20th century as 1900‚Äì1999), or treat both as acceptable options with the use of hatnotes for clarity in the case of ambiguity in articles? === [[Talk:Yom Kippur War#rfc_8B361D1|Talk:Yom Kippur War]] expired 2025-02-03 23:01 ===
* Id: 8B361D1
* Date: 2025-01-04 23:01:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1267407808|HIST 1267407808}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1267407815|POL 1267407815}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1273768069|HIST 1273768069}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1273768072|POL 1273768072}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the Yom Kippur War be characterized in any of the following ways in the infobox [[WP:RESULT]]:
# Do not characterize the war in the infobox, but write "See aftermath."
# Israeli victory
# Stalemate
# Egyptian victory

=== [[Talk:October 7 Hamas-led attack on Israel#rfc_B68F86B|Talk:October 7 Hamas-led attack on Israel]] expired 2025-02-04 12:01 ===
* Id: B68F86B
* Date: 2025-01-05 11:33:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1267507204|HIST 1267507204}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1273889300|HIST 1273889300}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
'''Question'''. Should this article include allegations of sexual violence and torture that were documented in the broader conflict after the Hamas-led incursion?
*'''A'''. '''No''' - These should be covered in parent articles (e.g., [[Israel-Hamas war]]) and in dedicated articles (e.g., [[Sexual and gender-based violence against Palestinians during the Israel‚ÄìHamas war]])
*'''B'''. '''Yes, in aftermath''' - Include them in a brief Aftermath section (the current {{alink|Israeli counterattack}} section or a new one) with links to more detailed coverage in other articles. 
*'''C'''. '''Yes, in main content''', either: '''1. as in current version''' (see {{alink||Reported atrocities}}), or '''2. elsewhere''' (please specify).
[[User:Alaexis|Alaexis]]<sub>[[User_talk:Alaexis|¬øquestion?]]</sub> 11:33, 5 January 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_A7D406B|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2025-02-04 19:01 ===
* Id: A7D406B
* User: 3family6
* Date: 2025-02-04 15:13:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1273923770|MEDIA 1273923770}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1273951717|MEDIA 1273951717}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
[[Encyclopaedia Metallum]]: The Metal Archives is user-generated content. There is long-standing consensus [[Talk:Encyclopaedia_Metallum#Source|since 2007]], and [[Wikipedia_talk:WikiProject_Albums/Archive_52#Genres_and_User-Contributed_Sources|affirmed in 2015]], that Encyclopaedia Metallum/Metal Archives is thus unreliable. It nonetheless constantly gets added as a source, including for highly contentions BLP statements (such as [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=National_Socialist_black_metal&diff=1273705189&oldid=1262848697 this edit] to - redundantly - verify a band playing [[National Socialist black metal]]). It is sometimes used as an external link, which generally, as far as I understand, possibly acceptable, although other databases - Spirit of Metal, [[Discogs]], etc. - often contain similar information. Also, if you run a search for uses of the site, it also is listed on numerous album cover images as the source for fair use. That is incorrect copyright attribution and technically a copyright violation (the original publisher or media itself should be listed). Essentially, nearly every single instance of this source across thousands of pages is in violation of either consensus against user-generated content or else technically commits a copy-right violation. I've tried to clean this up on some articles, but there's thousands. Over at the spam blacklist proposals page, one editor said that that venue isn't sufficient to blacklist a source used on that many pages, while another editor pointed out the copyright violation issue and said that would be a reason for blacklisting. I'm hoping a stronger consensus can emerge here as to whether or not the source should be deprecated, or even blacklisted.--[[User:3family6|3family6]] ([[User talk:3family6|Talk to me]]<nowiki>|</nowiki>[[Special:Contributions/3family6|See what I have done]]) 15:13, 4 February 2025 (UTC)}}

to 

<u>The Huddersfield child sex abuse ring was a group of British Asian men's mostly from [[British Pakistanis|Pakistani heritage]], who were convicted of sexual offences against girls in Huddersfield, West Yorkshire, United Kingdom. </u>


https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-england-45918845
https://www.business-standard.com/article/news-ians/uk-court-jails-20-men-mostly-pakistanis-for-sexual-abuse-of-teenage-girls-118102000080_1.html

=== [[Talk:Joe Biden#rfc_8E993C6|Talk:Joe Biden]] expired 2025-02-10 14:01 ===
* Id: 8E993C6
* User: WikiFouf
* Date: 2025-01-11 13:58:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1268777031|BIO 1268777031}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1268777033|HIST 1268777033}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1268777039|POL 1268777039}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1274995608|BIO 1274995608}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1274995612|HIST 1274995612}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1274995616|POL 1274995616}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The current single sentence on Gaza in the lede is as follows: {{green|During the Israel‚ÄìHamas war, Biden condemned the actions of Hamas as terrorism and sent military aid to Israel, as well as humanitarian aid to the Gaza Strip.}} The sentence is regularly modified, including the word "limited" which keeps being added/removed in front of "humanitarian aid". I started [[Talk:Joe Biden/Archive 19#"Announced military support for Israel" in the lede|a discussion]] on this topic a while ago; it didn't get a lot of input and didn't lead to a consensus. I thought this RfC could generate a larger discussion and settle a few related questions at once:
* Should the "military aid" and "humanitarian aid" be mentioned side by side as is?
* Should we mention that the amount of military aid sent to Israel is [https://apnews.com/article/israel-hamas-war-us-military-spending-8e6e5033f7a1334bf6e35f86e7040e14 a historical record]?
* Next to the mention of military aid, should there be a mention of allegations of war crimes against Israel?
Feel free to expand the discussion to other questions. My hope is that we can workshop a sentence that has a consensus behind it. Thanks! [[User:WikiFouf|WikiFouf]] ([[User talk:WikiFouf|talk]]) 13:58, 11 January 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Salome Zourabichvili#rfc_97A22A5|Talk:Salome Zourabichvili]] expired 2025-02-12 12:01 ===
* Id: 97A22A5
* User: Tahomaru
* Date: 2025-02-11 14:15:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1275180114|POLICY 1275180114}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1276825127|POLICY 1276825127}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Disputed revision [[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Salome_Zourabichvili&diff=prev&oldid=1275148115]]

I edited the article today because the description of Salome Zourabichvili as the incumbent president is '''misleading'''. Although there is no doubt that Georgia is mired in a [[2024‚Äì2025 Georgian constitutional crisis|political crisis]], there is no consensus that this crisis is "constitutional" (see [[Talk:2024‚Äì2025 Georgian constitutional crisis#Requested move 5 January 2025]]). Although, Zourabichvili refused to accept the official outcome of the parliamentary elections and the subsequent appointment of her successor, she voluntarily vacated the presidential palace on 29 December 2024. In doing so, she acknowledged that, according to both the constitutional provisions and the established practices of Georgian institutions, '''her term had ended'''. (Had she remained in the palace, it would have sparked a genuine constitutional crisis.) 

[[Mikheil Kavelashvili]], elected on 14 December and inaugurated on 29 December 2024 is the recognised head of state by '''all formal Georgian institutions'''. To claim otherwise is POV. Even though Zourabichvili herself, many opposition figures, some Western countries, and parts of civil society continue to contest his legitimacy, from a constitutional standpoint the dispute is '''purely political''' and reflects differences of opinion over the electoral process rather than an actual constitutional impasse.

To put this into perspective, if every allegation of electoral fraud were to trigger a "constitutional crisis", then virtually every country (especially those with authoritarian tendencies where disputes over election results are common) would be per this article standard in a perpetual state of constitutional crisis/disputes. Constitutional law requires a separation between legal procedure and political disagreement and the distinction between political and constitutional dispute must be clear. In Georgia's case, the constitutional framework itself clearly stipulates that the president is elected indirectly. The election [[2024 Georgian presidential election|was held]] and was '''not challenged by the Constitutional Court'''. 

In conclusion; The characterisation of this dispute as constitutional rather than political misrepresents the state of affairs in Georgia, where, despite political contestation, the constitutional procedures have been followed, and all institutions now formally recognise a new president. While Zourabichvili and her supporters continue to maintain an alternative narrative, according to the Georgian Constitution and the formal decisions of Georgian institutions, she neither de jure nor de facto holds the presidency.

I therefore propose to keep my revision, which clearly states that Zourabichvili's mandate has ended, with an added note explaining the context (the political dispute and the crisis in Georgia). 

(By the way, this is not the only article about Georgia that is subject to POV dispute.) [[User:Tahomaru|Tahomaru]] ([[User talk:Tahomaru|talk]]) 14:15, 11 February 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_DDBB150|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2025-02-12 21:01 ===

These are some of the most read newspaper of the country and I wanted to preemtively ask about the general reliability of the sources.on cases of economical, national and political reporting. This does not cover press releases, syndicated news or editorials. Usage for general information regarding local news is to be gauged here. The sources to rate for are:

# [[The Business Standard]]: [https://www.tbsnews.net/ tbsnews.net/]
# [[The Daily Star (Bangladesh)|The Daily Star]]: [http://thedailystar.net/ thedailystar.net/]
# [[Prothom Alo]]: [http://www.prothomalo.com/ prothomalo.com/] ([https://en.prothomalo.com/ English version], online only)

* '''Option A: [[Wikipedia:GREL|Generally reliable]]'''
* '''Option B: [[Wikipedia:MREL|Additional considerations]]'''
* '''Option C: [[Wikipedia:GUNREL|Generally unreliable]]'''
* '''Option D: [[Wikipedia:DEPREC|Deprecate]]'''

[[User:Greatder|Greatder]] ([[User talk:Greatder|talk]]) 16:19, 26 January 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Changing username#rfc_81EBD38|Wikipedia talk:Changing username]] expired 2025-02-13 04:01 ===
* Id: 81EBD38
* User: DreamRimmer
* Date: 2025-01-14 03:40:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1269327903|POLICY 1269327903}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1275458304|POLICY 1275458304}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
In [[:meta:Talk:Steward requests/Username changes#14-day hold period (for Meta and English Wikipedia)|this]] discussion on Meta-Wiki last month, some renamers suggested closing the English Wikipedia usurpation [[Wikipedia:Changing username/Usurpations|request page]] and directing users to Meta instead. As far as I know, English Wikipedia is the only wiki with its own usurpation page, while all other wikis process such requests on Meta. While requests on Meta are typically handled within hours, those on English Wikipedia often face delays due to a lack of attention from renamers. Given this, should all future usurpation requests be directed to Meta instead? ‚Äì [[User:DreamRimmer|<span style="color:black">'''DreamRimmer'''</span>]] <small>([[User talk:DreamRimmer|'''talk''']])</small> 03:40, 14 January 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Casualties of the Gaza war#rfc_DA61110|Talk:Casualties of the Gaza war]] expired 2025-02-13 05:01 ===
* Id: DA61110
* User: Johnadams11
* Date: 2025-02-11 17:06:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1275260819|POL 1275260819}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1275464662|POL 1275464662}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
See previous discussion [[Talk:Casualties of the Gaza war#Definition of Children|here]], and  [[Talk:Casualties of the Gaza war#A proposal relating to the definition of Children|here]]. Pinging: @[[User:NadVolum|NadVolum]], and ![[User:Lf8u2|Lf8u2]]  

The word ‚Äúchildren,‚Äù has at least two very clear connotations. One, is the biological meaning, which denotes a person who has not reached puberty. The other is the legal definition: commonly an age between 16 and 18.

Presently the article uses the word ‚Äúchildren‚Äù 57 times. So its importance, even criticality, to the article, is plain.

As the article stands now, the word is defined differently by different sources, with some using [https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/cn5wel11pgdo no definition], some using [https://aoav.org.uk/2023/are-the-gazan-casualty-figures-being-reported-reliable-two-conflict-experts-compared-the-numbers-to-previous-attacks-and-conclude-they-are-credible/ under 15], and most using under 18. But this is only part of the issue. 

The larger issue is that it can be reasonably expected that a not uncommon read of the article will include the natural  inference that WP is in fact talking about the biological definition. I also think it reasonable that the absence of any attempt for the article to define this term suggests an imprecision, or even carelessness, not flattering to the article particularly, or to WP more generally.

To avoid this, my own view is that the first reference to ‚Äúchildren‚Äù should include a parenthetical phrase which says something like:  ‚ÄúGenerally defined as under 18.‚Äù  (Explanatory, methodological notes for this article are already prominent in the second paragraph in which GHM methodologies are explained.)

I assume there may be better ideas, and I hope to hear them. [[User:Johnadams11|Johnadams11]] ([[User talk:Johnadams11|talk]]) 17:06, 11 February 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Theory of multiple intelligences#rfc_04C01B3|Talk:Theory of multiple intelligences]] expired 2025-02-14 01:01 ===
* Id: 04C01B3
* User: Pedro Manuel da Silva Faria
* Date: 2025-02-13 23:32:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1275604187|SCI 1275604187}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1275612780|SCI 1275612780}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
 Let's open a Request for Comment and open a discussion around the page of Theory of Multiple Intelligences, which contains a lead paragraph that includes several terms and conclusions that seems deceiving, such as "pseudoscientific"   and "subjective judgement‚Äù and  ‚Äúoverall unscientific and speculative nature", rather than factual descriptions.
The remainder of the articles does not support these kind of evaluations, but still does have an overall negative bias. These evaluations are drawn from critics with lack of sustained references on the theory itself neither shows other empirical research evidence. 
It is our understanding that Wikipedia policy and guidelines require a Neutral Point of View: 
Quote: 
2. Neutral Point of View (NPOV): Maintain a neutral tone throughout the article. Present information objectively without promoting a particular point of view or bias. Ensure that conflicting viewpoints are represented fairly. 
 
Wish to hear the views of all contributors, with or without a particular point of view on this subject, as long as we can make the Wikipedia page more fair, accurate and up to date information. [[User:Pedro Manuel da Silva Faria|Pedro Manuel da Silva Faria]] ([[User talk:Pedro Manuel da Silva Faria|talk]]) 23:32, 13 February 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Template talk:Infobox song#rfc_3DCD2F0|Template talk:Infobox song]] expired 2025-02-14 06:01 ===
* Id: 3DCD2F0
* User: Royiswariii
* Date: 2025-01-25 10:52:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1271724113|MEDIA 1271724113}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1271724116|TECH 1271724116}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1275642788|MEDIA 1275642788}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1275642791|TECH 1275642791}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Hello! I'm requesting for your consensus on whether infoboxes for songs and albums should be customized with background colors that reflect the primary colors of the associated album or single cover. I proposed this because to enhance visual appeal and strengthen the connection between the article design and the featured music branding.

Should we allow the customization of infobox background colors to reflect the color of the album or single cover?

Choices: {{ordered list |list-style-type=upper-alpha
|'''Yes''' ‚Äì Infoboxes for songs and albums should have customizable background colors based on the significant colors of the album or single cover.

|'''No''' ‚Äì Infoboxes for songs and albums should retain their current yellow or blue design without background colors.

|'''Neither''' ‚Äì No strong preference or support for either. Alternatively, propose a different solution or compromise (''need an explanation if '''C''' is the answer.'')
}} <span style="border-radius:7px;background:#800080;padding:4px 6px 4px 6px;color:white;">[[User:Royiswariii|<span style="color:white;">ROY is WAR</span>]]</span> [[User talk:Royiswariii|'''''Talk!''''']] 10:52, 25 January 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_11A50DD|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2025-02-15 17:01 ===
* Id: 11A50DD
* User: Choucas_Bleu
* Date: 2025-01-22 22:55:00

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1271186061|POL 1271186061}}

{{rfcquote|text=
The [https://www.eurasiantimes.com/ EurAsian Times] (used to have its own article but it was apparently PRODed) is cited in several hundreds of articles, mostly pertaining to Russian military hardware and South Asian issues, but not exclusively. It was mentioned [[Wikipedia:Reliable_sources/Noticeboard/Archive_389#EurAsian_Times|a]] [[Wikipedia:Reliable_sources/Noticeboard/Archive_399#The_Eurasian_Times|few]] [[Wikipedia:Reliable_sources/Noticeboard/Archive_458#Eurasian_Times|times]] on this noticeboard but only on a surface level.

In light of all this, how would you rate the EurAsian Times?

* '''Option 1: [[Wikipedia:GREL|Generally reliable]]'''
* '''Option 2: [[Wikipedia:MREL|Additional considerations]]'''
* '''Option 3: [[Wikipedia:GUNREL|Generally unreliable]]'''
* '''Option 4: [[Wikipedia:DEPREC|Deprecate]]'''

Thank you. '''''<span style="color:#503680">[[User:Choucas_Bleu|Choucas]] [[User talk:Choucas_Bleu|Bleu]] [[Special:Contributions/Choucas_Bleu|<span>&#128038;&#8205;&#11035;</span>]]</span>''''' 22:55, 22 January 2025 (UTC)}}

* Id: 0A2BBF0

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The last RfCs on the topic were over two years ago:[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talk:Russian_invasion_of_Ukraine/Archive_4#h-RfC:_Should_the_individual_arms_supplying_countries_be_added_to_the_infobox?-2022-02-27T23:35:00.000Z] [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talk:Russian_invasion_of_Ukraine/Archive_2#h-RfC_-_Should_NATO_be_displayed_in_the_infobox_as_a_support_belligerent_providing-2022-02-27T09:27:00.000Z] [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talk:Russian_invasion_of_Ukraine/Archive_8#c-Slatersteven-2022-04-27T15:59:00.000Z-Mindaur-2022-04-27T15:21:00.000Z]

'''Option A:''' No.

'''Option D:''' Something else. (please explain in the comments) [[User:TurboSuperA+|<span style="color:#9999FF;">'''Turbo'''</span><span style="color:#660066;">'''Super'''</span><span style="color:#CC3300;font-weight:bold;">A+</span>]] ([[User talk:TurboSuperA+|talk]]) 13:52, 17 January 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Declaration of war#rfc_B2386CE|Talk:Declaration of war]] expired 2025-02-16 19:01 ===
* Id: B2386CE
* User: WeatherWriter
* Date: 2025-01-17 18:46:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1270063309|HIST 1270063309}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1276075179|HIST 1276075179}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There has been previous discussions regarding whether the [[Israel‚ÄìHamas war]] & the [[Israeli invasion of Lebanon (2024‚Äìpresent)]] should be included in this article. The main question regarding this is whether or not this article covers only sovereign states (which Hamas & Hezbollah are not), or whether it covers non-sovereign states/political entities/paramilitaries. The lead of the article is vague in this distinction, but does specifically call out {{tq|national government}}. So, should both events be included or excluded?

*'''Option 1''' &ndash; Yes, both events should be included as this article should cover sovereign and non-sovereign state declarations of war.
*'''Option 2''' &ndash; No, both events should be excluded as this article should only cover sovereign state declarations of war and not included political entities/paramilitary-related declarations of war.
*'''Option 3''' &ndash; Include one but not the other (Specify which is included and which is excluded).

'''The [[User:WeatherWriter|Weather Event Writer]]''' ([[User talk:WeatherWriter|Talk Page)]] 18:46, 17 January 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Dilation and evacuation#rfc_1164B6E|Talk:Dilation and evacuation]] expired 2025-02-17 01:01 ===
* Id: 1164B6E
* User: DocZach
* Date: 2025-01-18 00:55:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1270121092|SCI 1270121092}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1276126038|SCI 1276126038}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I am requesting input from other editors regarding the level of detail in the description of the dilation and evacuation procedure in this article. My recent edits to expand this section, which included additional detail and references, were reverted. The current description in the article is as follows:
"Uterine contents are removed using a cannula to apply aspiration, followed by forceps to remove fetal parts."

I proposed revising this section to provide more specific details, including the instruments used and the other procedural steps. You can review my proposed changes in this edit: https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Dilation_and_evacuation&oldid=1270115407

I ask editors the following:

# Are terms such as "dismemberment" and "decapitation," which are referenced in medical literature, appropriate for inclusion?
# Should the article include information about the crushing of the fetal skull, a common part of the procedure?
# Should the article mention that dilation & evacuation is the most common abortion procedure in the second trimester?
I appreciate feedback from the community to help resolve this dispute. Thank you. 
[[User:DocZach|DocZach]] ([[User talk:DocZach|talk]]) 00:55, 18 January 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Layout#rfc_D91D3B1|Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Layout]] expired 2025-02-17 03:01 ===
* Id: D91D3B1
* User: 173.206.40.108
* Date: 2025-02-16 03:28:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1275971097|STYLE 1275971097}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1276139267|STYLE 1276139267}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
&#32;
;{{slink|WP:Manual of Style/Layout#Links to sister projects}} reads
:If the article has no "External links" section, then place the sister link(s) in a <mark>new "External links"</mark> section using inline templates. ...
:* Box-type templates (such as {{tlx|Commons category}}, shown at right) <mark>have to be</mark> put at the beginning of the <mark>"External links"</mark> section of the article so that ...
:* ...
:If an external link is added and/or exists in the "External links" section, the "inline" templates linking to sister projects can be replaced with their respective box-type templates.
;[[WP:MOSSIS]] reads
:Most box-type templates such as {{tlx|Commons}} shown at right should be put at the beginning of the ''last section'' of the article (which is <mark>usually, but not necessarily,</mark> the "External links" section) so that ...
:... [only in special cases], consider using "inline" templates, such as {{tl|Commons-inline}}, in the "External links" section

Which style should be used? [[Special:Contributions/173.206.40.108|173.206.40.108]] ([[User talk:173.206.40.108|talk]]) 03:28, 16 February 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Secondary School Certificate#rfc_7887C47|Talk:Secondary School Certificate]] expired 2025-02-17 15:01 ===
* Id: 7887C47
* User: UwU.Raihanur
* Date: 2025-02-16 15:36:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1276157216|PROP 1276157216}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1276210927|PROP 1276210927}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The term '''"Secondary School Certificate"''' is specific to Bangladesh, while other countries use different names for similar exams, such as '''[[Secondary School Leaving Certificate]] (SSLC)''' in India, '''Senior Secondary School Certificate''' in Nigeria, and '''[[General Certificate of Secondary Education]] (GCSE)''' in the UK. Additionally, many sections in the article about other countries lack proper sources or are poorly sourced, making the information difficult to verify. Given these discrepancies in naming and the lack of proper sourcing, I believe the article should focus exclusively on '''Bangladesh'''. The article '''"[[Secondary School Certificate (Bangladesh)]]"''' is already well-sourced and comprehensive.

So I suggest deleting the current '''"[[Secondary School Certificate]]"''' article, and moving the '''"[[Secondary School Certificate (Bangladesh)]]"''' article to the title '''"[[Secondary School Certificate]]"'''.

<span style="font-family:Georgia; color:#0000FF;">[[User:UwU.Raihanur|RAIHAN]]</span> <span style="color:#DA291C; letter-spacing:-1px;">‚ö°</span> [[User talk:UwU.Raihanur|Got something to say?]] 15:36, 16 February 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Gaza war#rfc_4A9D234|Talk:Gaza war]] expired 2025-02-19 14:01 ===
* Id: 4A9D234
* User: TurboSuperA+
* Date: 2025-02-16 11:15:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1276017690|POL 1276017690}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1276546968|POL 1276546968}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the United States be added as a participant under Israel in the infobox?

* '''Option 1:''' Yes, add the United States as an ally of Israel.  
* '''Option 2:''' Yes, add the United States as a co-belligerent under Israel.
* '''Option 3:''' No.

Rationale for this RfC: [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Template_talk:Gaza_war_infobox#RfC:_Should_the_US_and_UK_be_added_as_allies_to_Israel_in_the_infobox? Previous RfC (no consensus)] had several issues: the question changed half-way through the RfC, it used "US/UK" implying that the foreign policy of the two countries is the same when that is clearly not the case. This RfC focuses on the question of including the United States only. [[User:TurboSuperA+|<span style="color:#9999FF;">'''Turbo'''</span><span style="color:#660066;">'''Super'''</span><span style="color:#CC3300;font-weight:bold;">A+</span>]] ([[User talk:TurboSuperA+|<span style="color:##9999FF;">&#9743;</span>]]) 11:15, 16 February 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Polish‚ÄìOttoman War (1620‚Äì1621)#rfc_5B5FCFA|Talk:Polish‚ÄìOttoman War (1620‚Äì1621)]] expired 2025-02-19 20:01 ===
* Id: 5B5FCFA
* User: Setergh
* Date: 2025-01-20 19:45:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1270692784|HIST 1270692784}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1276602936|HIST 1276602936}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Problem: One side thinks that only the source which directly mentions the result of the '''war''' is valid, while other side thinks that all sources used for [[Battle of Khotyn (1621)]] are viable because it was the battle that determined the final outcome.

Therefore, what should the result be:

# Polish‚ÄìLithuanian victory (side with the source that directly mentions result of the war)
# Disputed, see aftermath (due to Battle of Khotyn being divided when it comes to results)
# Inconclusive
# Something else (suggest)

This is my first RFC so sorry if I set it up wrong. [[User:Setergh|Setergh]] ([[User talk:Setergh|talk]]) 19:45, 20 January 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Department of Government Efficiency#rfc_69EEAE2|Talk:Department of Government Efficiency]] expired 2025-02-20 18:01 ===
* Id: 69EEAE2
* User: NateNate60
* Date: 2025-01-21 17:09:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1270879798|POL 1270879798}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1276776965|POL 1276776965}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This request for comments concerns the following question: In the first sentence of the article, does the term "Department of Government Efficiency" require a definite article before it, i.e. "the Department of Government Efficiency"?

The sentence in question: '''Department of Government Efficiency''' ('''DOGE'''), officially the '''U.S. DOGE Service Temporary Organization''', is a temporary organization under the United States DOGE Service.

Proposed change: The '''Department of Government Efficiency''' ('''DOGE'''), officially the '''U.S. DOGE Service Temporary Organization''', is a temporary organization under the United States DOGE Service.

[[User:NateNate60|NateNate60]] ([[User talk:NateNate60|talk]]) 17:09, 21 January 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Template talk:Code#rfc_F6197F0|Template talk:Code]] expired 2025-02-21 02:01 ===
* Id: F6197F0
* User: Cedar101
* Date: 2025-01-22 01:40:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1271268597|POLICY 1271268597}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1276065931|SCI 1276065931}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1276065935|STYLE 1276065935}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1276840441|SCI 1276840441}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1276840447|STYLE 1276840447}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1276840448|POLICY 1276840448}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There is no point in syntaxhighlighting a word code.
{{qf|The feature displays text, especially source code, in different colours and fonts according to the category of terms. This feature facilitates writing in a structured language such as a programming language or a markup language as both structures and syntax errors are visually distinct.|[[Syntax highlighting]]}}
The meaning of 'distinct' is "different from one another." -- [[User:Cedar101|Cedar101]] ([[User talk:Cedar101|talk]]) 01:40, 22 January 2025 (UTC)}}
