=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)#rfc_E30D20D|Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)]] expired 2025-05-03 21:01 ===
* Id: E30D20D
* User: PharyngealImplosive7
* Date: 2025-04-19 02:35:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1286314255|STYLE 1286314255}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1290897373|STYLE 1290897373}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I would like to formally understand what the community would think of a date-fixing bot. Such a bot would fix dates in articles to conform either {{tlx|Use dmy dates}} or {{tlx|Use mdy dates}}. To be clear, this bot would not revert any good faith changes that add content and dates of the wrong format; instead, it will just change the date format. In my opinion, there are a few different ways such a bot could be implemented (or not):
* '''Option 1''': no bot, everything stays as is
* '''Option 2a''': a supervised bot (so every edit is manually reviewed before publication) that would have to pass BRFA to be implemented. I think this would alleviate any concerns of the bot creating errors based on context (such as changing date formats in quotes, links, references, etc.)
* '''Option 2b''': an automatic bot that does something similar in proposal 2a, but wouldn't actually have its edits be checked before implementation
* '''Option 3''': some other solution; no guarantee that this is actually feasible

Thanks for your consideration ‚Äì <b>[[User:PharyngealImplosive7|<span style="color:#6C7A62">Pharyngeal</span><span style="color:#2D6EE6">Implosive7</span>]] [[User talk:PharyngealImplosive7|<span style="color:#B12049">(talk)</span>]]</b> 02:35, 19 April 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)#rfc_454BE5A|Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)]] expired 2025-05-04 15:01 ===
* Id: 454BE5A
* Date: 2025-04-27 03:35:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1287576751|BIO 1287576751}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1287576758|POL 1287576758}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1287576759|STYLE 1287576759}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1287576760|POLICY 1287576760}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1288738127|BIO 1288738127}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1288738133|POL 1288738133}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1288738138|STYLE 1288738138}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1288738140|POLICY 1288738140}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
If an RfC finds consensus to exclude (or no consensus to include) a person's name from an article (e.g. a criminal suspect's name), which of the following statement(s) should be followed?
*'''(A)''' Sources that contain the name in their titles or headlines should not be used.
*'''(B)''' Sources that contain the name in their URLs should not be used.
*'''(C)''' Editors should not mention the name anywhere on Wikipedia, including talk pages and Wikipedia namespace.
*'''(D)''' None of the above.

03:35, 27 April 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject National Basketball Association#rfc_9EEAF87|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject National Basketball Association]] expired 2025-05-04 18:01 ===
* Id: 9EEAF87
* User: Ladtrack
* Date: 2025-04-04 17:08:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1283953972|SOC 1283953972}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1283988444|BIO 1283988444}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/WikiProjects_and_collaborations|prev|1283988457|PROJ 1283988457}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1288773346|BIO 1288773346}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1288773355|SOC 1288773355}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/WikiProjects_and_collaborations|prev|1288773359|PROJ 1288773359}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
1) Should the articles of any NBA players say that they are often considered one of the greatest players of all time?  

: Example: [[Hakeem Olajuwon|[Hakeem] Olajuwon]] is widely considered one of the greatest basketball players of all time.

2) If the answer to the previous question is yes, what standard should be used? Note: this question is '''optional'''

: 2a) Every [[NBA 75th Anniversary Team|NBA 75]] player is listed as one of the greatest.
: 2b) The following list of basketball players: 
:: [[Bill Russell]]
:: [[Wilt Chamberlain]]
:: [[Kareem Abdul-Jabbar]]
:: [[Larry Bird]]
:: [[Magic Johnson]]
:: [[Hakeem Olajuwon]]
:: [[Michael Jordan]]
:: [[Shaquille O'Neal]]
:: [[Kobe Bryant]]
:: [[Tim Duncan]]
:: [[LeBron James]]
: 2c) The statement is only included if sources discussing the player's legacy commonly state that that player is one of the greatest in the history of basketball, or use equivalent superlative language. 
:: Example of sourcing for the claim of [[Bill Russell]] being one of the greatest of all time: [https://www.cnn.com/2022/07/31/sport/bill-russell-nba-legend-dies-spt-intl/index.html NBA legend], [https://abcnews.go.com/US/nba-legend-bill-russell-dead-88/story?id=87711171 the greatest winner in basketball history], [https://www.cbsnews.com/news/bill-russell-dies-age-88-celtics-legend-11-time-nba-champion/ is widely considered one of the greatest basketball players of all time], [https://www.bbc.com/sport/basketball/62372000 basketball great], [https://apnews.com/article/bill-russell-nba-obit-48db4e1f37deb6e6574263c9f42dee46 NBA great], [https://x.com/SInow/status/1553793920978518017 one of the greatest players of all-time], [https://www.espn.com/nba/story/_/id/34323568/boston-celtics-great-bill-russell-11-nba-champion-dies-88 the ultimate winner].
:2d) Any other criteria; if this option is selected, please do not simply give a different list of basketball players, but rather a different standard from which the inclusion or exclusion of a given player can be assessed through application of some common criteria.
Context: Various historical NBA players have been called "one of the greatest", "the greatest of all-time", or "the greatest at a position" by the press, magazines, books, former players, experts, etc. These terms are very subjective in nature and cover a 75+ year history, but can be sourced none-the-less. Discussions have ranged from the terms being vital to non-encyclopedic, from leaving the term in a player legacy section to prominently being displayed in the lead to not using the term at all. Please help us out with a yes or no on the term "greatest" in the lead section and the reasoning behind it. Thanks. 

Pinging previous discussion contributors: {{Ping|Fyunck(click)|Left_guide|Wamalotpark|Bagumba|Johnnynumerofive|Somarain|Zagalejo|Eg224|Jessintime|Orlando_Davis|Assadzadeh|GOAT_Bones231012|Anonymous7432|Boles_P94}}

[[User:Ladtrack|Ladtrack]] ([[User talk:Ladtrack|talk]]) 17:08, 4 April 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Notability (music)#rfc_F85BE18|Wikipedia talk:Notability (music)]] expired 2025-05-05 18:01 ===
* Id: F85BE18
* User: Flipandflopped
* Date: 2025-04-05 17:53:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1284120840|MEDIA 1284120840}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1284130964|POLICY 1284130964}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1288968893|MEDIA 1288968893}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1288968900|POLICY 1288968900}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Does [[WP:GNG]] allow for album reviews containing substantive, in-depth analysis to ground the notability of a song article, or does the categorical prohibition in [[WP:NSONG]] apply?

# If a song article has substantive in-depth coverage across multiple reliable sources, but they  are all album reviews, it can still be notable under [[WP:GNG]] despite plainly failing [[WP:NSONG]]. [[WP:NSONG]] should be modified to remove the prohibition on album reviews to establish notability, and refer to [[WP:SIGCOV]].
# A song being substantively covered across multiple reliably-sourced album reviews is not a sufficient basis for notability‚Äîa notable song should be the subject of multiple non-trivial published works. NSONG should be clarified as superseding GNG for songs.
# No change is necessary and the current wording of [[WP:NSONG]] is sufficiently clear (''please explain your rationale'').

[[User:Flipandflopped|<b style="color:Teal;">Flip</b>]][[Special:Contribs/Flipandflopped|<sup style="color:purple">and</sup>]][[User talk:Flipandflopped|<b style="color:lime">Flopped</b>]] [[Wikipedia:Civility|<b style="color:grey"> „ÉÑ</b>]] 17:53, 5 April 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Taiwan#rfc_544246A|Talk:Taiwan]] expired 2025-05-07 14:01 ===
* Id: 544246A
* User: 49.157.47.20
* Date: 2025-05-06 06:30:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1289059948|POL 1289059948}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1289262723|POL 1289262723}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The Cambridge Dictionary [https://web.archive.org/web/20231102164711/https://dictionary.cambridge.org/dictionary/english/taiwan previously defined] Taiwan as ‚Äú{{tq|an island country in East Asia}},‚Äù but [https://dictionary.cambridge.org/dictionary/english/taiwan it has now revised the definition] to: ‚Äú{{tq|A large island to the east of China, together with some nearby smaller islands, that has its own government. Taiwan is claimed by the People's Republic of China as its territory.}}‚Äù

Some Wikipedia editors have resisted removing the word ‚Äúcountry‚Äù because [[WP:RS|reliable sources]] have referred to Taiwan as such. However, I believe the Cambridge Dictionary is a representative and reliable source. Moreover, after [[WP:TWRFC|the 2020 RFC]], many reliable sources have adjusted their wording to avoid directly labeling Taiwan as a ‚Äúcountry.‚Äù

Certain editors argue that ‚ÄúTaiwan‚Äù in English primarily refers to a country, while the island or geographical area is [[zh:Ëá∫ÁÅ£|the primary meaning in Chinese]]. But as far as I know, the [[Cambridge Dictionary]] is written by [[British people|British]], not Chinese, authors. I'm not sure whether British people are more likely to understand [[English]] better than Chinese people.

Some editors claim that China's stance is irrelevant to Taiwan's definition. However, the Cambridge Dictionary has placed China's claim in a prominent part of the entry.

So far, I haven‚Äôt heard of China bribing the Cambridge Dictionary, nor have I heard of Chinese hackers infiltrating its website.

I hope the Wikipedia community will reconsider how Taiwan is defined. [[Special:Contributions/49.157.47.20|49.157.47.20]] ([[User talk:49.157.47.20|talk]]) 06:30, 6 May 2025 (UTC)}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
[[Wikipedia:Autopatrolled|Autopatrolled]] is a user right for editors who frequently create articles. Shall we remove this user right from accounts that have made no edits in the last three years? This proposal would initially affect about 1250 of the approximately 4900 autopatrollers; editors who reach the three-year inactivity mark in the future would have the right removed at that time. 04:54, 4 May 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Georgie Aldous#rfc_E18970D|Talk:Georgie Aldous]] expired 2025-05-13 10:01 ===
* Id: E18970D
* User: Martinevans123
* Date: 2025-04-13 09:26:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1285372981|BIO 1285372981}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1290200227|BIO 1290200227}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the following sub-section be added as '''Gender stereotyping'''?

In 2016 British clothing brand Jacamo, owned by [[N Brown Group]], was accused of [[gender stereotyping]] after posting an advert on [[Twitter]] showing a model next to a "real man". Aldous criticised the advert publicly and stated he thought the advert was "homophobic".<ref>{{Cite web |date=2016-11-01 |title=Jacamo's Push For Diversity In Fashion Backfired Spectacularly |url=https://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/entry/jacamo-real-men_uk_58187faee4b0672ea689f8b5 |access-date=2024-12-22 |website=HuffPost UK}}</ref> His criticism was widely reported.<ref>https://her.ie/life/mens-clothing-brand-causes-outrage-with-homophobic-campaign-317913</ref><ref>https://www.joe.co.uk/life/clothing-brand-causes-outrage-with-homophobic-ad-campaign-95181</ref><ref>{{Cite news |date=2016-10-31 |title=Jacamo clothing firm apologises after 'gender stereotyping' in Twitter advert |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/newsbeat-37822931 |access-date=2024-12-20 |work=BBC News}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Lee |first=Josh |date=2016-10-31 |title=Clothing brand Jacamo issue an apology after being called out for "homophobic" online campaign |url=https://www.attitude.co.uk/news/world/clothing-brand-jacamo-issue-an-apology-after-being-called-out-for-homophobic-online-campaign-290669/ |access-date=2024-12-22 |website=Attitude |language=en-GB}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Baret |first=Julie |date=2016-10-31 |title=Les "vrais mecs" et l'homophobie d'une marque anglaise |url=https://tetu.com/2016/10/31/vrais-mecs-pub-jacamo/ |access-date=2024-12-22 |website=T√äTU |language=fr}}</ref> He explained his position: "I feel like I am constantly trying to be shoved into a category that I do not want to be in, I feel like I should have to like football, not like the colour pink, shouldn‚Äôt dye my hair and should have a girlfriend because I'm a man."<ref>{{Cite web |date=2016-10-31 |title=Clothing retailer blasted for "Homophobic" Twitter campaign |url=https://www.thegayuk.com/clothing-retailer-blasted-for-homophobic-twitter-campaign/ |access-date=2024-12-20 |website=THEGAYUK}}</ref>

[[User:Martinevans123|Martinevans123]] ([[User talk:Martinevans123|talk]]) 09:26, 13 April 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Military history#rfc_D609C4A|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Military history]] expired 2025-05-13 10:01 ===
* Id: D609C4A
* User: Thehistorianisaac
* Date: 2025-05-13 00:44:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/WikiProjects_and_collaborations|prev|1290133154|PROJ 1290133154}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/WikiProjects_and_collaborations|prev|1290200232|PROJ 1290200232}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Does the scope of WP:MILHIST also include unarmed coast guards like the [[China Maritime Safety Administration|CMSA]] or the [[Canadian Coast Guard|Canadian coast guard]]? Additionally, do unarmed coast guards used for paramilitary purposes like the [[China Marine Surveillance|CMS]] fall under the scope of WP:MILHIST even though they are unarmed? On the same topic, do armed agencies with a civilian law enforcement role (like the [[CBP Air and Marine Operations]]) fall under WP:MILHIST?

If there are no rules on this yet, I propose one of 5 solutions:

# '''All coast guards fall under the scope of WP:MILHIST'''
# '''Only armed coast guards like the [[United States Coast Guard|USCG]] or [[China Coast Guard|CCG]] fall under the scope of WP:MILHIST'''
# '''Unarmed coast guards fall under the scope of WP:MILHIST if they are used for non-search and rescue military purposes (e.g. CMS)'''
# '''Unarmed coast guards fall under the scope of WP:MILHIST if they are organizationally under the military, such as [[Maritime Search and Rescue (Mexico)|Mexican Maritime Search and Rescue]]'''
# '''All armed coast guards with military weapons(e.g. CBPAMO) fall under WP:MILHIST regardless of role'''

[[User:Thehistorianisaac|Thehistorianisaac]] ([[User talk:Thehistorianisaac|talk]]) 00:44, 13 May 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Abd al-Mu'min#rfc_5E911B5|Talk:Abd al-Mu'min]] expired 2025-05-13 23:01 ===
* Id: 5E911B5
* User: Blazing73
* Date: 2025-05-03 13:54:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1288565817|HIST 1288565817}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1290297912|HIST 1290297912}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
According to the historian [['Abd al-Wahid al-Marrakushi]], Abd al-Mu'min was born in Tagra near Tlemcen during the reign of [[Yusuf ibn Tashfin]], [https://books.google.it/books?id=4Q4sAAAAMAAJ&newbks=1&newbks_redir=0&dq=N%C3%A9%20%C3%A0%20la%20fin%20de%20487%2C%20sous%20le%20r%C3%A8gne%20de%20Yo%C3%BBsof%20b.%20T%C3%A2chefin&hl=it&pg=PA172#v=onepage&q=N%C3%A9%20%C3%A0%20la%20fin%20de%20487,%20sous%20le%20r%C3%A8gne%20de%20Yo%C3%BBsof%20b.%20T%C3%A2chefin&f=false] which is consistent with the historical events of that time, as the Almoravids took control of Tlemcen around the year 1081,[https://books.google.it/books?id=oq_2EAAAQBAJ&newbks=1&newbks_redir=0&lpg=PT117&dq=Almoravid%20Tlemcen%201081&hl=it&pg=PT117#v=onepage&q=Almoravid%20Tlemcen%201081&f=false] and [[Djamaa el Kebir|The Almoravid Mosque of Algiers]] was built in 1097, one year after the birth of Abd al-Mu'min, which indicates that the Hammadid borders did not extend beyond Algiers and that's why I ask editors to decide between:

# Abd al-Mu'min was born during the Almoravid era 
# Abd al-Mu'min was born during the reign of the Hammadid dynasty. 
# Not specified in the Kingdom was Born.
[[User:Blazing73|Blazing73]] ([[User talk:Blazing73|talk]]) 13:54, 3 May 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Nicole Perlman#rfc_260D895|Talk:Nicole Perlman]] expired 2025-05-14 04:01 ===
* Id: 260D895
* User: Stevedorex
* Date: 2025-05-10 19:32:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1289778536|BIO 1289778536}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1289778544|MEDIA 1289778544}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1290329208|BIO 1290329208}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1290329211|MEDIA 1290329211}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should this article contain information about James Gunn? The assertion that James "rewrote the whole script" is just that, an assertion by a party in dispute, common in credit disputes and already heavily covered in the Guardians of the Galaxy article.

The WGA arbitration exists to make a formal determination of whether James "rewrote the whole script." If he had, he would have been awarded sole credit. He wasn't, so that claim was invalidated. This is weird Twitter fanboy beef brought to Wikipedia. This a longstanding dispute that has resulted in a number of edit wars elsewhere and might require limited protections for this article.

[[User:Stevedorex|Stevedorex]] ([[User talk:Stevedorex|talk]]) 19:32, 10 May 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Femosphere#rfc_CF95384|Talk:Femosphere]] expired 2025-05-14 09:01 ===
* Id: CF95384
* User: HairlessPolarBear
* Date: 2025-05-13 21:49:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1290291549|SOC 1290291549}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1290291550|POLICY 1290291550}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1290426815|SOC 1290426815}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1290426819|POLICY 1290426819}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Does the current "Radicalisation narratives" section in the *Femosphere* article comply with core Wikipedia content policies - ''specifically, WP:NPOV, WP:SYNTH, WP:V, and WP:OR''?

* This discussion follows the AfD outcome ''(‚ÄòKeep, without prejudice toward a rewrite to address NPOV and other content issues‚Äô).''

The section groups several claims ''(e.g., rejection of liberal feminism, invocation of fallacies, mimicry of manosphere logic)'' into what appears to be an established ‚Äúradicalisation narrative‚Äù or ‚Äúpipeline.‚Äù 

However:

#Some sources do not use the term ‚Äúfemosphere‚Äù at all ''(e.g., referring instead to ‚Äúwomanosphere‚Äù)'', which may raise WP:SYNTH concerns if they‚Äôre synthesized to support the same point.
#Several claims appear in Wikipedia‚Äôs voice without clear attribution to secondary sources, which may affect WP:NPOV and WP:V compliance.
#None of the cited sources define or support the grouping of these ideas together under any "radicalisation narrative" or "pipeline," raising concerns under WP:OR and WP:SYNTH. One source ''(The Guardian, 2024)'' states that ''"there's no evidence to say that the femosphere is radicalizing its members in the same way as the manosphere,"'' which appears to contradict the framing of the section.

Editors are invited to weigh in on how best to bring the section into alignment with policy. 

'''Potential options might include ''(but are not limited to)'':'''

* '''Option A''': Keep as is
* '''Option B''': Revise for clearer attribution, sourcing, or scope
* '''Option C''': Remove section until stronger sourcing is available

[[User:HairlessPolarBear|HairlessPolarBear]] ([[User talk:HairlessPolarBear|talk]]) 21:49, 13 May 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Billie Eilish discography#rfc_E5A2D53|Talk:Billie Eilish discography]] expired 2025-05-16 04:01 ===
* Id: E5A2D53
* Date: 2025-04-16 03:32:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1285841195|MEDIA 1285841195}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1290649115|MEDIA 1290649115}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
It has been bothering me for a while that some of Eilish's songs that are assigned as singles, since not every standalone release is a single. That is why I think we should move certain songs into promotional singles category. I have put it into a numbered list, to explain why these examples should be switched:
# "[[Come Out and Play (Billie Eilish song)|Come Out and Play]]" (2018) ‚Äì song released to be used in a commercial, not tied to any project (besides being a <u>bonus</u> track on Japanese edition of ''[[When We All Fall Asleep, Where Do We Go?]]'' (2019)). No airplay release, no physical release either.
# "[[When I Was Older]]" (2019) ‚Äì song inspired by a movie ''[[Roma (2018 film)|Roma]]'' (2018), later included in soundtrack album for it and as a bonus track on Japanese edition of her debut album. No airplay release, no physical release either.
# "[[Wish You Were Gay]]" (2019) ‚Äì song released as more of a charity single, but it also was included in the standard track listing of her debut album. It did not got neither airplay, nor physical release, and was pushed so close to the album release date, I would categorize it as a promo single.
# "[[Lost Cause (Billie Eilish song)|Lost Cause]]" (2021) ‚Äì another example of song getting pushed close to the album's release, with no airplay and physical release. The song's release date was also unusual, and it is actually the first song on that list that was promoted by a music video, however non-singles also can get visual independent of the album (ex. "[[Xanny (song)|Xanny]]" from her debut album).
# "[[Male Fantasy]]" (2021) ‚Äì even though I have created the article about this one, now I do not believe that since some magazines call a song a single it should be categorized as such. It got only music video treatment and a single performance during its "single release" month, not much promotion, especially knowing that it did not appeared on any physical formats or on radios. It did not even had its own separate digital release.
# "[[Hotline Bling#Covers and usage in media|Hotline (Edit)]]" (2023) ‚Äì literally just a portion of previously released single should definitely not be counted as a separate single release. No airplay release, no physical release either.
Update: I think, there are actually more examples than I initially thought of. I am less knowledgeable about her dbeut EP days, that is why I have not included her earlier singles in the list.
#<li value=7> "[[Bored (song)|Bored]]" (2017) and "[[Lo Vas a Olvidar]]" (2021) ‚Äì another soundtrack songs with no physical release, or airplay release.
# "[[Watch (Billie Eilish song)|Watch]]", "[[Copycat (Billie Eilish song)|Copycat]]", "[[Idontwannabeyouanymore]]", and "[[My Boy (Billie Eilish song)|My Boy]]" (all 2017) ‚Äì all of these songs were released shortly one at another in anticipation of the EP, some of them got remixed versions released, but still no physical or radio release.
# "[[&Burn]]", "[[Bitches Broken Hearts]]", and "[[Party Favor (song)|Party Favor]]" (all 2018) ‚Äì all of these songs were issued as standalone releases before getting added as bonus tracks of her debut EP. No radio release, however "Party Favor" was released physically, even before its digital release, but it still does not make it official single.
[[User:Infsai|<span style="color:gray">inf</span><span style="color:red">sai</span>]] ([[User_talk:Infsai|<span style="color:#5d09e3">talk</span>]]) 03:32, 16 April 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Oriental (Morocco)#rfc_25279D3|Talk:Oriental (Morocco)]] expired 2025-05-16 18:01 ===
* Id: 25279D3
* User: ElijahUHC
* Date: 2025-05-08 19:37:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1289463155|POLICY 1289463155}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1290730528|POLICY 1290730528}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Previous discussion on this talk page did not reach consensus on whether the Tifinagh name ‚µì‚µè‚µá‚µá‚¥∞‚µî should be included in the infobox for Oriental (Morocco).[[Talk:Oriental (Morocco)#c-Skitash-20250507220800-ElijahUHC-20250507215400|Talk:Oriental (Morocco)#c-Skitash-20250507220800-ElijahUHC-20250507215400]]

Should the Tifinagh name ‚µì‚µè‚µá‚µá‚¥∞‚µî be in the infobox of Oriental (Morocco), sourced to the Moroccan government's official website: https://www.maroc.ma/amz/taxonomy/term/9. This is not a translation or interpretation ‚Äî it appears directly on the government‚Äôs interactive [https://www.maroc.ma/amz map], labeling the region in Standard Moroccan Tamazight (Tifinagh script), alongside Arabic, French, and English.
This concerns the administrative region‚Äôs official name, not common usage or linguistic preference. Other proposed names cited earlier do not appear in the sources attributed to them, nor in the governmental site.
Per [[WP:PRIMARY]] and [[WP:V]], official government sources are reliable for official names. Does this justify including ‚µì‚µè‚µá‚µá‚¥∞‚µî in the infobox? [[User:ElijahUHC|ElijahUHC]] ([[User talk:ElijahUHC|talk]]) 19:37, 8 May 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:External links#rfc_E98D5FA|Wikipedia talk:External links]] expired 2025-05-17 00:01 ===
* Id: E98D5FA
* User: Patrick Welsh
* Date: 2025-05-16 21:56:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1290762572|STYLE 1290762572}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1290774233|STYLE 1290774233}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Do [[WP:Verifiability]] and [[WP:Reliable sources]] apply to the contents of [[MOS:FURTHER|Further reading]] sections?

* '''Option 1''': Yes
* '''Option 2''': No
* '''Option 3''': Other (please specify)

Before supporting option 3, please consider whether your objection might be better accommodated as a special exception under options 1 or 2. The application of either option would require the same editorial exercise of case-specific judgment and, in instances of disagreement, consensus-oriented discussion towards which we aspire everywhere <s>else</s> on Wikipedia.

Note in particular that option 1 would not provide license for editors to indiscriminately remove unsourced content from these sections‚Äînot any more than option 2 would provide license for editors to add large amounts of content to these lists without any stated justification. In most case, both of these behaviors would be considered [[WP:Disruptive editing]] in the same way that they would for such edits made to the prose body of an article, and they would be treated accordingly.

This is the first time I have formally requested comments from the community in this way. I do so in this venue because it is where the precipitating discussion began (which you may find immediately above). I will advertise it at [[Wikipedia_talk:Manual_of_Style/Layout]], and I invite other editors to please do the same at any other appropriately neutral forum.

Thank you in advance for your participation ‚Äî<br>
[[User:Patrick Welsh|Patrick üêà‚Äç‚¨õ]] ([[User talk:Patrick Welsh|talk]]) 21:56, 16 May 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Yura Borisov#rfc_9F6D838|Talk:Yura Borisov]] expired 2025-05-21 07:01 ===
* Id: 9F6D838
* User: Jyothipaili5656568
* Date: 2025-05-21 04:40:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1291426952|MEDIA 1291426952}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1291437496|MEDIA 1291437496}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I am opening this RfC to gain community consensus on the following proposed addition to the "Career" section of the Yura Borisov article:

> "In 2024, Borisov faced criticism for filming in Russian-occupied territories in Ukraine and for his involvement in films described by *The Guardian* as aligned with Russian state propaganda.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Sauer |first=Pjotr |date=2025-03-03 |title=Russian state propagandists overjoyed at Anora‚Äôs Oscar triumph |url=https://www.theguardian.com/film/2025/mar/03/anora-oscar-triumph-russian-state-propagandists-overjoyed |access-date=2025-05-15 |work=The Guardian}}</ref>"

**Supporting points:**
- *The Guardian* article specifically names Borisov and discusses his starring role in *Kalashnikov*, which it notes was partially filmed in Crimea (occupied Ukrainian territory).
- *The Guardian* is a reliable source per WP:RS.
- There was a prior Third Opinion (3O) supporting inclusion.
- Per WP:UNDUE and WP:BLP, sourced criticism ‚Äî especially from a major news outlet ‚Äî is appropriate when attributed and balanced.
- Although the article doesn‚Äôt explicitly say ‚Äúhe was criticized,‚Äù it strongly implies it by linking his film work to Russian state propaganda and placing it in a critical context.

**Opposing editors argue:**
- The *Guardian* article doesn‚Äôt directly state Borisov was criticized.
- It does not confirm which scenes were filmed in Crimea or whether Borisov was involved in those scenes.
- The criticism is more implied than explicit, and may not meet WP:BLP standards for inclusion.

Your input is welcome. Please weigh in on whether this sourced criticism is appropriate to include in the Career section of the article.

[[User:Jyothipaili5656568|Jyothipaili5656568]] ([[User talk:Jyothipaili5656568|talk]]) 04:40, 21 May 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Mustafa Kemal Atat√ºrk#rfc_7E39107|Talk:Mustafa Kemal Atat√ºrk]] expired 2025-05-21 20:01 ===
* Id: 7E39107
* User: Chess
* Date: 2025-04-21 19:58:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1286665738|BIO 1286665738}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1291527174|BIO 1291527174}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should this article include information about Zsa Zsa Gabor's possible relationship with Mustafa Kemal Ataturk?

# '''Do not include''' any information.
# '''Include as a claim''' attributed to Zsa Zsa Gabor.
# '''Include in Wikivoice''' that the relationship occurred.

This statement was added after the RfC began to satisfy [[WP:RFCNEUTRAL]] and [[WP:RFCBRIEF]]. <span class="nowrap">[[User:Chess|Chess]] ([[User talk:Chess|talk]]) <small>(please [[Help:Talk pages#Notifications|mention]] me on reply)</small></span> 19:58, 21 April 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Template talk:Korean/auto#rfc_CC09880|Template talk:Korean/auto]] expired 2025-05-21 21:01 ===
* Id: CC09880
* User: seefooddiet
* Date: 2025-04-21 20:14:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1286764212|TECH 1286764212}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1291535054|TECH 1291535054}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Read [[User:Seefooddiet/Automatic Korean romanization|this page]] for the full project proposal.

Summary: proposing that this template ({{tl|Korean/auto}}) and {{tl|Infobox Korean name/auto}} gradually replace their predecessor templates {{tl|Korean}} and {{tl|Infobox Korean name}}. These new templates have '''semi-automatic romanization''', as well as a number of other new features. For rationale and specifics, see [[User:Seefooddiet/Automatic Korean romanization|the linked page above]]. === [[Talk:Implicational propositional calculus#rfc_1104B90|Talk:Implicational propositional calculus]] expired 2025-05-22 13:01 ===
* Id: 1104B90
* User: Marc Schroeder
* Date: 2025-04-22 12:52:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1286874110|SCI 1286874110}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1291630363|SCI 1291630363}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
On  22 April 2025 (02:19) I updated the article [[Implicational propositional calculus]]. A few hours later the update was reverted with the argument that ''"I am missing the whole point which is to avoid using falsum in the formulas"''. Could a third party please verify that claim.

Aside from that, in my opinion the article needs substantial improvements:
* The article should place implicational calculus in its historical context by tracing its development from ‚Äò‚Äô[[Begriffsschrift]]‚Äô‚Äô, through ‚Äò‚Äô[[Principia Mathematica]]‚Äô‚Äô, and on to later contributions by the [[Lw√≥w‚ÄìWarsaw school]], [[Gerhard Gentzen|Gentzen]], and others. This would reveal the evolution from the axiomatic [[Hilbert system|Hilbert-style proof systems]] to the more intuitive methods of [[Method of analytic tableaux|analytic tableaux]], [[natural deduction]] or [[sequent calculus]].
* The article should highlight that implicational calculus {{mdash}} with <math>\bot</math>{{mdash}} adequately covers classical logic, but does not suffice for full intuitionistic logic, where conjunction (<math>\land</math>) and disjunction (<math>\lor</math>) are essential, rather than merely [[syntactic sugar]]. This important distinction should not be overlooked.

As to the sections,
* The section ''[[Implicational propositional calculus#Completeness|Completeness]]'' is either undocumented or based on (forbidden) original research. The reader loses track in the midst of formal derivations.
* The section ''[[Implicational propositional calculus#The Bernays‚ÄìTarski axiom system|The Bernays‚ÄìTarski axiom system]]'' should either be relocated to the article ''[[List of axiomatic systems in logic]]'' or better justified in context. Highlighting one alternative among a plethora of axiom systems appears arbitrary and lacks relevance to the broader purpose of the article.
* The section ''[[Implicational propositional calculus#Satisfiability and validity|Satisfiability and validity]]'' discusses the [[NP (complexity)|NP-complexity]] of the [[Boolean satisfiability problem|propositional satisfiability problem]]. Either the computational complexity angle should be considered as beyond the scope of the article and removed, or should be addressed with appropriate context. Note that the examples provided implicitly use the [[method of analytic tableaux]], while the article only deploys [[Hilbert system|Hilbert-style deduction systems]].
* The section ''[[Implicational propositional calculus#Adding an axiom schema|Adding an axiom schema]]'' illustrates that adding non-tautologies {{mdash}}think of a bare propositional variable <math>P</math>{{mdash}} as axioms makes the system inconsistent. This is a trivial point and comes across as unprofessional. The section should be removed.
* The section ''[[Implicational propositional calculus#An alternative axiomatization|An alternative axiomatization]]'' is undocumented and lacks references. Without a proper citation, it appears to be original research and should either be sourced or omitted.

‚Äì‚Äì‚Äì [[User:Marc Schroeder|Marc Schroeder]] ([[User talk:Marc Schroeder|talk]]) 12:52, 22 April 2025 (UTC)}}

Should the article, including the opening sentence of the lead section, state the Gaza Genocide in wikivoice as fact?:

*'''Yes''' Example opening sentence: {{tq|The '''Gaza genocide''' is the ongoing systematic destruction of the Palestinian people in Gaza by Israel during the Gaza war.}} or equivalent (new proposed version)
*'''No''' Example opening sentence: {{tq|According to a United Nations special committee, Amnesty International, and other experts and human rights organisations, Israel has committed genocide against the Palestinian people during its ongoing invasion and bombing of the Gaza Strip as part of the Gaza war.}} (previous stable version) [[User:Hemiauchenia|Hemiauchenia]] ([[User talk:Hemiauchenia|talk]]) 22:17, 26 April 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Australian Cattle Dog#rfc_4CDE30F|Talk:Australian Cattle Dog]] expired 2025-05-24 07:01 ===
* Id: 4CDE30F
* User: Guilbrynski
* Date: 2025-05-24 05:01:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1291921159|HIST 1291921159}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1291925917|HIST 1291925917}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
G'day,

I‚Äôm the proud owner of what I currently refer to (see chart) as a '''Cattle Dog of Australia''' ‚Äî a term I use in contrast to the more formalised name ''Australian Cattle Dog'', which, according to my ongoing research, appears to have been coined and formalised by Robert Kaleski around '''1903'''.

Over the past month and a half, with help from my AI assistant, I‚Äôve compiled a working '''genealogical chart''' tracing known and hypothesised breed influences, including several undocumented or lesser-discussed variants. This includes some visual reconstructions where no historical images were available.

My previous discussion thread was titled '''‚ÄúGenealogy Breed Chart Draft‚Äù''', and I‚Äôd like to thank @[[User:Traumnovelle|Traumnovelle]] for helping improve the early clarity of that draft. The latest version (as of 24 May 2025) is available here:

‚û°Ô∏è [https://drive.google.com/file/d/1dKH8QcsYTxz7zhyOnDj8EbNUtZzUixfu/view?usp=sharing Current Draft]

(''Note: This is still in development. If anyone prefers to print, annotate, and scan it back to me for easier feedback, that‚Äôs very welcome.'')
----

''' üß≠ Topics I‚Äôd Love Reflection or Sources On: '''

''' 1. Timmins‚Äô Experiment vs Early Hall Lineage '''

Do we have any Australian source that directly compares these two branches or suggests one may have been foundational to the other?

''' 2. The ‚ÄúCattle Dog of Australia‚Äù Terminology '''

I‚Äôve labelled the pre-Kaleski, Bentley-era lineage as ''Cattle Dog of Australia'' in my chart. At that stage, the dogs were still regionally bred, unstandardised, and not known by the ‚ÄúAustralian Cattle Dog‚Äù name yet. The label is intended to distinguish it from post-Dalmatian/Kelpie infusion lines promoted by the Bagust brothers.

Fair or confusing?

''' 3. The George Elliott Dilemma '''

Elliott‚Äôs work is mentioned heavily in US sources like '''ACDCA.org''', but he‚Äôs absent from this article. Meanwhile, Thomas Hall (well-documented in Australian literature) is omitted from that same US site entirely.

Could this reflect a storytelling bias, or is there primary source material on Elliott‚Äôs dogs in Australian archives that we‚Äôve missed?
----

''' üîç Additional Questions (Lower Priority): '''

* Was there a known '''phenotypic variant''' (e.g. coat or temperament) that emerged directly following the '''Dalmatian infusion'''?
* Is there clear consensus that the '''Northumberland Drover''' imported by Hall came from '''England''' and not '''Scotland'''? (Some sources use ‚Äúborder regions‚Äù loosely.)
* Despite only 100 km separating '''Smithfield''' and '''Northumberland''', accounts suggest quite distinct working types. Can anyone confirm historical differences in behaviour or morphology?

----Thank you for any insight or redirections you can offer. I believe this type of visual chart ‚Äî even in draft form ‚Äî could help clarify historical ambiguity for the community, and I‚Äôd love for it to become a collaborative effort.

Best regards and blessings,

'''Guil''' [[User:Guilbrynski|Guilbrynski]] ([[User talk:Guilbrynski|talk]]) 05:01, 24 May 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Sean Combs sexual misconduct allegations#rfc_B498132|Talk:Sean Combs sexual misconduct allegations]] expired 2025-05-24 17:01 ===
* Id: B498132
* User: The Gnome
* Date: 2025-05-24 11:34:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1291960061|BIO 1291960061}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1291960063|MEDIA 1291960063}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1291960067|POL 1291960067}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1291960072|SOC 1291960072}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1292000732|BIO 1292000732}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1292000737|MEDIA 1292000737}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1292000739|POL 1292000739}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1292000741|SOC 1292000741}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Almost all [[WP:RS|sources]] reporting on the article's subject or commenting about it are referring to it concisely and succinctly as the "Sean Combs trial." This title varies across the sources only on the individual's name, e.g. a media outlet might denote it as the "Diddy trial." (A trivial earch unearths a plethora of examples.) Since the whole issue of the accusations for sexual misconduct has moved to its final and decisive judicial phase, and on the basis of [[WP:V]] and [[WP:COMMONNAME]], I submit to fellow contributors the obvious question for their comments:

Should the article's title

'''A''' Remain the same?

'''B''' Be changed to '''Sean Combs trial''' ? 

-[[User:The Gnome|The Gnome]] ([[User talk:The Gnome|talk]]) 11:34, 24 May 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_E56F219|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2025-05-25 18:01 ===
* Id: E56F219
* User: Marquardtika
* Date: 2025-05-01 17:01:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1288290588|MEDIA 1288290588}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1292912242|MEDIA 1292912242}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
 

Regarding the reliability of the ''Washington Free Beacon''. Previous discussions from [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Reliable_sources/Noticeboard/Archive_227#Washington_Free_Beacon 2017] and [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Reliable_sources/Noticeboard/Archive_291#Using_The_Washington_Free_Beacon_in_politically_related_BLPs_-_is_it_an_RS? 2020]. Discussion that led to creation of this RFC is [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Reliable_sources/Noticeboard#Washington_Free_Beacon here]. [[User:Marquardtika|Marquardtika]] ([[User talk:Marquardtika|talk]]) 17:01, 1 May 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Perth#rfc_582268D|Talk:Perth]] expired 2025-05-28 02:01 ===

* User: PastelLilac

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1287725215|HIST 1287725215}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1292639976|MEDIA 1292639976}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There is ongoing disagreement among editors about which landmarks should be included in the lead image montage of the Perth article. This RFC seeks community input on how best to determine which landmarks are most appropriate or representative for inclusion. The dispute revolves around three landmarks:

*'''Option 1''': [[Elizabeth Quay]] Pedestrian Bridge ([https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Perth&oldid=1287554044 the current version])
*'''Option 2''': [[Cottesloe Beach]] ([https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Perth&oldid=1287553458 diff])
*'''Option 3''': [[Crawley Edge Boatshed]] ([https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Perth&oldid=1284052555 diff])

Please indicate which option you support, and feel free to suggest modifications or alternative combinations. - [[User:PastelLilac|PastelLilac]] ([[User talk:PastelLilac|talk]]) 01:04, 28 April 2025 (UTC)}}

[[Rediff.com]] has been discussed at least 4 times previously ([https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Featured_article_candidates/Dimple_Kapadia/archive2#Source_review],[https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talk:Mallika_Sherawat#Mallika's_age_and_actions_by_user_Shshshsh],[https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Reliable_sources/Noticeboard/Archive_171#Rediff.com_News?],[https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Reliable_sources/Noticeboard/Archive_322#Rediff.com]). *'''Option 3''': [[WP:GUNREL|Generally unreliable]]
*'''Option 4''': Generally unreliable, with [[WP:DEPREC|deprecation]]

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Reliable sources/Perennial sources#rfc_BC24291|Wikipedia talk:Reliable sources/Perennial sources]] expired 2025-06-01 13:01 ===
* Id: BC24291
* User: 2405:6E00:223E:AF6E:A85D:7FF:FEB8:8AC6
* Date: 2025-05-31 03:41:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1293171445|MEDIA 1293171445}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1293393813|MEDIA 1293393813}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This source [[Pinkvilla]], which mostly posts box office numbers and entertainment gossip, is considered reliable at [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Film/Indian cinema task force]]. I'm posting this RfC here because if I post it at [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Film/Indian cinema task force|WP:ICTF]], the result is only going to be in favour of this source. The editors there defend this source with passion. Here is a brief history of the source:

First thing first, here is the disclaimer they give out at the end of each article, as pointed out by the editor {{u|Black Kite}} in a previous discussion here:

'''The figures can be approximate, and Pinkvilla does not make any claims about the authenticity of the data'''

That should say enough but here's more:

Pinkvilla was previously considered unreliable at ICTF and was moved to the list of reliable sources in February 2022 without proper discussion, as seen [https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia_talk:WikiProject_Film/Indian_cinema_task_force/Archive_7#Reliability_of_Pinkvilla here].

The Entertainment Editor at Pinkvilla, Himesh Mankad, welcomed the current admin of their box office section and his associate to Pinkvilla in December 2021, as seen [https://x.com/HimeshMankad/status/1469235093612875776?t=8b-mXlRNYb9FfH02fnK-5w&s=19 here].

In [https://x.com/meJat32/status/1498699613980999681?t=l9JFI_GcsEiEP35b08UqvQ&s=19 this] tweet, the admin of Pinkvilla Box Office confirm that they started the blog Cinetrak and moved to Pinkvilla from Cinetrak. Now Cinetrak is considered unreliable. Although the admin say they have not been involved with it since moving to Pinkvilla, they continue to endorse Cinetrak and call it the "best box office tracking site in South India", even in [https://x.com/meJat32/status/1923531864125386764?t=ltXeGd5hBZrBDwYosPNcig&s=19 this] recent tweet. The box office figures given by Cinetrak and Pinkvilla are also exactly the same for every film. 

Now, it's not as if there aren't other sources reporting on the box office of Indian films. Many sources including newspapers like [[The Hindu]], [[The Indian Express]] etc. publish box office figures. And they do this without citing any of these other dubious sources. If a movie has indeed earned a specific amount of money, then other sources will publish about it, as Indian films are often widely covered in the media.

([[Special:Contributions/2405:6E00:223E:AF6E:A85D:7FF:FEB8:8AC6|2405:6E00:223E:AF6E:A85D:7FF:FEB8:8AC6]] ([[User talk:2405:6E00:223E:AF6E:A85D:7FF:FEB8:8AC6|talk]]) 03:41, 31 May 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Reform UK#rfc_EA5B2B1|Talk:Reform UK]] expired 2025-06-01 17:01 ===
* Id: EA5B2B1
* User: GlowstoneUnknown
* Date: 2025-06-01 14:31:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1293408810|POL 1293408810}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There seems to be new sources coming to light and renewed calls for the description of the party's position to be changed lately, so I thought it would be best to open an RfC to discuss this and achieve a proper consensus. My suggestion is, due to the quantity of sources that describe the party as simply "right-wing", that the article's infobox and lead should be changed to describe the party as '''Right-wing to far-right'''.

Pinging previous contributors from similar discussions (obviously new editors are encouraged to participate in this RfC as well): @[[User:GothicGolem29|GothicGolem29]], @[[User:ErickTheMerrick|ErickTheMerrick]], @[[User:Scope creep|Scope creep]], @[[User:Kowal2701|Kowal2701]], @[[User:Kind Tennis Fan|Kind Tennis Fan]], @[[User:Cortador|Cortador]], @[[User:Czello|Czello]], @[[User:GhulamIslam|GhulamIslam]], @[[User:Halbared|Halbared]], @[[User:Sirfurboy|Sirfurboy]], @[[User:Sizewell|Sizewell]], @[[User:DWMemories|DWMemories]], @[[User:Spookybunny8|Spookybunny8]], @[[User:Polish kurd|Polish kurd]], @[[User:Brat Forelli|Brat Forelli]], @[[User:This is Paul|This is Paul]]: @[[User:Bondegezou|Bondegezou]], @[[User:Dimadick|Dimadick]]. <span style="text-shadow:5px 5px 25px Black;font-family:Courier;font-weight:bold;font-size:110%">[[User:GlowstoneUnknown|<span style="color:#f44">‚Äì GlowstoneUnknown</span>]] [[User talk:GlowstoneUnknown|<span style="color:#f9f">(Talk)</span>]]</span> 14:31, 1 June 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Henny Penny#rfc_D242EAA|Talk:Henny Penny]] expired 2025-06-03 15:01 ===
* Id: D242EAA
* User: Nicholas0
* Date: 2025-05-14 20:32:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|1290442192|LANG 1290442192}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|1293765667|LANG 1293765667}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This RfC seeks to establish that edits about comma usage should be based on verified rules. All of the sources listed in this thread support the same rule for comma usage when it comes to two full independent clauses. No reference has been provided to justify the comma's removal in the following sentence: "Similar stories go back more than 25 centuries, and 'Henny Penny' continues to be referred to in a variety of media." I correctly added a comma between two full independent clauses with different subjects and different verbs. The clauses have different subjects and verbs, making them full independent clauses.
Examples of how to correctly use commas to separate full independent clauses can be found in these helpful references from sites around the world.<br>
'''American English''':<br>
#1 https://east.iu.edu/student-success/coursework/commas.html#:~:text=1.,cat%20tripped%20on%20the%20cord.
1. Use a comma to separate independent clauses<br>
Rule: Use a comma before a coordinating conjunction (and, but, yet, so, or nor, for) when it joins two complete ideas (independent clauses).<br>
He walked down the street, and then he turned the corner.<br>
You can go shopping with me, or you can go to a movie alone.<br>
#2 https://www.stylemanual.gov.au/grammar-punctuation-and-conventions/punctuation/commas#place_commas_between_principal_clauses_joined_together_with_a_conjunction
Place commas between principal clauses joined together with a conjunction.<br>
Use commas to connect 2 or more principal clauses joined by a coordinating conjunction (‚Äòand‚Äô, ‚Äòor‚Äô, ‚Äòbut‚Äô, ‚Äòso‚Äô).<br>
If they have different subjects, use a comma before the coordinating conjunction.<br>
Example:
The Senate debated the Bill at length, but the party whips eventually called for a vote.
[‚ÄòBut‚Äô is the coordinating conjunction. ‚ÄòThe Senate‚Äô and ‚Äòthe party whips‚Äô are each the subjects of a principal clause.]<br>
'''Australian English''':
#3 https://www.swarthmore.edu/writing/commas-0
Use a comma before a coordinating conjunction1 that connects two independent clauses.<br>
CORRECT: I want to major in English, but my mother says it's not practical.
Conjunctions perform many functions, so make sure they're separating independent clauses before you insert a comma.<br>
'''British English''':
#4 https://www.bbc.co.uk/bitesize/articles/zfmmtv4#zx662v4
Commas and clauses<br>
Commas are used to separate some types of clauses in a sentence.
Independent clauses that are joined by coordinating conjunctions -‚ÄØand, but, for, or, nor, so, yet‚ÄØ- also need a comma before the conjunction.<br>
Malik opened the door**, and** Helen was waiting inside.<br><br>
As you can see from the sources, this rule about using commas before the conjunction to separate independent clauses is not exclusive to one particular variety of English. Nevertheless, [[User:Sweetpool50]] undid my edit without providing any reasoning or explanation other than the abrupt comment "wrong". [[User:Nicholas0|Nicholas0]] ([[User talk:Nicholas0|talk]]) 20:32, 14 May 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:UserBenchmark#rfc_3675B16|Talk:UserBenchmark]] expired 2025-06-03 15:01 ===
* Id: 3675B16
* User: PeteskiPete
* Date: 2025-05-29 17:09:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1292936664|SCI 1292936664}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1293765670|SCI 1293765670}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Following on from the "Discussion on deleted edits" on this talk page, there are three outstanding [[wp:NPOV]] edits (numbered 1, 9 and 10 under "Discussion on deleted edits") I propose, that thus far I've been unable to get enough local editors to okay. The proposed edits rely on the references that are already cited in the article. I'd be grateful for your comments.

1) From:

"It is known for its controversies for producing biased computer hardware ranking charts which unfairly favour Intel and Nvidia hardware, and disapproves of AMD hardware.<ref name=":1">{{Cite web |last=Nasir |first=Hassam |date=2025-03-12 |title=UserBenchmark bashes AMD GPUs and claims they lack real-world performance |url=https://www.tomshardware.com/pc-components/gpus/userbenchmark-bashes-amd-gpus-and-claims-they-lack-real-world-performance |access-date=2025-03-16 |website=Tom's Hardware |language=en}}</ref>"
 
to:
 
‚ÄúIts controversial opinions and perceived biases in its computer hardware rankings against AMD products have drawn criticism in the tech press, which UserBenchmark have rejected.<ref name=":1">{{Cite web |last=Nasir |first=Hassam |date=2025-03-12 |title=UserBenchmark bashes AMD GPUs and claims they lack real-world performance |url=https://www.tomshardware.com/pc-components/gpus/userbenchmark-bashes-amd-gpus-and-claims-they-lack-real-world-performance |access-date=2025-03-16 |website=Tom's Hardware |language=en}}</ref><ref name=":2">{{Cite web |author1=Matthew Connatser |date=2019-07-28 |title=Updated: Userbenchmark Responds to Criticism Over Score Weighing Revisions |url=https://www.tomshardware.com/news/userbenchmark-benchmark-change-criticism-amd-intel,40032.html |access-date=2025-01-08 |website=Tom's Hardware |language=en |archive-date=2024-12-25 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20241225230428/https://www.tomshardware.com/news/userbenchmark-benchmark-change-criticism-amd-intel,40032.html |url-status=live }}</ref>
 
References:
{{Reflist}}

Reason for proposed change: Remove emotive language and accurately reflect the sources cited.


2) From:

‚ÄúIn July 2019, UserBenchmark updated how it calculates the effective speed index<ref name=":1">{{Cite web |title=What is the effective CPU speed index? - Answers - UserBenchmark |url=https://cpu.userbenchmark.com/Faq/What-is-the-effective-CPU-speed-index/55 |access-date=2025-01-08 |website= UserBenchmark.com |archive-date=2024-11-20 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20241120100933/https://cpu.userbenchmark.com/Faq/What-is-the-effective-CPU-speed-index/55 |url-status=live }}</ref> on its website's CPU hardware rankings, drastically affecting the ranking positions of CPUs, which penalized AMD processors.<ref name=":2">{{Cite web |author1=Matthew Connatser |date=2019-07-28 |title=Updated: Userbenchmark Responds to Criticism Over Score Weighing Revisions |url=https://www.tomshardware.com/news/userbenchmark-benchmark-change-criticism-amd-intel,40032.html |access-date=2025-01-08 |website=Tom's Hardware |language=en |archive-date=2024-12-25 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20241225230428/https://www.tomshardware.com/news/userbenchmark-benchmark-change-criticism-amd-intel,40032.html |url-status=live }}</ref>‚Äù

to:

"In July 2019, UserBenchmark updated how it calculates the effective speed index<ref name=":1">{{Cite web |title=What is the effective CPU speed index? - Answers - UserBenchmark |url=https://cpu.userbenchmark.com/Faq/What-is-the-effective-CPU-speed-index/55 |access-date=2025-01-08 |website= UserBenchmark.com |archive-date=2024-11-20 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20241120100933/https://cpu.userbenchmark.com/Faq/What-is-the-effective-CPU-speed-index/55 |url-status=live }}</ref>  on its website's CPU hardware rankings, which resulted in Intel's i9-9900K CPU taking the top rank from AMD's high core-count Threadripper processors for gaming and desktop use. Some found the timing of the adjustments and the results suspicious. However, UserBenchmark responded that the effective speed indices are subject to frequent tuning and have been made more accurate by the change.<ref name=":2">{{Cite web |author1=Matthew Connatser |date=2019-07-28 |title=Updated: Userbenchmark Responds to Criticism Over Score Weighing Revisions |url=https://www.tomshardware.com/news/userbenchmark-benchmark-change-criticism-amd-intel,40032.html |access-date=2025-01-08 |website=Tom's Hardware |language=en |archive-date=2024-12-25 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20241225230428/https://www.tomshardware.com/news/userbenchmark-benchmark-change-criticism-amd-intel,40032.html |url-status=live }}</ref>‚Äù

References:
{{Reflist}}

Reason for proposed change: Remove emotive language and accurately reflect the sources cited.


3) From:

‚ÄúThis resulted in backlash on social media, with some hardware enthusiast boards banning links to the UserBenchmark website.<ref name=":4">{{Cite web |last=eTeknix.com |date=2020-04-22 |title=UserBenchmark Gets Banned From 3 Huge Reddit Groups |url=https://www.eteknix.com/userbenchmark-gets-banned-from-3-huge-reddit-groups/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240523145532/https://www.eteknix.com/userbenchmark-gets-banned-from-3-huge-reddit-groups/ |archive-date=2024-05-23 |access-date=2025-01-08 |website=eTeknix |language=en-GB}}</ref>‚Äù

to:

‚ÄúSome hardware enthusiast boards later banned links to the UserBenchmark website.<ref name=":4">{{Cite web |last=eTeknix.com |date=2020-04-22 |title=UserBenchmark Gets Banned From 3 Huge Reddit Groups |url=https://www.eteknix.com/userbenchmark-gets-banned-from-3-huge-reddit-groups/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240523145532/https://www.eteknix.com/userbenchmark-gets-banned-from-3-huge-reddit-groups/ |archive-date=2024-05-23 |access-date=2025-01-08 |website=eTeknix |language=en-GB}}</ref>‚Äù
 
References:
{{Reflist}}

Reason for proposed change: to more accurately reflect the timing of the ban and remove the direct attribution of this action to the CPU index update, as per the original citation.


Thanks in advance. [[User:PeteskiPete|PeteskiPete]] ([[User talk:PeteskiPete|talk]]) 17:09, 29 May 2025 (UTC)}}

A debate has arisen regarding what is the proper definition for "tank battle" over on [[Talk:Operation Brevity#"Tank Battle"?]]. There appear to be two competing definitions up for selection. Which of the following definitions should be used when deciding whether to classify a military engagement on Wikipedia as a "tank battle"?
:'''(A)''' A "tank battle" should be defined as any military engagement where tanks are employed by at least one side.
:'''(B)''' A "tank battle" should only refer to military engagements where tank-on-tank combat constituted a significant proportion of the fighting.

=== [[Talk:George W. Bush#rfc_0765F7F|Talk:George W. Bush]] expired 2025-06-07 06:01 ===
* Id: 0765F7F
* User: Mosi Nuru
* Date: 2025-06-07 04:49:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1294343468|BIO 1294343468}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1294343474|POL 1294343474}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1294348514|BIO 1294348514}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1294348515|POL 1294348515}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
On June 6, I made a fairly extensive set of edits intended to make the opening section more neutral, specific, and encyclopedic in tone. These were mass reverted by another user. After taking it to the user's talk page, we couldn't come to an agreement. To avoid an edit war, I'd request that other users weigh in.

My edits, and the reversions, can both be seen here.

https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=George_W._Bush&diff=prev&oldid=1294337508

The edits cover a wide range of issues rather than a single theme, but some of the areas that I think it is most important to undo the revert include:

‚Ä¢Giving specific years of Bush's military service instead of vaguely saying "his twenties" and avoiding weird language like "Bush flew warplanes" as opposed to "Bush served in the Air National Guard." "From 1968 to 1974, during the [[Vietnam War]], Bush served in the [[Air National Guard]], though he never deployed to Vietnam." instead of "Bush flew warplanes in the [[Texas Air National Guard]] in his twenties."

‚Ä¢Using clear, specific language like "two major pieces of tax legislation, commonly referred to as the 'Bush tax cuts'" instead of "a major tax-cut program."

‚Ä¢Providing more detail on the 2006 election, as in "Bush's declining public approval contributed to the outcome of the [[2006 United States elections]], a [[Wave elections in the United States|wave election]] where the opposing [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic Party]] won majorities in both the [[United States House of Representatives|House of Representatives]] and [[United States Senate|Senate]]" as opposed to "Amid his unpopularity, the Democrats regained control of Congress in the [[2006 United States elections|2006 elections]]."

My preferred solution is to '''undo the revert and return to "Revision as of 02:37, 7 June 2025"'''

[[User:Mosi Nuru|Mosi Nuru]] ([[User talk:Mosi Nuru|talk]]) 04:49, 7 June 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Roseto effect#rfc_D745C2B|Talk:Roseto effect]] expired 2025-06-08 03:01 ===
* Id: D745C2B
* User: Ke4roh
* Date: 2025-05-09 02:23:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1289511280|SCI 1289511280}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1289511282|SOC 1289511282}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1294502674|SCI 1294502674}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1294502678|SOC 1294502678}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There is an ongoing disagreement on this talk page[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talk:Roseto_effect#Sourcing] about the sourcing and notability of the article on the Roseto Effect. One editor has argued that there are no MEDRS-compliant sources that explicitly discuss the Roseto Effect and therefore the article fails WP:MEDRS and WP:NOTABILITY. Another editor contends that while the term is not widely used in modern medical literature, the original Roseto studies are historically notable and have been covered in multiple reliable secondary sources (e.g., JAMA, AJPH, Chicago Tribune), and that the article has been updated to frame the effect as a historical concept rather than a current medical claim.

The current version includes:
* Historical peer-reviewed sources describing the phenomenon (Stout et al. 1964; Egolf et al. 1992)
* Modern scholarly analysis of the Roseto case (Coste & Glatron 2024)
* Systematic reviews and meta-analyses on the general relationship between social cohesion and cardiovascular health, used to contextualize (not synthesize) the broader topic

It does not include (but has previously):
* A 2024 preprint critique of the original Roseto effect research (clearly labeled as such)

Question: Is the current version of the article (as of [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Roseto_effect&oldid=1289279772]) appropriately framed and sourced under Wikipedia policy? If not, what changes would you recommend ‚Äî merging, renaming, restructuring, or something else?

All input welcome ‚Äî thanks. -- [[User:Ke4roh|ke4roh]] ([[User talk:Ke4roh|talk]]) 02:23, 9 May 2025 (UTC)}}

{{rfcquote|text=
In the [[Russo-Crimean Wars]] article, should the section titled "Russo‚ÄìCrimean War (1571-1572)" be split into two different sections, "The Fire of Moscow (1571)" and "The Battle of Molodi", with the accompanying respective content? If so, should two separate infoboxes be included in these new sections?--[[User:3family6|3family6]] ([[User talk:3family6|Talk to me]]<nowiki>|</nowiki>[[Special:Contributions/3family6|See what I have done]]) 19:35, 3 June 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Besor Stream#rfc_E40F2E4|Talk:Besor Stream]] expired 2025-06-08 23:01 ===
* Id: E40F2E4
* User: Closetside
* Date: 2025-05-09 22:20:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1289647258|HIST 1289647258}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1289647267|POL 1289647267}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1294636106|HIST 1294636106}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1294636113|POL 1294636113}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
<s>Is the main source of the Besor stream</s>  <ins>Does the channel designated as the Nahal Besor start</ins> in the northwestern Negev (Mount Boker) or in the Hebron Hills of the West Bank? Or should both sources be treated equally (i.e. there is no main source)?</s> [[User:Closetside|Closetside]] ([[User talk:Closetside|talk]]) 22:20, 9 May 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Traditional Chinese medicine#rfc_0B74667|Talk:Traditional Chinese medicine]] expired 2025-06-09 20:01 ===
* Id: 0B74667
* User: YellowFlag
* Date: 2025-06-09 10:27:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1294714812|SCI 1294714812}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1294714817|SOC 1294714817}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1294785523|SCI 1294785523}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1294785529|SOC 1294785529}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I am requesting an RFC on whether recent peer-reviewed research on Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM) can be proportionally reflected in the article's lead to better comply with WP:NPOV, WP:RS, WP:DUE, and WP:SUMMARY.

The current lead heavily emphasises the pseudoscientific status of TCM while minimising the existence of a growing body of high-quality academic literature exploring physiological mechanisms (such as gut microbiota interactions, neuroimmune pathways, and systems biology models), published in RS-compliant journals.

I proposed limited, policy-compliant updates to reflect the existence of such research without making efficacy claims or violating WP:MEDRS. 

My proposed sources include:

- The New England Journal of Medicine (Eisenberg et al. 1993, doi:10.1056/NEJM199301283280406) 

- The Lancet (Tang et al. 2008, doi:10.1016/S0140-6736(08)61354-9) 

- Pharmacology & Therapeutics (Yuan & Lin, 2000) 

- Frontiers in Pharmacology (Li et al. 2020, Zhou et al. 2021) - NCCIH (official NIH center on complementary medicine)

A full discussion and dispute resolution process has already occurred at the DRN: [[Wikipedia:Dispute resolution noticeboard#Traditional Chinese Medicine|Link to DRN filing]]

I am requesting community input to determine whether limited neutral inclusion of these RS sources is appropriate under existing policy.

Thank you. [[User:YellowFlag|YellowFlag]] ([[User talk:YellowFlag|talk]]) 10:27, 9 June 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Capital letters#rfc_D31633F|Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Capital letters]] expired 2025-06-10 23:01 ===
* Id: D31633F
* User: Sammy D III
* Date: 2025-06-10 21:29:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1294967480|STYLE 1294967480}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1294973880|STYLE 1294973880}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There have been questions about what a proper name is and how it is identified. There seem to be different problems with objects, actions, and maybe ideas. I am going to start with "objects" here, they are simpler. Others can expand to actions.
 
Simply, could a manufacturer create a name for an object they make using their choice of letters and generic words in either upper or lower case? What Reliable Source is needed to show what the object's proper name is?
 
* Possible spellings: Acme Shovel - Acme SHOVEL - Acme shoVel - Acme shovel - acme shovel.
 
* Possible sources: - Name on object - Name in company document - Name in government document - Name in sources used - Name in potential sources - Name used most often (Commonname).
 
:: To start things going, my ''opinion'' (I will not take a position): A manufacturer can name its product whatever it wants. Any copyright or trade-mark problem is the manufacturer's unless it affects Wikipedia "legallty".
 
:: For sources, (always "most") company documents. Government documents. Any RS used in the article. No image of object, even if a proper name is clearly visible (images are almost never RS).
 
:: Any source "against" a proper name must specifically exclude it. Simply not using the proper name doesn't mean that it isn't a proper name. A word can be used both as a proper name and generically in the same source.
 
To be clear, I am not asking about MOS grammar, or when to use a proper name, only what a proper name is.
 
Thank you to anyone who shows up. [[User:Sammy D III|Sammy D III]] ([[User talk:Sammy D III|talk]]) 21:29, 10 June 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Biographies of living persons#rfc_2CD5463|Wikipedia talk:Biographies of living persons]] expired 2025-06-11 16:01 ===
* Id: 2CD5463
* User: Nemov
* Date: 2025-05-12 15:30:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1290064603|BIO 1290064603}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1290064611|POLICY 1290064611}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1290064614|PROP 1290064614}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1295083843|BIO 1295083843}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1295083851|POLICY 1295083851}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1295083854|PROP 1295083854}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This RfC proposes improving the wording of the existing [[WP:BLPCRIME]] policy. The intent is {{strong|not to change the policy or principles}}. The goal is to make the guidance {{strong|clearer and easier to apply}}. Below is the current wording followed by the proposed revision.

'''Current version'''
:{{tq|A living person accused of a crime is [[presumption of innocence|presumed innocent]] until convicted by a court of law. Accusations, investigations, arrests and charges do not amount to a conviction. For individuals who are [[WP:NOTPUBLICFIGURE|not public figures]]‚Äîthat is, individuals not covered by {{section link||Public figures}}‚Äîeditors must seriously consider {{strong|not}} including material{{efn|name=namerfc}}‚Äîin any article‚Äîthat suggests the person has committed or is accused of having committed a crime, unless a conviction has been secured for that crime.}}
:
:{{tq|If different judicial proceedings result in seemingly contradictory outcomes that do not overrule each other,{{efn|For example, [[O. J. Simpson]] was [[O. J. Simpson murder case|acquitted]] in 1995 of the murder of [[Nicole Brown Simpson]] and [[Ronald Goldman]], but was later found liable for their [[wrongful death]]s in a civil trial.}} include sufficient explanatory information.}}
:
'''Proposed version'''
:{{tq|A living person accused of a crime is [[presumption of innocence|presumed innocent]] until convicted by a court of law. Accusations, investigations, arrests, and charges do not amount to a conviction. For individuals who are [[WP:NOTPUBLICFIGURE|not public figures]]‚Äîthat is, individuals not covered by {{section link||Public figures}}‚Äîeditors must seriously consider not including material{{efn|name=namerfc}}‚Äîin any article‚Äîthat suggests the person has committed or is accused of committing a crime, unless a conviction has been secured. If different judicial proceedings result in seemingly contradictory outcomes that do not overrule each other,{{efn|For example, [[O. J. Simpson]] was [[O. J. Simpson murder case|acquitted]] in 1995 of the murder of [[Nicole Brown Simpson]] and [[Ronald Goldman]], but was later found liable for their [[wrongful death]]s in a civil trial.}} sufficient explanatory information should be included.}}
:
:{{tq|When deciding whether to name a living or recently deceased person in connection with a crime, editors should assess the stage of proceedings as a spectrum: {{strong|person of interest < arrested < charged < on trial < convicted}}. The earlier the stage, the higher the threshold for inclusion. Names should rarely be included for persons of interest. For convicted individuals, names are generally appropriate unless exceptional circumstances apply. For intermediate stages, editors must carefully weigh factors such as the extent and quality of reliable sourcing, whether the subject is a minor, and the person‚Äôs public status.}}

Please comment below. Thanks! [[User:Nemov|Nemov]] ([[User talk:Nemov|talk]]) 15:30, 12 May 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Scientology#rfc_D6D048B|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Scientology]] expired 2025-06-12 01:01 ===
* Id: D6D048B
* Date: 2025-05-13 00:42:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|1290133146|LANG 1290133146}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1290133150|RELI 1290133150}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|1295148214|LANG 1295148214}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1295148215|RELI 1295148215}}

{{rfcquote|text=
This RfC seeks wider community input to obtain a consensus and resolve [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Scientology#Open discussion about categorizing Hubbard's Scientology books|ongoing disagreements]] over how Scientology book-articles should generally be '''categorized''' within Wikipedia, and how the '''genre''' should be listed in an infobox.
