There are currently 10 standalone book-articles, which are summarized at {{Section link|Bibliography of Scientology|Books}} (the ones which are wiki-linked). <span style="text-shadow:#000 0em 0em 1em">[[User:Grorp|<span style="color:#6a0dad"> &nbsp;&nbsp;‚ñ∂ I am Grorp ‚óÄ </span>]]</span> 00:42, 13 May 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Biography#rfc_36C680D|Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Biography]] expired 2025-06-13 01:02 ===
* Id: 36C680D
* User: MWFwiki
* Date: 2025-05-14 00:10:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1290310682|BIO 1290310682}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1290310684|STYLE 1290310684}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1295313004|BIO 1295313004}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1295313011|STYLE 1295313011}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the provision [[MOS:POSTNOM]] (under [[WP:MOSBIO]]) that allows [[post-nominal letters]] only outside the <u>'''''LEAD SENTENCE'''''</u> be overturned, maintained, or modified? Specifically, the guideline currently reads: {{tq|"When the subject of an article has received honours or appointments issued either by the subject's state of citizenship or residence, or by a widely recognized organization that reliable sources regularly associate with the subject, post‚Äênominal letters may be included in any part of the article other than the lead sentence."}} Obviously, this RfC would also invite alternative solutions, etc. I will add options if so-requested. As such;

*'''Option 1''': ''Full Reversal of the Exclusion''
**Overturn the existing guideline entirely so that post‚Äênominal letters may be included in the lead sentence. Order will be determined by awarding-nation's order of precedence (I.e. the higher-ranking award is listed first after the name). If one award is from one nation, and the second award is from another nation, list them in chronological order of receipt (assuming they do not recognize each other, such as Commonwealth awards).
*'''Option 2''': ''Maintain MOS:POSTNOM As-Is''
**Maintain existing guidelines.
*'''Option 3''': ''Conditional Inclusion Based on Infobox Presence''
**Allow post‚Äênominal letters in the lead sentence only when an infobox is absent. If an article provides an infobox, then post‚Äênominals should be confined there (with full details in the body text '''''OTHER THAN THE LEAD SENTENCE''''').
*'''Option 4''': ''Partial Inclusion with Limits''
** Allow a limited number of post‚Äênominal letters (for example, one or two of the most important honors) to remain in the lead sentence, with any extra post‚Äênominals moved into the infobox or detailed in the article body. Order will be determined by awarding-nation's order of precedence (I.e. the higher-ranking award is listed first). If one award is from one nation, and the second award is from another nation, list them in order of receipt (assuming they do not recognize each other, such as Commonwealth awards).
*'''Option 5''': ''Open-Ended Policy''
**Refrain from requiring ''or'' excluding post-nominals within the guidelines. Refrain from limiting the number of post-nominals in either the lead, body, or infobox. Require consensus on an article-by-article basis on their relevant Talk pages (if-so required).

AGAIN, THIS PERTAINS TO THE <u>'''''LEAD SENTENCE'''''</u> OF AN ARTICLE. 

EDIT: the order of precedence stuff can probably be ignored.<br />
EDIT 2: For transparency, I have attempted to manually ping each participant in the original discussion. I apologize if I missed you, it was a long discussion and my thumbs and eyes grow weary.

This RfC invites discussion on whether excluding post‚Äênominals from the lead remains justified, or if a revision is warranted given concerns about clarity, consistency, and the conveyance of useful information. [[Wikipedia_talk:Manual_of_Style/Biography#MOS:POSTNOM|The original discussion]] was not an RfC proper, and as such, I have taken it upon myself to start one. The discussion was productive enough that I feel it warranted an RfC. This is my first RfC, so, I apologize in advance for any mistakes.

[[User:MWFwiki|MWFwiki]] ([[User talk:MWFwiki|talk]]) 00:10, 14 May 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of active separatist movements in Europe#rfc_8536092|Talk:List of active separatist movements in Europe]] expired 2025-06-15 19:01 ===
* Id: 8536092
* User: Joy
* Date: 2025-05-16 18:48:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1290738310|POL 1290738310}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1295767566|POL 1295767566}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This list has been tagged for original research cleanup for eight years now. The criteria section is completely unreferenced, seemingly encouraging [[WP:OR|original research]] - instead of being consistent with the lists on the rest of the encyclopedia and depending on [[WP:RS|reliable sources]], it creates this sort of a hodgepodge of various claims. Its basic definition also contradicts the non-list main article on the topic (see [[#definition of separatist|above]]).

There don't seem to be any [[WP:NLIST|sources to the list as a whole]], it's mostly [[WP:NOTNEWS|newspaper articles]] about individual possibly qualifying items. Given how relatively easy it is to get a political claim published in a newspaper these days, this is a really shoddy basis for an encyclopedia article.

There's a fairly consistent formatting about how some "people" or "ethnic group" has separatist movements, but there's no nuance to it, which may well lead the average reader to [[WP:UNDUE|arbitrary conclusions]] about the notability or significance of each of these.

There's a consistent stream of complaints on the Talk page that have been getting largely ignored for many years now. Nobody seems to be seriously reacting to this, so I'm bringing it up as an RFC to try to bring more attention to it. --[[User:Joy|Joy]] ([[User talk:Joy|talk]]) 18:48, 16 May 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:2025 India‚ÄìPakistan conflict#rfc_993ECB7|Talk:2025 India‚ÄìPakistan conflict]] expired 2025-06-18 09:01 ===
* Id: 993ECB7
* User: Rightmostdoor6
* Date: 2025-05-19 08:15:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1291136218|HIST 1291136218}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1291136220|POL 1291136220}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1296172698|HIST 1296172698}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1296172700|POL 1296172700}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I think this RfC is pretty much needed to decide the design of infobox. Looking at the above [[Talk:2025 India‚ÄìPakistan conflict/Archive 6#Indian casualties (third party)|discussion]], I have encountered reluctant opinions to go with my proposal, but if not trivially then it could be done with general consensus here. The Independent sources hold indefinite and varying values of the Indian casualties:
*[https://observers.france24.com/en/asia-pacific/20250512-india-pakistan-conflict-rafale-fighter-jets-shot-down-images-debunked France 24 (Debunking other losses but consonant with one Rafale loss)]: {{tq|Only one French aircraft may have been shot down.}} 
*[https://www.reuters.com/world/pakistans-chinese-made-jet-brought-down-two-indian-fighter-aircraft-us-officials-2025-05-08/ Reuters(Based on unknown US officials and written in jargon tone)]: {{tq|A top Chinese-made Pakistani fighter plane shot down at least two Indian military aircraft on Wednesday, two U.S. officials told Reuters, marking a major milestone for Beijing's advanced fighter jet...Another official said at least one Indian jet that was shot down was a French-made Rafale fighter aircraft.}}
*aje dot io slash a5inmx Al Jazeera: {{tq|Reuters news agency also reported, citing four government sources in Indian-administered Kashmir, that three fighter jets crashed in the region. Reports in CNN said that at least two jets crashed, while a French source told the US outlet that at least one Rafale jet had been shot down.}}
*[https://www.barrons.com/news/three-indian-fighter-jets-crashed-on-home-territory-cause-unknown-indian-security-source-c8d544c0 AFP (Another unknown source with no hard evidence)]: {{tq|Three Indian fighter jets crashed on Wednesday on home territory, a senior Indian security source said, without giving the cause.}}
*[https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2025/05/09/fighter-jets-india-pakistan-attack/ The Washington Post (Evidence based report)]: {{tq|India‚Äôs air force appears to have lost at least two fighter jets, including one of its most advanced models, during attacks Wednesday morning on sites in Pakistan and Pakistani-administered Kashmir, according to a review of visual evidence by The Washington Post.}}
Given the above explanation, what should be the statement in the infobox "Third party claim"?
#'''Option 1''': 1‚Äî3 aircraft shot down or lost. 
#'''Option 2''': Omit from infobox. 
#'''Option 3''': 3 aircraft shot down or lost. [[User:Rightmostdoor6|Rightmostdoor6]] ([[User talk:Rightmostdoor6|talk]]) 08:15, 19 May 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Bella Hadid#rfc_F8FB89C|Talk:Bella Hadid]] expired 2025-06-18 16:01 ===
* Id: F8FB89C
* User: FortunateSons
* Date: 2025-05-19 15:23:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1291181844|BIO 1291181844}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1291181851|POL 1291181851}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1296214541|BIO 1296214541}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1296214546|POL 1296214546}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Is the following or a similar phrasing and sourcing due and appropriate for inclusion:

{{quote|She participated in the [[Gaza war protests]] and called Israel's actions in the [[Gaza Strip]] "genocide."<ref>{{cite news |title=Adidas drops Bella Hadid from campaign referencing 1972 Munich Olympics |url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/7/19/adidas-drops-bella-hadid-from-campaign-referencing-1972-munich-olympics |work=Al Jazeera |date=July 19, 2024}}</ref> Hadid stated that she and her family have received death threats for their pro-Palestinian stance, saying: "I've been sent hundreds of death threats daily, my phone number has been leaked, and my family has felt to be in danger. But I can not be silenced any longer. Fear is not an option."<ref>{{cite news |last1=Zhan |first1=Jennifer |title=Bella Hadid Says Palestine ‚ÄòCannot Afford Our Silence‚Äô |url=https://www.vulture.com/2023/10/bella-hadid-palestine-israel-statement.html |work=[[Vulture (magazine)|Vulture]] |date=October 26, 2023}}</ref> In November 2023, Israeli music duo Ness & Stilla released the single ''"[[Harbu Darbu]]"'',<ref>{{cite news |last1=Fiske |first1=Gavriel |title=Hip-hop war anthem reaches number one in Israel |url=https://www.timesofisrael.com/hip-hop-war-anthem-reaches-number-one-in-israel/ |work=The Times of Israel |date=November 21, 2023 |archive-date=December 2, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231202212635/https://www.timesofisrael.com/hip-hop-war-anthem-reaches-number-one-in-israel/ |url-status=live }}</ref> which called for her death.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Zitser |first1=Joshua |title=Israel's Gen Z is dancing to a war song that celebrates bombing Gaza and names Dua Lipa and Bella Hadid as enemies |url=https://www.businessinsider.com/israel-gen-z-tiktok-harbu-darbu-song-supporting-gaza-bombing-2023-12 |work=Business Insider |date=December 12, 2023}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Israel split by song calling for death of Dua Lipa and Bella Hadid |url=https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/israel-split-by-song-calling-for-death-of-dua-lipa-and-bella-hadid-xcb53tppq |work=[[The Times]] |date=February 14, 2024}}</ref>}} 

[[User:FortunateSons|FortunateSons]] ([[User talk:FortunateSons|talk]]) 15:23, 19 May 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Dragon Age: The Veilguard#rfc_7AB371B|Talk:Dragon Age: The Veilguard]] expired 2025-06-18 18:01 ===
* Id: 7AB371B
* User: ImaginesTigers
* Date: 2025-05-20 12:50:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1291347564|MEDIA 1291347564}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1296353056|MEDIA 1296353056}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This RfC concerns what content to include in the lead, starting with the sales information.
;Sales information
{{Ordered list |type=upper-alpha
|Do not include ''Veilguard''{{'s}} commercial performance
|Include unit sales only; e.g., {{tq|By year-end 2024, Electronics Art said the game had reached 1.5 million players}}.
|Include commercial performance in relation to publisher's expectation only; e.g., {{tq|According to Electronic Arts, the game missed their commercial expectations by around 50%.}}
|Include unit sales and publisher expectations; e.g., {{tq|''Veilguard'' reached 1.5 million players by year-end 2024, missing EA's expectations by nearly 50%.}}
|Include unit sales, publisher expectations, and performance against previous EA releases; e.g., {{tq|Reaching 1.5 million players by year-end 2024, Veilguard outperformed Electronic Arts' previous single-player games but did not meet the publisher's expectations}}.
|Other; provide proposed content alongside your vote.
}}

‚Äî '''''[[User:ImaginesTigers|ImaginesTigers]]''''' ([[User talk:ImaginesTigers|talk]]) 12:50, 20 May 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Requests for comment/Temporary account IP-viewer#rfc_6E5B591|Wikipedia:Requests for comment/Temporary account IP-viewer]] expired 2025-06-21 19:01 ===
* Id: 6E5B591
* User: Voorts
* Date: 2025-06-21 17:01:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1296702199|POLICY 1296702199}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1296702204|PROP 1296702204}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1296709442|POLICY 1296709442}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1296709448|PROP 1296709448}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
== Background '''

: ''[[Special:PermanentLink/1296464986#Adding checkuser-temporary-account to rollbackers and NPP folks|Discussion]] preceding this RfC and ongoing discussion about the intersection of TAIV and other user rights.''
:''See also [[:mw:Trust and Safety Product/Temporary Accounts/FAQ|this FAQ]].''

The WMF is removing public access to IP addresses and replacing them with [[:mw:Trust and Safety Product/Temporary Accounts|temporary accounts]]. (This will not affect visibility of IP addresses or edits from before implementation.) Temporary accounts are tied to [[browser cookie]]s, which are set to expire three months from the first edit. This means that they will be different across [[web browser]]s and devices. The WMF has determined that temporary accounts are necessary to protect user privacy and comply with legal requirements, while maintaining the ability to edit Wikimedia sites anonymously.

The WMF has also created a new user right for [[foundation:Policy:Wikimedia Access to Temporary Account IP Addresses Policy|access to temporary account IP addresses]], which has come to be known as temporary account IP-viewer (TAIV). The minimum criteria for editors (other than functionaries, 'crats, and admins) seeking the user right are:

# minimum account age of 6 months and 300 edits;
# specifically applying for access;
# opting in for access via Special:Preferences; and
# "[a]gree[ing] to use the IP addresses in accordance with these guidelines, solely for the investigation or prevention of vandalism, abuse, or other violations of Wikimedia Foundation or community policies, and understand[ing] the risks and responsibilities associated with this privilege".

Activation and use of the right will be [[WP:log|log]]ged.

Users who are site-blocked will lose the user right. [[:meta:Steward|Steward]]s may revoke the right upon request at [[:meta:Steward requests/Permissions#Removal of access]] "if the user is determined to have misused the temporary account IP addresses or local community consensus dictates removal."

''' Questions '''

'''Question 1''': Should we adopt the minimum or heightened standards for TAIV? If the latter, please specify.

'''Question 2''': Should we authorize any of the following actors to request removal of TAIV upon evidence of misuse of the right?
* '''Option A''': the Arbitration Committee or its delegates
* '''Option B''': a consensus of (i) functionaries, (ii) 'crats, or (iii) admins
* '''Option C''': individual (i) functionaries, (ii) 'crats, or (iii) admins

''' Survey (Question 1) '''

* '''Option 1A''': (i) 500 edits/6 months and (ii) a demonstrated need for TAIV, as evidenced by counter-vandalism work, participation in NPP or AfC, sock hunting, etc. You should at least have extended confirmed to get this user right. The demonstrated need requirement is to ensure editors have a good track record and prevent abuse up front. I do not believe that we need to specify that editors should not be blocked or banned because I think that should usually be heavily weighed against an editor seeking any permission. [[User:Voorts|voorts]] ([[User talk:Voorts|talk]]/[[Special:Contributions/Voorts|contributions]]) 17:01, 21 June 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Naming conventions (definite or indefinite article at beginning of name)#rfc_32F242D|Wikipedia talk:Naming conventions (definite or indefinite article at beginning of name)]] expired 2025-06-21 21:01 ===
* Id: 32F242D
* User: Ladtrack
* Date: 2025-05-22 20:34:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1291697441|POLICY 1291697441}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1296723405|POLICY 1296723405}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
In 2014, there was [[Wikipedia talk:Naming conventions (definite or indefinite article at beginning of name)/Archive 2#RfC|an RfC]] about using definite articles to achieve natural disambiguation. I have copied the proposal almost exactly below (only fixing some links that have changed since then), although I would urge all participants to read the RfC itself. 
:Is putting "The" at the beginning of an article title an acceptable innovation for [[WP:NATURAL]] [[Wikipedia:D|disambiguation]]?
:Context: Recently, [[Talk:Hulk/Archive 6#Requested move|a move request]] at [[Hulk (comics)]] to [[Hulk (disambiguation)|Hulk]] resulted in a "no consensus" close. Multiple editors, while perhaps opposing the proposed move, suggested moving [[Hulk (comics)]] to [[The Hulk]] instead (as [[The Hulk]] already redirects there). [[User:Tenebrae|One editor]] intelligently noticed that [[WP:THE]] currently is directly opposed to that, as per its dictum that [[The Joker]] redirect to [[Joker (comics)]], and not vice-versa. But should that be the case?
:Please respond '''support '''if you believe adding "the" is OK in order to disambiguate.
:Please respond '''oppose '''if you think adding "the" should not be allowed, as is currently the case.
:Thanks for helping Wikipedia. 
For additional context, the article currently located at [[Hulk]] was then at [[Hulk (comics)]]. 

The RfC was closed as follows: 
:Result: '''The definite article may be used to disambiguate articles in certain circumstances.'''
:There were 8 supports and 4 opposes. One oppose was based on the objection that the DABNAME guidance would be affected, but how this was the case was not explained and it doesn't seem true to me (nothing stemming from what has been discussed here would mean we would not retain the DAB page [[Hulk (disambiguation)|Hulk]], for example). A second oppose was made on the basis that "the" should only be used if it is part of the formal name of the article subject. However, that argument seems contrary to [[WP:COMMONNAME]]. A third oppose suggests that "the" is insufficient disambiguation because we use it in many articles. I can't work out if there is a typo in the comment or not, but this doesn't make sense to me as an argument. The fourth oppose was on the basis that it would be confusing. I don't think any of these are knockout arguments, and so the numerical victory of the supports should be recognised.
:There also seems to be consensus that the applciation of the principle should be resticted to article titles where there is genuine natural disambiguation (e.g. one this is commonly called "The Foo", the other is called "Foo" and not normally "The Foo") and a genuine need for disambiguation. There also seems to be consensus that a case-by-case approach should be taken and common sense applied to avoid unnecessary confusion, and so that conflicting considerations can be taken into account.
To the best of my knowledge, no change was ever implemented after the closure of that RfC, and it has not been overturned or overruled by a subsequent RfC. 

Should [[WP:THE]] include some language that indicates that use of a definite article to achieve natural disambiguation is acceptable? 

An example of proposed language (although this is open to change) could be something like this as a third condition, after the first two listed:
:3. Use of definite articles is acceptable as a form of natural disambiguation, if the article is not the primary topic for the article title without parenthetical disambiguation.
Here are some articles whose titles might be different if this were to pass (all of these have redirects in the format of "the x"): 
:[[Charleston (dance)]] ‚Üí [[The Charleston]]
:[[Madonna (art)]] ‚Üí [[The Madonna]]
:[[Roundhouse (venue)]] ‚Üí [[The Roundhouse]]
:[[Penguin (character)]] ‚Üí [[The Penguin]]
:[[Politics (Aristotle)]] ‚Üí [[The Politics]]
[[User:Ladtrack|Ladtrack]] ([[User talk:Ladtrack|talk]]) 20:34, 22 May 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Scott Russell Surasky#rfc_A226334|Talk:Scott Russell Surasky]] expired 2025-06-23 14:01 ===
* Id: A226334
* User: Neurodoc99
* Date: 2025-06-23 12:59:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1296978397|BIO 1296978397}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
A continuing dispute concerns whether the subject of this article meets Wikipedia‚Äôs notability standards‚Äîspecifically [[WP:SIGCOV]] and [[WP:NBIO]]. The article now includes:

* National TV appearances as sole featured expert (Fox News, Newsmax, OANN)  
* A published book by a major publishing house (Simon & Schuster)  
* Accepted expert witness testimony in state and federal courts  
* Coverage in reliable independent sources (Fox Business, The Hill, Economic Times, New York Post)  

'''Question:''' Does the article in its current form meet the threshold of notability under [[WP:SIGCOV]] and [[WP:NBIO]]?

Please assess the article as it stands now‚Äînot based on its prior versions or past deletion history.

--[[User:Neurodoc99|Neurodoc99]] ([[User talk:Neurodoc99|talk]]) 12:59, 23 June 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Ice Hockey#rfc_F9B69A6|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Ice Hockey]] expired 2025-06-28 07:01 ===
* Id: F9B69A6
* User: Aspening
* Date: 2025-06-28 04:08:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1297734687|SOC 1297734687}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1297747748|SOC 1297747748}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I propose that professional players should be added to a player category when they are under contract and are on the official roster as listed on the league website, to align with when we would change the language in the article lead to say they play for their new teams. Players under contract but on LTIR or other non-roster status should not be added to the team category if they have not played for the team. An example is [[Shea Weber]], whose contract has been traded multiple times after his last game appearance. For players on two-way NHL contracts who have not played for that team before, wait until the player is on the opening-day roster. Amateur players such as NCAA or junior hockey players should not be added to player categories until they have played a game for the respective team due to the lack of binding contracts.
[[User:Aspening|Aspening]] ([[User talk:Aspening|talk]]) 04:08, 28 June 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of gangs in Australia#rfc_C79CDF5|Talk:List of gangs in Australia]] expired 2025-06-28 18:01 ===
* Id: C79CDF5
* User: 2405:6E00:62C:4A60:148D:B7C:243C:CA13
* Date: 2025-06-27 18:19:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|1297672943|UNSORTED 1297672943}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|1297815686|UNSORTED 1297815686}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Sorry I'm not really sure what the correct procedure is for this. I tried just asking above but nobody replied for over a week. This page worries me somewhat and I'm trying to find some people who might be able to help improve it.

It seems inappropriate to group everything into a bikie gang or an ethnic group. There are a few criminal gangs or violent political groups that are centred on a particular culture or ethnic group, but whoever started this page seems to have tried to sort everything that way.

A lot of the labels, and even the groups themselves, aren't locally relevant. Australians don't tend to group Spanish and Portuguese speakers from opposite sides of the Atlantic as a group, other than possibly "immigrants", the "Hispanic" concept is an American thing.

I'm not sure if everything in the white supremacist group is actually a white supremacist gang, some might be all white just by chance or locality, since that's the largest demographic in Australia.

[[Special:Contributions/2405:6E00:62C:4A60:148D:B7C:243C:CA13|2405:6E00:62C:4A60:148D:B7C:243C:CA13]] ([[User talk:2405:6E00:62C:4A60:148D:B7C:243C:CA13|talk]]) 18:19, 27 June 2025 (UTC)}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1298291041|HIST 1298291041}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1298291044|POL 1298291044}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Hey all, I came across a piece of information that might be relevant for inclusion in the article, I was thinking of saying something along the lines if relevant as ‚Äî (During his tenure as mayor of San Diego, Joshua Bean was involved in a controversial transaction in which he attempted to transfer ownership of City Hall and portions of the city‚Äôs pueblo lands to himself and Lieutenant Cave J. Couts. Although the legality of the sale was disputed, the property was ultimately restored to the city.)

However, the only source I‚Äôve located so far is from the San Diego Police Historical Association Museum, which seems to have drawn from the Wikipedia article on [[Joshua Bean]] itself: http://www.sdpolicemuseum.com/Joshua-Bean.html. So, as of now, it may be circular. If anyone can help locate a primary or third-party source to substantiate this, it could strengthen the article. [[User:Issac I Navarro|Issac I Navarro]] ([[User talk:Issac I Navarro|talk]]) 15:38, 1 June 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Kusaila#rfc_0438505|Talk:Kusaila]] expired 2025-07-03 23:01 ===
* Id: 0438505
* User: ElijahUHC
* Date: 2025-06-03 22:26:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1293830704|BIO 1293830704}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1293830711|HIST 1293830711}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1298671313|BIO 1298671313}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1298671315|HIST 1298671315}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the article on Kusaila include one of the available photographs of the modern (reinstalled) statue located in Bouhmama, Algeria, as the lead image?

There are two freely licensed photographs of the statue:
* A wider, uncropped version: [https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Kusaila_Statue1.jpg]
* A more tightly cropped version: [https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Kusaila_Ibn_Malzam.jpg]

Both are images of a modern public monument commemorating Kusaila, and have been proposed as alternatives to a previously used fictional drawing: [https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Aksel_(cropped).jpg], which was removed due to sourcing concerns. This RfC seeks input on whether either image should be used, and if so, which version is more appropriate.

(For additional context, see: [[Talk:Kusaila#c-ElijahUHC-20250602183300-Image_Change:_Statue_of_Kusaila_from_Bouhmama]])

[[User:ElijahUHC|<span style="color:darkorange;">'''ElijahUHC'''</span>]] [[User talk:ElijahUHC|<span style="color:darkorange;">(Talk)</span>]] 22:26, 3 June 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Main Page#rfc_67E2391|Talk:Main Page]] expired 2025-07-04 19:01 ===
* Id: 67E2391
* User: Dan Leonard
* Date: 2025-06-04 18:27:00

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
On behalf of [[User:Minilammas|Minilammas]] in the above discussion I'd like to propose an RFC on removing the main page's restriction on interlanguage links. This would permit readers to use the language dropdown menu's search box to find Wikipedias in any language. Note that this proposal ''does not affect'' the links advertised in the [[Main Page#mp-lang|Wikipedia languages]] section of the main page, which will continue to be handled by {{template link|Wikipedia languages}}.

Editors are encouraged to visit [[fi:Wikipedia:Etusivu|the main page of the Finnish Wikipedia]] for an example of this implementation. <span title="Signature of Dan Leonard">[[User:Dan Leonard|Dan Leonard]] ([[User talk:Dan Leonard|talk]]¬†‚Ä¢ [[Special:Contributions/Dan Leonard|contribs]])</span> 18:27, 4 June 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Chelsea Wolfe (BMX cyclist)#rfc_39EB4A3|Talk:Chelsea Wolfe (BMX cyclist)]] expired 2025-07-05 17:01 ===
* Id: 39EB4A3
* User: ArtemisiaGentileschiFan
* Date: 2025-06-05 16:48:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1294109931|BIO 1294109931}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1294109937|SOC 1294109937}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1298933844|BIO 1298933844}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1298933850|SOC 1298933850}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
It's my opinion that the subject of this article should be referred to as an "Olympian" and a "member of Team USA" based on quotes from sources. Particularly, [https://www.bicycling.com/racing/a44772359/chelsea-wolfe/ this source] which refers to her as {{tq|Olympian Chelsea Wolfe}} in the title and [https://web.archive.org/web/20240803035246/https://www.palmbeachpost.com/story/news/local/2021/07/30/bmx-rider-from-lake-park-will-make-history-as-first-team-usa-trans-athlete/5385995001/ this source] which refers to her as the {{tq|first out trans athlete on Team USA}}. Other users, {{u|Fram}} and {{u|Topcardi}}, argue that she does not qualify as an Olympian because she did not compete in the Olympics, and was only a reserve member of her team that would have competed if another teammate was unable to. My request for comment is asking if '''yes''', the article should refer to her as an "Olympian", or if '''no''', it should not. [[User:ArtemisiaGentileschiFan|ArtemisiaGentileschiFan]] ([[User talk:ArtemisiaGentileschiFan|talk]]) 16:48, 5 June 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Neurodiversity#rfc_28656E3|Talk:Neurodiversity]] expired 2025-07-05 19:01 ===
* Id: 28656E3
* User: Plasticwonder
* Date: 2025-07-05 08:05:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1298879308|SCI 1298879308}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1298879309|SOC 1298879309}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1298879311|STYLE 1298879311}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1298879314|POLICY 1298879314}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1298951677|SCI 1298951677}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1298951679|SOC 1298951679}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1298951682|STYLE 1298951682}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1298951686|POLICY 1298951686}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Does the community think that the following statement is relevant to the article:

{{xt|Autism scholar Jason Travers asserted that "the notion that ASD is caused or explained by impairments or differences in brain processing", while plausible, is "largely descriptive (rather than prescriptive)", and have "many hallmarks of pseudoscience", continuing that the proponents of the neurodiversity movement "aim to undermine evidence-based treatments".<ref>{{citation|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=NP-xEAAAQBAJ&dq=%22However%2C%20this%20perspective%20is%20largely%20descriptive%22&pg=PA285|page=285 and 290 |title=Pseudoscience in Therapy: A Skeptical Field Guide |isbn=978-1-316-51922-6 |date=March 23, 2023 |publisher=Cambridge University Press | vauthors = Hupp S, Santa Maria CL|quote="That is, the notion that ASD is caused or explained by impairments or differences in brain processing seems plausible. However, this perspective is largely descriptive (rather than prescriptive), has many hallmarks of pseudoscience, and has ushered in various treatments that are unsupported by rigorous experimental evidence......Sadly, vocal opposition to evidence-based treatments has become a prominent theme of the neurodiversity movement, particularly on social media and in some academic circles (e.g., disability studies; Broderick & Roscigno, 2021). In particular, some neurodiversity proponents aim to undermine evidence-based treatments rooted in applied behavior analysis." }}</ref>}}
{{reflist-talk}}
[[WP:RFCBEFORE]]-[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talk:Neurodiversity/Archive_2#Edit_and_reversion_regarding_phrenology here] [[User:Plasticwonder|Plasticwonder]] ([[User talk:Plasticwonder|talk]]) 08:05, 5 July 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Template talk:Lee Jae-myung series#rfc_48B09EC|Template talk:Lee Jae-myung series]] expired 2025-07-05 21:01 ===
* Id: 48B09EC
* User: Kaito-san
* Date: 2025-06-05 20:41:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1294138144|TECH 1294138144}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1298967377|TECH 1298967377}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I'm starting this RfC after a dispute came to the suggestion to start an RfC on whether to convert Lee Jae-myung's and other former South Korean presidents' series sidebars to navboxes for the bottom of articles. This is primarily dealing with interpretation of [[MOS:SANDWICH]], which says that one should avoid sandwiching text horizontally between two images, or between an image and an infobox, navigation template, etc. For the dispute of concern, see [[Template talk:Lee Jae-myung series#Convert to navbox for bottom]], which also got a [[WP:3O|third opinion]]. As of this RfC being started, the presidential seal and signature have been removed from the template, and [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template%3ALee_Jae-myung_series&diff=1294044701&oldid=1294043754 an attempt to restore them was reverted].
#'''Keep''': Keep the series sidebars unchanged.
#'''Remove images''': Remove the presidential seal and signature found on the bottom of series sidebars.
#'''Convert to navbox''': Convert to a navbox for the bottom of related articles. 
[[User:Kaito-san|Kaito-san]] ([[User talk:Kaito-san|talk]]/[[Special:Contributions/Kaito-san|contribs]]) 20:41, 5 June 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Aviation/Style guide/Layout (Aircraft)#rfc_0ACB46D|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Aviation/Style guide/Layout (Aircraft)]] expired 2025-07-06 05:02 ===
* Id: 0ACB46D
* User: Bimmons
* Date: 2025-06-06 04:16:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1294188443|SCI 1294188443}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1299032070|SCI 1299032070}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There is currently an impasse between several editors (including myself) on the topic of how to display an aircraft's specifications if there are several variants. For instance, the Boeing 737 Classic generation has 3 variants: The -300, -400, and -500. On several existing pages, these variants and their specifications (Such as range, physical dimensions, engine types, etc.) are listed in a large table which encompasses either the entire family of aircraft (See [[Boeing 747#Specifications]]) or for the specific generation (See [[Boeing 737 MAX#Specifications]]). However, under the Style guide these should be a single variant in a list (See [[Boeing 737 Next Generation#Specifications (Boeing 737-800 with CFM56-7B26 and winglets)]]) to minimize the amount of extraneous data. 

The disagreement comes in with which one should be used. The side I am on argues the tables give the most complete view of the variants while providing a quick reference lookup for data within the article. The side for the guidelines in the style argues that the tables violate [[Wikipedia:INDISCRIMINATE]] due to being too information dense, and that the singular variant model is more readable and better for reader understanding. 

My request for comment is whether '''We should follow the style guide''', or '''We should use the existing data tables.''' [[User:Bimmons|Bimmons]] ([[User talk:Bimmons|talk]]) 04:16, 6 June 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Kris (Deltarune)#rfc_2F6B48E|Talk:Kris (Deltarune)]] expired 2025-07-07 01:02 ===

{{rfcquote|text=
regarding how sources (official or otherwise) handle the topic, how should the article describe kris's gender? this rfc is "split" into two main parts:

* general description (stating they're non-binary, stating that certain sources describe them as non-binary, stating that "they/them" is used for kris, etc.)
* how this will reflect in the infobox (non-binary, ambiguous, no official gender, unknown, no gender field, etc.)

=== [[Talk:Islamism#rfc_8905CDF|Talk:Islamism]] expired 2025-07-07 19:01 ===
* Id: 8905CDF
* User: 119.154.238.97
* Date: 2025-07-07 00:48:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1299194821|POL 1299194821}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1299326361|POL 1299326361}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This is a formal Request for Comment regarding the lead sentence of the *Islamism* article. While discussion is ongoing above, I believe wider input is needed on the framing and definition of "Islamism" in the article's opening line. Please see full discussion and sources above. Summary of proposed change below:

Current lead:  
> ''Islamism is a range of religious and political ideological movements that believe that Islam should influence political systems.''

Proposed lead:  
> ''Islamism is a modern political term used to describe a range of ideological movements that seek to implement Islamic principles in government and public policy. The term is not found in classical Islamic texts and is used with varying meanings in academic and political discourse, often contested by those it is applied to.''

Do editors agree with revising the lead along these lines?
[[Special:Contributions/119.154.238.97|119.154.238.97]] ([[User talk:119.154.238.97|talk]]) 00:48, 7 July 2025 (UTC)}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1295262573|SOC 1295262573}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1300173849|MEDIA 1300173849}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1300173853|POL 1300173853}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1300173857|SOC 1300173857}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
{{color|green|Should the source be included? (question 1) If so, should it be included in the current manner, including the statement that the authors are "40 topic experts"? (question 2)}}

[https://journals.sagepub.com/doi/full/10.1177/03616843231202708 "The Misandry Myth: An Inaccurate Stereotype About Feminists‚Äô Attitudes Toward Men"] is currently included in the final sentence of the article's intro and the final paragraph of the article itself. Some users have argued that the source is [[WP:PRIMARY]], and that it is therefore against Wikipedia's guidelines to use it to claim empirical proof of controversial claims, such as "The false idea that misandry is commonplace among feminists is so widespread that it has been called the 'misandry myth' by 40 topic experts" and "feminist views of men were no different than that of non-feminists or men towards men." Other users have argued that the source is [[WP:SECONDARY]], and that it is therefore fine to include. Additionally, some users have argued that calling the authors "40 topic experts" is not adequately supported, while other users feel that being author of an academic article is enough reason to be called a "topic expert." [[User:Dekadoka|Dekadoka]] ([[User talk:Dekadoka|talk]]) 17:09, 12 June 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Template talk:Infobox government cabinet#rfc_1146007|Template talk:Infobox government cabinet]] expired 2025-07-13 10:01 ===
* Id: 1146007
* User: Impru20
* Date: 2025-06-13 09:08:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1295374119|POL 1295374119}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1300272960|POL 1300272960}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
During late 2024 to early 2025, there has been a tendency from multiple users (mostly IP and/or recently-created accounts) to add composition bars to the "Status in legislature" field in the infoboxes of cabinet/government-related articles. This situation has resulted in a number of issues that need to be addressed. Researching on this matter, I have found hardly any discussion or substantial input on this issue, meaning there is no explicit consensus for this (in fact, composition bars seem to have been added either unilaterally or in good faith by people who actually thought this was a widely-accepted formatting). Due to this affecting a wide range of articles, I believe a RfC is the most straightforward way to proceed. Thus, the question put forward is: should we include composition bars on legislature status in the infoboxes of cabinet articles, Yes or No? If Yes, how should it be formatted? [[User:Impru20|'''<span style="color:#E65B00;">Impru</span><span style="color:#0018A8;">20</span>''']]<sup>[[User talk:Impru20|talk]]</sup> 09:08, 13 June 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (idea lab)#rfc_070A36C|Wikipedia:Village pump (idea lab)]] expired 2025-07-16 19:01 ===
* Id: 070A36C
* User: Soni
* Date: 2025-07-16 16:53:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1300833777|POLICY 1300833777}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1300853747|POLICY 1300853747}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Of the 7 [[WP:RECALL]] petitions so far, at least three have some concerns at least adjacent to [[WP:INACTIVITY]] - [[Wikipedia:Administrator recall/Master Jay|Master Jay]], [[Wikipedia:Administrator recall/Gimmetrow|Gimmetrow]] and [[Wikipedia:Administrator recall/Night Gyr|Night Gyr]] (ongoing).

Currently admins are desysopped procedurally if they haven't made any edits/admin actions for 1 year OR have made less than 100 edits in 5 years. According to [[WP:RESTORATION]], adminship is generally restored at [[WP:BN]] unless there were 2 years without edits OR 5 years since last tool usage.

Clearly, many editors believe we need to update WP:INACTIVITY but there has been no RFCs attempted on how.

This is a preliminary RFC to ask two main questions -
* '''Q1:''' Do the thresholds for procedural desysoppings ( [[WP:INACTIVITY]] ) need changing? If yes, to what?
* '''Q2:''' On return from inactivity, when do they generally get the tools back? ( [[WP:RESTORATION]] )

I'm hoping this narrows solutions down sufficiently that a future yes/no proposal can gauge consensus later.

[[User:Soni|Soni]] ([[User talk:Soni|talk]])  16:53, 16 July 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of gangs in Australia#rfc_4F785AA|Talk:List of gangs in Australia]] expired 2025-07-20 11:01 ===
* Id: 4F785AA
* User: 2405:6E00:62C:4A60:148D:B7C:243C:CA13
* Date: 2025-06-27 18:19:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1297815681|POL 1297815681}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1297815685|SOC 1297815685}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1301541581|POL 1301541581}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1301541583|SOC 1301541583}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Sorry I'm not really sure what the correct procedure is for this. I tried just asking above but nobody replied for over a week. This page worries me somewhat and I'm trying to find some people who might be able to help improve it.

It seems inappropriate to group everything into a bikie gang or an ethnic group. There are a few criminal gangs or violent political groups that are centred on a particular culture or ethnic group, but whoever started this page seems to have tried to sort everything that way.

A lot of the labels, and even the groups themselves, aren't locally relevant. Australians don't tend to group Spanish and Portuguese speakers from opposite sides of the Atlantic as a group, other than possibly "immigrants", the "Hispanic" concept is an American thing.

I'm not sure if everything in the white supremacist group is actually a white supremacist gang, some might be all white just by chance or locality, since that's the largest demographic in Australia.

[[Special:Contributions/2405:6E00:62C:4A60:148D:B7C:243C:CA13|2405:6E00:62C:4A60:148D:B7C:243C:CA13]] ([[User talk:2405:6E00:62C:4A60:148D:B7C:243C:CA13|talk]]) 18:19, 27 June 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Spaceflight#rfc_A45B986|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Spaceflight]] expired 2025-07-21 16:01 ===
* Id: A45B986
* User: RickyCourtney
* Date: 2025-06-25 20:48:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1297380001|STYLE 1297380001}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1301773446|STYLE 1301773446}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should articles about spaceflight missions (e.g., launches and landings) present UTC first and local time in parentheses, or local time first and UTC in parentheses? The current [[:Wikipedia:WikiProject Spaceflight/Style guide|WikiProject Spaceflight style guide]] recommends listing UTC first as space is not within any Earth-bound time zone, while some editors argue this contradicts [[MOS:TIMEZONE]], which prioritizes local time where an event took place.

The goal of this RfC is to determine whether spaceflight articles should make an exception to MOS:TIMEZONE (if such a exception is needed) by standardizing on UTC first formatting, given the global and technical nature of these events. 

Examples of formatting options:
* UTC first and local time in parentheses: June 4, 2022, 13:25:02 UTC (9:25:02 am EDT)
* Local time first and UTC in parentheses: June 4, 2022, 9:25:02 am EDT (13:25:02 UTC)

Please share your thoughts and rationale below. -- [[User:RickyCourtney|RickyCourtney]] ([[User talk:RickyCourtney|talk]]) 20:48, 25 June 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Ahmed al-Sharaa#rfc_0CDE9C7|Talk:Ahmed al-Sharaa]] expired 2025-07-26 15:01 ===
* Id: 0CDE9C7
* Date: 2025-06-29 21:26:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1298004176|BIO 1298004176}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1298080626|POL 1298080626}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1302619985|BIO 1302619985}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1302619990|POL 1302619990}}

{{rfcquote|text=
Should we change the title to "interim president" or keep it as "President of Syria"? Most sources refer to him as 'Interim' [https://www.timesofisrael.com/six-months-after-assads-ouster-syria-faces-major-security-economic-challenges/], [https://www.france24.com/en/live-news/20250623-syria-president-vows-those-involved-in-church-attack-will-face-justice], [https://www.thenationalnews.com/news/mena/2025/06/07/syrias-interim-president-al-sharaa-makes-first-visit-to-daraa-birthplace-of-countrys-uprising/],[https://www.arabnews.com/node/2588340/middle-east], [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2025/3/30/syrian-president-unveils-transitional-government], [https://www.france24.com/en/live-news/20250329-%F0%9F%94%B4-syria-s-interim-president-ahmed-al-sharaa-announces-formation-of-new-transitional-government], [https://edition.cnn.com/2025/03/13/middleeast/syria-constitution-ap-intl], [https://abcnews.go.com/International/al-qaeda-syrias-presidency-rise-ahmad-al-sharaa/story?id=121788656] while others use 'President' [https://www.economist.com/middle-east-and-africa/2025/02/03/warlord-jihadi-or-nation-builder],[https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/syrias-rebel-leader-sharaa-assad-strongholds-rcna192436],[https://news.sky.com/story/who-is-syrian-rebel-leader-abu-mohammed-al-jolani-and-what-are-his-links-to-al-qaeda-13270212], [https://www.voanews.com/a/syria-president-calls-for-unity-after-reports-of-mass-killings/8004130.html], [https://nna-leb.gov.lb/en/regional/765517/syrian-president-al-sharaa-signs-draft-constitution], [https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2025/7/1/will-syria-normalise-relations-with-israel], [https://www.jpost.com/middle-east/article-859610], [https://www.whitehouse.gov/presidential-actions/2025/06/providing-for-the-revocation-of-syria-sanctions/], [https://www.axios.com/2025/06/30/trump-syria-sanctions-israel-deal]

To clarify, some media call him "interim president" for leading the [[Syrian transitional government|transitional government]], while others use "president" to reflect his current leadership. The [[2025 Interim Constitution of Syria|draft constitution]] affirms that he holds [[executive power]] and serves as [[Commander-in-Chief]]. <span style="font-family: Georgia; background-color: maroon; padding: 2px 3px 1px 3px;">[[User:HurricaneEdgar|<span style="color: greenyellow">HurricaneEdgar</span>]] [[HurricaneEdgar|<span style="color: greenyellow"></span>]]</span> 21:26, 29 June 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Middle East Media Research Institute#rfc_EF6E71D|Talk:Middle East Media Research Institute]] expired 2025-07-26 18:02 ===
* Id: EF6E71D
* User: AssanEcho
* Date: 2025-06-26 17:06:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1297516391|POL 1297516391}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1302641384|POL 1302641384}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Hello! This I am made this post an RFC due to the lack of consensus on whether or not the second paragraph of the lead should remain or not.
*The opposition to the current lead have stated that it is inaccurate and/or is from bad faith primary sources (Mona Baker is the main example given) and thus should be removed for giving [[WP:UNDUE]] weight to bad faith interpretations (at least in the lead).
*Editors who are positive of or neutral the current lead do not believe it is biased or that regardless of the quality of the sources of the criticism, that having a criticism in the lead is preferable since it is a notable aspect of organisation (my argument).
I do not believe I have any right to repeatedly revert edits rejecting the current lead when there is no clear consensus on this talk page on what to do regarding it, and that this is a fairly niche article so a talk page trying to solve this issue wouldn't probably wouldn't have much luck compared to the last few times. Thanks for reading! [[User:AssanEcho|AssanEcho]] ([[User talk:AssanEcho|talk]]) 17:06, 26 June 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Australian politics#rfc_AE0BB25|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Australian politics]] expired 2025-07-27 09:04 ===
* Id: AE0BB25
* User: AINH

Currently, most articles use <nowiki>{{Australian party style|Independent}}</nowiki> to refer to teal candidates in election articles. I propose changing it to <nowiki>{{Australian party style|Teal Independent}} and {{Australian politics/name|Teal Independent}}</nowiki> (Display as {{Australian politics/name|Teal Independent}} ) since they operate differently from other independents, and most reliable sources categorise them as such anyway, rather than just "independent" [https://www.abc.net.au/news/2025-04-08/climate-200-teal-independent-candidates-queensland-fed-election/105145466][https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/2025/may/10/what-next-for-teal-independent-candidates-after-2025-federal-election][https://www.afr.com/politics/federal/the-12-teal-battlegrounds-to-watch-out-for-this-election-20250217-p5lcq3][https://www.sbs.com.au/news/podcast-episode/who-are-the-teals/n9t05nqie][https://www.abc.net.au/news/2025-05-03/goldstein-voters-on-impact-of-teal-wave-in-federal-election/105247256]. The difference between the two groups should be noted. [[User:AINH|AINH]] ([[User talk:AINH|talk]]) 08:13, 27 June 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of The Simpsons Treehouse of Horror episodes#rfc_4385923|Talk:List of The Simpsons Treehouse of Horror episodes]] expired 2025-07-27 15:03 ===
* Id: 4385923
* User: Sollyucko
* Date: 2025-07-27 00:33:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1302695913|MEDIA 1302695913}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1302695919|SOC 1302695919}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1302805717|MEDIA 1302805717}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1302805720|SOC 1302805720}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the "Parody of" column '''include''' or '''exclude''' title-only references?

[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=1100430362&oldid=1100408251&title=List_of_The_Simpsons_Treehouse_of_Horror_episodes On July 25, 2022], [[User:Shivertimbers433]] added a note to the "Parody of" column header, stating that "Properties are only listed if a significant portion of the segment's plot is dedicated to parodying it, and has been cited by the show creators or a review published by a reliable source. Excluded are title-only references and brief jokes." However, this seems to be a unilateral decision rather than a consensus, and I am opposed to the "title-only references" part of this, so I am therefore bringing it up for debate.

My argument in favor of '''including''' title-only references is that readers are likely to want to know where the title of each segment comes from, and so unless it happens to also be parodied by enough of the main content, then readers will be unable to find that information here. Even if other one-off references are excluded (which I am fine with), I think title-only references should be exempt from that because titles generally bear much more importance and get much more attention than brief snippets of main content.

The main argument I assume for '''excluding''' them is that they could cause confusion and clutter, but if we agree on a uniform, concise formatting for them, I don't think that shouldn't be an issue. For example, a possible format could be "<main references>; title only: <title-only reference>", but I'm open to other formats.

[[User:Sollyucko|Solomon Ucko]] ([[User talk:Sollyucko|talk]]) 00:33, 27 July 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Fun (band)#rfc_A110380|Talk:Fun (band)]] expired 2025-07-29 06:10 ===
* Id: A110380
* User: MrSeabody
* Date: 2025-06-29 05:11:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1297896063|MEDIA 1297896063}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1297896065|SOC 1297896065}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1303123364|MEDIA 1303123364}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1303123369|SOC 1303123369}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Consensus does not appear to exist on the tense of this article: whether the band should be referred to in the present tense (e.g., "Fun (stylized as fun.) '''is''' an American pop rock band...") or the past tense (e.g., "Fun (stylized as fun.) '''was''' an American pop rock band..."). I am thus proposing two options: that the band be referred to in the present tense ("is", "current members", etc) or the past ("was", "former members", etc). [[User:MrSeabody|MrSeabody]] ([[User talk:MrSeabody|talk]]) 05:11, 29 June 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Deadlock (video game)#rfc_2280C7A|Talk:Deadlock (video game)]] expired 2025-07-29 10:01 ===

=== [[Talk:Leo Frank#rfc_AC9E87F|Talk:Leo Frank]] expired 2025-07-29 17:01 ===
* Id: AC9E87F
* User: BarneyEsNumeroUno
* Date: 2025-07-29 08:07:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1303143550|HIST 1303143550}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1303205567|HIST 1303205567}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Hi all,

There is some disagreement over whether the article should state outright that Leo Frank was ‚Äúwrongly convicted‚Äù of murder. While many modern historians believe Frank was innocent and that the case was influenced by bias and misconduct, it is also true that:

* Frank‚Äôs conviction was never legally overturned.
* The 1986 posthumous pardon from the state of Georgia did not exonerate him; rather, it specifically condemned the state‚Äôs failure to protect him from lynching.
* A total of 13 appeals and motions were filed between 1913 and 1915‚Äîincluding in the Georgia State Appeals Courts, Georgia Supreme Court, U.S. District Court, U.S. Court of Appeals, and the U.S. Supreme Court‚Äîall of which were denied.
* More recent efforts, including a 2019 petition for full exoneration, were also dismissed (in early 2023).
* As a result, Frank‚Äôs conviction remains legally valid, based on the original jury verdict in what was at the time Georgia‚Äôs longest criminal trial.

Given this, should the article continue to use strong language like ‚Äúwrongly convicted,‚Äù or should it be revised to a more neutral phrasing? For example:

‚ÄúMany historians believe Leo Frank was wrongfully convicted, though his conviction has never been formally overturned or legally cleared.‚Äù

In short, this phrasing acknowledges that most historians consider Frank wrongfully convicted, while also reflecting the important legal context‚Äînamely the extensive unsuccessful appeals during his lifetime and the many failed attempts to clear his name over more than 100 years since his conviction and subsequent lynching.

This discussion aims to reach consensus on the most accurate and balanced way to describe Frank‚Äôs conviction, in accordance with Wikipedia‚Äôs policies on [[WP:NPOV]] (Neutral point of view) and [[WP:RS]] (Reliable sources).

Thanks in advance for your input.

Please **indicate your position** by adding your username under one of the following headings: [[User:BarneyEsNumeroUno|BarneyEsNumeroUno]] ([[User talk:BarneyEsNumeroUno|talk]]) 08:07, 29 July 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Southern American English phonology#rfc_0A38437|Talk:Southern American English phonology]] expired 2025-07-29 17:01 ===
* Id: 0A38437
* User: Wolfdog
* Date: 2025-07-29 10:59:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|1303156447|LANG 1303156447}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|1303205577|LANG 1303205577}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should this article (and similar dialect ones) follow the naming convention of '''Southern American English phonology''' (i.e. '''X English phonology''') per [[WP:TITLECON]]? Or should it follow the convention of something like '''Southern accent (United States)''' (i.e. '''X accent''') per [[WP:COMMONNAME]] (also [[WP:TITLECON]] in cases like [[Baltimore accent]], [[Boston accent]], etc.)? [[User:Wolfdog|Wolfdog]] ([[User talk:Wolfdog|talk]]) 10:59, 29 July 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Antifa (United States)#rfc_854ABEB|Talk:Antifa (United States)]] expired 2025-07-29 20:01 ===
* Id: 854ABEB
* User: Doug Weller
* Date: 2025-07-29 07:20:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1303123367|POL 1303123367}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1303231375|POL 1303231375}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
1.) Militancy

Option A: Keep current

Option B: Mention the tendency of the militarism/violence in the group

Option C: Call them militaristic/violent

2.) Ideology

Option A: Keep current

Option B: List all ideologies with [[WP:DUEWEIGHT]]

Option C: Call them far-left

Option D: Call them left wing to far left

Improper RfC. See [[WP:RFCBEFORE]]: Before starting the process
RfCs are time consuming, and Wikipedia being a volunteer project, editor time is valuable. Editors should try to resolve their issues before starting an RfC. Try discussing the matter with any other parties on the related talk page. If you can reach a consensus or have your questions answered through discussion, then there is no need to start an RfC.

If a local discussion does not answer your question or resolve the problem, then some other forums for resolution include:

Asking for input or assistance at one or more relevant WikiProjects, which are often listed at the top of the article's talk page.
Also, "Include an initial brief, neutral statement or question about the issue in the talk page section,"Statements are often phrased as questions, for example: "Should this article say in the lead that John Smith was a contender for the Pulitzer Prize?" 
[[User:Doug Weller|<span style="color:#070">Doug Weller</span>]] [[User talk:Doug Weller|talk]] 07:20, 29 July 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Egyptian cuisine#rfc_7203377|Talk:Egyptian cuisine]] expired 2025-08-01 13:01 ===
* Id: 7203377
* User: Turnopoems
* Date: 2025-07-02 12:12:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|1298431990|LANG 1298431990}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1298431995|SOC 1298431995}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|1303684588|LANG 1303684588}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1303684592|SOC 1303684592}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
A disagreement has arisen regarding whether the Egyptian Arabic template should be applied to names of dishes in Egyptian cuisine articles, especially when the spelling does not differ from Standard Arabic. If I have misrepresented a position, please clarify below. 

Editors are invited to comment on the following two options:

'''Option 1: Use Egyptian Arabic template only when the spelling of the name explicitly does not conform to Standard Arabic orthography'''

The supporter of this view argues that using the Egyptian Arabic template when the term conforms to Standard Arabic orthography and lexicology can be considered nationalistic advocacy. They maintain that the template should be reserved for cases where the term is clearly in vernacular Egyptian Arabic, but that Standard Arabic should take precedence in cases where the two overlap, even if its within the context of Egyptian Arabic.

'''Option 2: Use Egyptian Arabic template regardless of overlap with Standard Arabic (due to shared usage within Egyptian Arabic)'''

The supporter of this view argues that the Egyptian Arabic template is appropriate for labeling culinary items and varieties in Egyptian culture, even if those forms, within the context of Egyptian Arabic, partially or fully overlap with Standard Arabic. He notes that many culinary items have entirely different nomenclature across other Arabic dialects, and as such, their designation as Egyptian Arabic in Egyptian contexts is necessary for linguistic and cultural precision. He notes that even when there is lexilogical similarities Egyptian Arabic has a broader orthographic tolerance than Standard Arabic, often allowing standard and non-standard spellings more capable of reflecting local pronunciation and usage. Thus the template can better reflect these localized forms, as they are recognizable to Egyptian speakers. '''[[User:Turnopoems|<span style="background:linear-gradient(to bottom,#57ABDF 65%,#FFB800);color:white;text-shadow:0 0 3px black;font-weight:bold;padding:4px;">Turnopoems ìãπ</span>]] [[User talk:Turnopoems|‚úé]]''' 12:12, 2 July 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Template talk:IPA#rfc_4E7D44E|Template talk:IPA]] expired 2025-08-03 22:01 ===

* User: Grapesurgeon
* Date: 2025-07-04 21:34:00

{{rfcquote|text=
This template, {{tl|IPA}}, currently does not have an option to disable links to relevant IPA help pages. For example, <code><nowiki>{{IPA|fr|asdf|}}</nowiki></code> {{arrow|r}} {{IPA|fr|asdf|}}. === [[Talk:Period (Kesha album)#rfc_3FC710C|Talk:Period (Kesha album)]] expired 2025-08-04 04:01 ===
* Id: 3FC710C
* User: Vinokurov Demis
* Date: 2025-07-05 03:40:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1298851402|MEDIA 1298851402}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1298851406|STYLE 1298851406}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1304125587|MEDIA 1304125587}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1304125590|STYLE 1304125590}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
To give a short summary, I've actually went through all Wikipedia policies and precedents, and everything is quite simple. The album page '''''should''''' have the name "'''.'''" ('''[[MOS:ALBUM]]''', ''"The article name should be the title of the album"''). This is '''in line with all the precedents like such as [[√∑ (album)|√∑]], [[! (Trippie Redd album)|!]], [[_ (album)|_]].''' Even in complex Unicode cases the rule is upheld: [[While(1 Is Less Than 2)|While(1<2)]], [[Robot Face|<|¬∞_¬∞|>]], [[(A‚ÜíB) Life]]. The '''only''' example against this (correct me if I'm wrong) is [[Love Symbol]] which isn't a Unicode character in the first place anyway.

'''However''', there is a '''technical limitation''' that '''a)''' Wikipedia page name can't contain a single dot (no such page exists) and '''b)''' per renaming discussion above unlike other single-character album names, a dot is especially technically challenging to serve as a valid reference due to its size and function. So '''page title [[Period (Kesha album)]] is not under question.''' 

My {{Suggestion}} is therefore as follows:
# Introduction as "'''''.''''' (pronounced as '''''Period''''') is the sixth studio album..."
# Template header "'''''.'''''"
# Add the [[Template:Correct title]] per '''[[WP:NC-SLASH]]''', last paragraph (''"Page names '''consisting of exactly one or two periods''' [...] are not allowed. In most such cases DISPLAYTITLE will not work, so '''[[Template:correct title]] should be used'''."'')
Discussion above seems to support this at the moment (4 opinions for this versus 1 opinion against). In principle we can also count all the reverted edits from all the other users. Due to this being a special case and ongoing back-and-forth edits opinions from the wider community are very much welcome.--[[User:Vinokurov Demis|Vinokurov Demis]] ([[User talk:Vinokurov Demis|talk]]) 03:40, 5 July 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:2025 India‚ÄìPakistan conflict#rfc_2F4D754|Talk:2025 India‚ÄìPakistan conflict]] expired 2025-08-05 01:01 ===
* Id: 2F4D754
* User: Dr Hissam Kaisam
* Date: 2025-07-31 11:37:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1303510685|POL 1303510685}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1304267031|POL 1304267031}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Inviting comments on inclusion of this anaysis by Royal United Services Institute

:In an analysis published by [[RUSI]], Walter Ladwig of [[King's College London]] wrote that India had seemingly "largely achieved its stated objectives". He noted that the Indian Airforce had, in the opening days, showed the capability to destroy claimed terror infrastructure, and for the first time since 1971 had penetrated the Pakistani air defence systems to hit forward airbases ‚Äì showing a capacity for "coercive precision operations". However, he said that the Indian military's initial silence had ceded the narrative space, leading to an undue emphasis on specific platforms. He said that the Indian operation had set new normal regarding responses to terror attacks, changing the use of force against Pakistan proper from an "exception to expectation". He however noted that fringe actors may attempt to use this to provoke confrontations, and emphasised the need for expanding communication channels. He said that Operation Sindoor should not be remembered as a "dogfight between airframes" but as a "calibrated use of force" designed to show resolve, target terrorist infrastructure, and assert military capability.<ref>{{cite web |author=Dr. Walter Ladwig |title=Calibrated Force: Operation Sindoor and the Future of Indian Deterrence |url=https://www.rusi.org/explore-our-research/publications/commentary/calibrated-force-operation-sindoor-and-future-indian-deterrence}}</ref>

[[User:Dr Hissam Kaisam|Dr Hissam Kaisam]] ([[User talk:Dr Hissam Kaisam|talk]]) 11:37, 31 July 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Naming conventions (government and legislation)#rfc_D79844A|Wikipedia talk:Naming conventions (government and legislation)]] expired 2025-08-05 04:01 ===
* Id: D79844A
* User: ElijahPepe
* Date: 2025-07-06 03:04:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1303066912|STYLE 1303066912}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1303066916|POLICY 1303066916}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1304289389|STYLE 1304289389}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1304289391|POLICY 1304289391}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Prior to reading, [[WT:TRUMP#Requested move 15 April 2025]] should also be looked at. Regarding our subarticles on topics relating to presidential administrations, there are several titles that have been used. From the articles I am aware of on the [[second presidency of Donald Trump]] (though this issue is much more widespread than the articles listed below):
* '''Option A''': [[List of executive orders in the second presidency of Donald Trump]] ‚Äî "[ordinal] presidency of [full name]"
* '''Option B''': [[Legal affairs of the second Donald Trump presidency]] ‚Äî "[ordinal] [full name] presidency"
* '''Option C''': [[Timeline of Donald Trump's second presidency (2025 Q1)]] ‚Äî "[full name]'s [ordinal] presidency"
* '''Option D''': [[Foreign policy of the second Donald Trump administration]] ‚Äî "[ordinal] [full name] administration"
* '''Option E''': [[Activist deportations in the second Trump presidency]] ‚Äî "[ordinal] [last name] presidency"
* '''Option F''': [[Detention and deportation of American citizens in the second Trump administration]] ‚Äî "[ordinal] [last name] administration"

Which of the options above should be used? Alternatively, an option not on this list can be suggested. <span style="font-family: monospace;">[[User talk:ElijahPepe|elijahpepe@wikipedia]] (he/him)</span> 03:04, 6 July 2025 (UTC)}}

{{rfcquote|text=
There are several dozen WikiProjects on individual musicians which are pretty much dead. [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Council/Guide/Merging WikiProjects|To encourage closer collaboration instead of disparate editing, I propose]] merging the following sub-projects, all of which can be called inactive or barely active, into WikiProject Musicians {{small|(I've excluded a few like the Beatles or Michael Jackson because of the higher probability they might be revived)}}:

*[[Wikipedia:WikiProject Frank Zappa |WikiProject Frank Zappa ]]
*[[Wikipedia:WikiProject Van Halen |WikiProject Van Halen ]]
}}
Please let me know if you oppose any of these inactive sub-projects being merged into this one. I will leave messages on all of their talk pages too {{small|maybe tomorrow, it's quite a list!}}. [[User:AirshipJungleman29|&#126;~ AirshipJungleman29]] ([[User talk:AirshipJungleman29|talk]]) 22:42, 31 July 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Sokoban#rfc_E2A5C78|Talk:Sokoban]] expired 2025-08-07 05:01 ===
* Id: E2A5C78
* User: Carloseow
* Date: 2025-07-08 04:34:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1299398885|STYLE 1299398885}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1304624401|STYLE 1304624401}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Hello editors. Disagreement over the lead section of the Sokoban article has led to edit warring. I'd like to present both discussed leads and seek your input regarding their prose, content, and style.

Please review both lead versions below. Your comments and preference, supported by Wikipedia policies and guidelines, would be greatly appreciated.

'''A) Lead Version A (Video game type-focused opening):'''

"Sokoban is a puzzle video game in which the player pushes boxes around in a warehouse, trying to get them to storage locations. Designed in 1981 by Hiroyuki Imabayashi, it was first published in Japan in 1982 by his company Thinking Rabbit for the NEC PC-8801 computer. The game was later ported to various platforms and followed by new titles. It became popular in Japan and internationally, inspiring unofficial versions, a subgenre of box-pushing puzzle games, and artificial intelligence research."

'''B) Lead Version B (Specific 1982 game-focused opening, creator not in lead):'''

"Sokoban[a] is a 1982 puzzle video game developed and published by Japanese studio Thinking Rabbit. In the game, the player pushes boxes around in a warehouse, trying to get them to storage locations. It was first released in Japan in 1982 for the NEC PC-8801 computer. The game was later ported to various platforms and followed by new titles. It became popular in Japan and internationally, inspiring unofficial versions, a subgenre of box-pushing puzzle games, and artificial intelligence research."

'''Specific Questions for Discussion'''

'''Overall Framing''': Which version (A or B) do you believe provides the most appropriate lead for the Sokoban article? Specifically, should the lead primarily introduce ''Sokoban'' as:

'''A)''' A puzzle video game type/genre, with details about the first title in 1982 following.

'''B)''' The specific 1982 original video game.

'''Clarity:'''
When evaluating the above, please consider how the words of the lead matches the information in the article. For example, the ai research is about general Sokoban puzzles, not about the 1982 release.

'''Creator Mention:''' Do you believe Hiroyuki Imabayashi (the creator) should be mentioned in the lead and the infobox as a basic fact?

'''Your input and reasoning are highly valued.''' [[User:Carloseow|Carloseow]] ([[User talk:Carloseow|talk]]) 04:34, 8 July 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Bill Maher#rfc_4DCB897|Talk:Bill Maher]] expired 2025-08-12 19:01 ===
* Id: 4DCB897
* User: Mike Schwartz
* Date: 2025-08-11 22:35:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1305420804|BIO 1305420804}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1305553461|BIO 1305553461}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
=== Sentences with long "interposed" subordinate clauses === 

The first sentence of the last paragraph of the "Political views" section of this article -- at least, based upon the [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Bill_Maher&oldid=1304721387 "Latest revision as of 12:29, 7 August 2025"] '''version of this article''' -- seems (with the help of www.charactercountonline.com ) -- to have about '''58''' words. 

The above sentence (which I just wrote) has -- thanks to the same "charactercountonline dot com" website -- about '''44''' words ('''or''' maybe more, if you count the ['non-displayed'] URL that is the target for the "Latest revision..." [[hyperlink]].) 

As you can see, I am not opposed to long sentences. I am offering this "suggestion" simply with the goal of helping readers "parse" (figure out) what previous text ('''spoiler alert:''' it is "He has addressed his Republican fans") '''goes with''' the words "by saying that..." once the reader finally "returns" -- (like a Fortran subroutine -- perhaps a lengthy one! -- "returning" to the calling program that invoked it) -- from the '''40-word (long)''' "subordinate clause" or sentence fragment saying<blockquote>who have asked him why he after frequently criticizing the Democratic party over the years for various policies and decisions and being "so good in roasting the [[woke]] nonsense-peddlers" won't just " go all the way and join" the right-wing</blockquote>that is interposed before continuing ("resuming") with the words '''"by saying that [...]"''' to finally end the sentence.

''' "Suggestion" for a simple [easy] change === 

I am not "suggesting" moving nor inserting any sentence boundaries, nor changing the order of any of the words. I just think it would make it a lot easier [for the reader] '''to parse,''' if the '''40-word (long)''' "subordinate clause" or sentence fragment (see the <<code>"blockquote"</code>> above) were surrounded by some "white space" and/or some other punctuation. 

That long "subordinate clause" or sentence fragment will probably cause that sentence to require a lot of time -- and '''effort!''' -- to 'parse' or "figure out", if it is left as it appears now. 

It could be set apart by using a "<<code>blockquote</code>><big>...</big><<code>/blockquote</code>>" construct -- just like the <<code>blockquote</code>> shown in the above sub-section of this [Talk:] page section. 

Personally I would be OK with the idea -- in fact, I think it might be a '''good idea''' -- to '''also''' surround that <<code>/blockquote</code>> construct with some parens or brackets ... and maybe even some em dashes (or double minus signs), too... '''in addition to''' the white space. 

''' Just a "Suggestion" === 
Any comments? [[User:Mike Schwartz|Mike Schwartz]] ([[User talk:Mike Schwartz|talk]]) 22:35, 11 August 2025 (UTC)}}
