=== [[Talk:Persecution of Muslims during the Ottoman contraction#rfc_7FAEA54|Talk:Persecution of Muslims during the Ottoman contraction]] expired 2025-08-14 17:01 ===
* Id: 7FAEA54
* User: Robert McClenon
* Date: 2025-07-15 16:14:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1300656344|HIST 1300656344}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1305883845|HIST 1305883845}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Which of the options should be implemented?

'''A:'''
Insert the following text into '''Death Toll''' subsection in '''Total number of casualties''' section:
:Edward Roger John Owen and ≈ûevket Pamuk estimate that during the last decade of the Ottoman Empire (1912‚Äì1922), when the Balkan Wars, the First World War and the War of Independence took place in areas that were later to become part of Turkey, there were nearly 2 million Muslim casualties of the military and civilian population.<ref>{{cite book |last1=Owen |first1=Edward Roger John |last2=Pamuk |first2=≈ûevket |title=A History of Middle East Economies in the Twentieth Century |date=1999 |publisher=Harvard University Press |location=Cambridge, Massachusetts |isbn=0-674-39831-9 |page=11 |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{cite book |last1=Pamuk |first1=≈ûevket |editor1-last=Broadberry |editor1-first=Stephen Noel |editor2-last=Harrison |editor2-first=Mark |title=The Economics of World War I |date=2005 |publisher=Cambridge University Press |location=The Edinburgh Building, Cambridge |isbn=978-0-511-13234-6 |pages=131-132 |language=en |chapter=The Ottoman economy in World War I}}</ref> However the text does not specify it is only about Christian attacks.

'''B:'''
Insert the following text into '''World War I and the Turkish War of Independence''' section
:Roger Owen and ≈ûevket Pamuk estimate that during the last decade of the Ottoman Empire (1912‚Äì1922), when the Balkan Wars, the First World War and the War of Independence took place in areas that were later to become part of Turkey, there were nearly 2 million military and civilian deaths among Muslim Turks and Kurds.[https://books.google.com/books?id=jn-PdUK9AzgC pp 10-11] [https://www.cambridge.org/core/books/economics-of-world-war-i/A9528E1394637261A7ABD08D9D7148B5 p. 131] Kemal Kiri≈ü√ßi mentions McCarthy's estimate of 2.5 million Muslim deaths within the borders of modern-day Turkey due to wars, as the Ottoman Empire collapsed.[https://www.cambridge.org/core/books/cambridge-history-of-turkey/ADF782F75F1A17567890F5A2FE7938A9 p. 175-177]

'''C:'''
Neither or another option

[[User:Robert McClenon|Robert McClenon]] ([[User talk:Robert McClenon|talk]]) 16:14, 15 July 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Akan language#rfc_A62DDAA|Talk:Akan language]] expired 2025-08-15 14:01 ===
* Id: A62DDAA
* User: Robert McClenon
* Date: 2025-07-16 22:24:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|1300886489|LANG 1300886489}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|1306098564|LANG 1306098564}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the two following changes be made in [[Akan language]]?
 
A.

In the Name section of [[Akan language]], change the first sentence

{{tqb| The language was originally referred to by local designations such as 'Twi' (/t ÉwiÀê, twiÀê, t ÉiÀê/;[12][13] Akan: [t…ï·∂£i]), 'Fante' and 'Brong'.}}

to

{{tqb|Twi was proposed as a name for the dialects but was rejected by Fante, however Akan was acceptable to all. Akan: [[Help:IPA|[t…ï·∂£i]]])'[[Twi]]' ([[Help:IPA/English|/t ÉwiÀê, twiÀê, t ÉiÀê/]]-'[[Fante dialect|Fante]]'}}

B.

In the first sentence of the second paragraph of the lede, change

{{tqb|Three dialects were developed as literary standards with distinct [[Orthography|orthographies]]: [[Asante dialect|Asante]] and [[Akuapem dialect|Akuapem]], collectively known as [[Twi]], and [[Fante dialect|Fante]]}}

to

{{tqb|Three dialects were developed as literary standards with distinct [[Orthography|orthographies]]: [[Asante dialect|Asante]] [[Akuapem dialect|Akuapem]], and [[Fante dialect|Fante]]}}
[[User:Robert McClenon|Robert McClenon]] ([[User talk:Robert McClenon|talk]]) 22:24, 16 July 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Ellie Reeves#rfc_ACB88CE|Talk:Ellie Reeves]] expired 2025-08-16 01:01 ===
* Id: ACB88CE
* User: Estar8806
* Date: 2025-07-17 00:26:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1300900869|BIO 1300900869}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1300900872|HIST 1300900872}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1300900876|POL 1300900876}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1306112981|BIO 1306112981}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1306112982|HIST 1306112982}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1306112987|POL 1306112987}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the wives of peers/knights who are entitled to appropriate stylings (eg. The Lady Cryer for Ellie Reeves; Lady Nugee for [[Emily Thornberry]]; etc), but who do not use them, be referred to as:

'''Option A.''' Use the full/official/legal title in both the lede sentence and the infobox (ex. ''Ellie Claire Reeves, Baroness/Lady Cryer'' and ''The Lady Cryer'' in the lede and infobox, respectively);<br>
'''Option B.''' Do not use the full/official/legal title in both the lede and the infobox (ex.''Ellie Claire Reeves'' and ''Ellie Reeves'', in the lede and infobox, respectively), but include a note (ex. ''Reeves is entitled to be styled as Lady Cryer by marriage''; or something of the sort);<br>
'''Option C.''' As a compromise, use the full title in the lede but not the infobox (ex. ''Ellie Claire Reeves, Baroness/Lady Cryer'' in the lede, but ''Ellie Reeves'' in the infobox); possibly including a note here as well.

'''Note''': There is precedent for most of these options: option A is used for [[Caroline Dinenage]]; B is used for Thornberry (or more closely, [[Amelia Gentleman]]; and C is used for Reeves. [[User:Estar8806|estar8806]] ([[User talk:Estar8806|talk]]) [[Special:Contributions/Estar8806 |‚òÖ]] 00:26, 17 July 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_60BB054|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2025-08-16 20:01 ===
* Id: 60BB054
* User: Numberguy6
* Date: 2025-08-16 16:22:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1306231335|MEDIA 1306231335}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1306256509|MEDIA 1306256509}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
[[Sveriges Television|SVT]], [[DR (broadcaster)|DR]], [[Yle]], [[NRK]], [[R√öV]], [[Sveriges Radio|SR]], [[Swedish Educational Broadcasting Company|UR]], [[Kalaallit Nunaata Radioa|KNR]], [[Kringvarp F√∏roya|KVF]], [[√Ölands Radio and TV|√ÖRTV]]: all Nordic state-owned broadcasters. Collectively cited more than 28,000 times on en.wiki, and are all very widely cited in their own language wikis. Previous discussion: [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard/Archive 230#Source for calling Nyheter Idag xenophobic|1]], [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard/Archive 235#Citing a self-published, but peer reviewed, book to back up that a reservation has taken place?|2]], [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard/Archive 274#RfC: Bellingcat (August 2019)|3]], [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard/Archive 315#Is Wafa.ps a RS?|4]]; all discussions list these sources as generally reliable.

{{duses|svt.se}}<br/>{{duses|dr.dk}}<br/>{{duses|yle.fi}}<br/>{{duses|nrk.no}}<br/>{{duses|ruv.is}}<br/>{{duses|sverigesradio.se}}<br/>{{duses|ur.se}}<br/>{{duses|knr.gl}}<br/>{{duses|kvf.fo}}<br/>{{duses|alandsradio.ax}}

*'''Option 1:''' Generally [[WP:RS|reliable]] for factual reporting.
*'''Option 2:''' Unclear or additional considerations apply.
*'''Option 3:''' Generally [[WP:QUESTIONABLE|unreliable]] for factual reporting.
*'''Option 4:''' Publishes false or fabricated information, and should be [[WP:DEPS|deprecated]].

[[User:Numberguy6|Numberguy6]] ([[User talk:Numberguy6|talk]]) 16:22, 16 August 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Back pain#rfc_40AEB8D|Talk:Back pain]] expired 2025-08-20 08:01 ===
* Id: 40AEB8D
* User: Badgettrg
* Date: 2025-08-19 22:20:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1306829519|POLICY 1306829519}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1306889696|POLICY 1306889696}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I was notified that my edits that created a new section, "Monitoring response to treatment" (see version https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Back_pain&oldid=1306789873 ) were removed. The message I received was "Please stop. If you continue to add unsourced or poorly sourced content, as you did at Back pain, you may be blocked from editing. Please don't use outdated, low-quality chiropractic sources; instead, use WP:MEDRS for this topic."

The article I cited is on PubMed and in my view is the best source as it is the most recent systematic review of a topic that is no longer actively researched. If preferred, I can instead cite an RCT in JAMA, 2015 (PMID [https://pubmed.gov/26461996 26461996]) that used a MCID of 6 in its design and cited an article from 2001 as opposed to the similar recommendation of the Vianin review that I cited and recommends a range of 4.5 to 10.

I greatly respect WikiPedia's dedication to quality, but this may be a case that rather than removing the edit as its content is reasonable, to instead post on the discussion page whether the edit can be improved and/or add a Disputed section tag. I add a second source (or can switch) the citation and note that while the source is from 2001, it is used to design a high quality RCT in a major journal in 2015 (PMID [https://pubmed.gov/26461996 26461996]). Admittedly, I could have proposed my content on the talk page before posting.

While I cited a PubMed article that is not within Medline, the article that I cited is cited by over 50 articles on Medline (combine [https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/?linkname=pubmed_pubmed_citedin&from_uid=19646379&medline%5Bsb%5D PubMed articles citing the article I cited] with medline[sb] at PubMed. 

Apologies for not including the edit summary.

thanks for your time

[[User:Badgettrg|Badgettrg]] ([[User talk:Badgettrg|talk]]) 22:20, 19 August 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Heights of presidents and presidential candidates of the United States#rfc_E2056D7|Talk:Heights of presidents and presidential candidates of the United States]] expired 2025-08-24 08:01 ===
* Id: E2056D7
* User: Nib2905
* Date: 2025-08-23 15:34:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1307435403|BIO 1307435403}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1307435406|POL 1307435406}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1307546946|BIO 1307546946}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1307546955|POL 1307546955}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
User:271rpm has repeatedly reverted edits that mention skepticism of Donald Trump's height claims. They have said that  "Girther movement by picture "evidence" is an agenda that has to be reverted." These reversions have included an edit by User:GlowingLava which presented the information as claims, not facts, and  which included citations from reliable sources such as The Times of India, Politico and The Guardian. https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Heights_of_presidents_and_presidential_candidates_of_the_United_States&oldid=1306183165 Some of the references are listed below. There were a total of 10 sources on said edit. 

"Trump's driver's license casts doubt on height claims". POLITICO. December 23, 2016. Retrieved 2025-08-16

Gabbatt, Adam (January 17, 2018). "A tall tale? Accuracy of Trump's medical report ‚Äì and new height ‚Äì questioned". The Guardian. ISSN 0261-3077. Retrieved 2025-08-16

"Is Biden taller than Trump? White House photo sparks height discussions on social media". The Times of India. November 16, 2024. ISSN 0971-8257. Retrieved 2025-08-16.

User:271rpm said in their revision comments of User:GlowingLava's edit "You first need to reach consensus on the talk page.", it was pointed out by User:GlowingLava that simply mentioning a notable point of disagreement, without altering the main text, is a standard way to resolve editing stalemates and does not necessarily require prior consensus to be proposed. (Do not need to reach consensus, mentioning there is disagreement is not the same thing as changing the main number. This also solves the problem of the ongoing stalemate which is encouraged IIRC.)

In response, User:271rpm stated: "As long as there hasn't been a RfC on the subject, I will continue to revert you."

User:271rpm has made 4 reverts on this topic of discussion. [[User:Nib2905|Nib2905]] ([[User talk:Nib2905|talk]]) 15:34, 23 August 2025 (UTC)}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the official IAF claims<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2025/8/9/india-says-six-pakistani-aircraft-shot-down-during-kashmir-conflict |title=India says six Pakistani aircraft shot down during May conflict}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/india-shot-down-six-pakistani-military-aircraft-may-air-force-chief-says-2025-08-09/ |title=India shot down six Pakistani military aircraft in May, air force chief says}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://indianexpress.com/article/india/operation-sindoor-iaf-pakistan-5-fighter-jets-1-large-aircraft-air-marshal-10179475/ |title=Crediting Russian S-400, IAF chief says India took down 5 Pak fighters, one ‚Äòlarge aircraft‚Äô during Op Sindoor}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/asia/india/india-pakistan-conflict-jets-aircraft-b2804796.html |title=India shot down military aircraft during clash with Pakistan, its air force claims}}</ref> on the shoot down and destruction of PAF aircraft be re-added<ref>{{cite web|url=https://en.m.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2025_India%E2%80%93Pakistan_conflict&diff=prev&oldid=1305376703|title=Revision Diff}}</ref> into the article based on the extensive discussions in 2 sections<ref>{{cite web|url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talk:2025_India%E2%80%93Pakistan_conflict#IAF_Confirmation_on_6_Pakistani_Aircraft_being_shot-down|title=IAF Confirmation on 6 Pakistani Aircraft being shot-down}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talk:2025_India%E2%80%93Pakistan_conflict#Losses|title=Losses}}</ref> of the talk page? [[User:Cdr. Erwin Smith|Cdr. Erwin Smith]] ([[User talk:Cdr. Erwin Smith|talk]]) 11:57, 23 August 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Elections and Referendums#rfc_165027C|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Elections and Referendums]] expired 2025-08-24 16:01 ===
* Id: 165027C
* User: BottleOfChocolateMilk
* Date: 2025-07-25 15:57:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1302469248|POL 1302469248}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1302469254|PROP 1302469254}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1307600443|POL 1307600443}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1307600452|PROP 1307600452}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There's been an ongoing debate on pages for elections in the US about what kind of sourcing you need to move a candidate from the "Filed paperwork" or "Potential" section to "Declared." A lot of editors seem to agree that an [[Federal Election Commission|FEC]] filing is not enough, because it is very common for people to file with the FEC without ever actually campaigning. Ideally, we want to cite a news article that says the candidate is running. However, it's easy to find candidates who've filed with the FEC and launched a campaign website but who haven't been mentioned in any news articles. Moreover, some news articles say that a candidate is running purely because they've filed with the FEC, even though the candidate has no online campaign presence and the author of the news article doesn't seem to have reached out to them to confirm they're actually running. In my eyes, there are three proposals for how to deal with this:

1. Maintain the current system. A candidate can only be moved to "Declared" if there is an article from a [[WP:RS|reliable news source]] that says they're running.

2. Allow someone to be listed in "Declared" if they have filed with the FEC or the relevant state/local elections agency.

3. Allow someone to be listed in "Declared" with two citations: first, a filing with the FEC or the relevant state/local elections agency, and second, a self-published source from the candidate that says they're running--e.g. a campaign website, campaign social media account, or fundraising page where the candidate explicitly says they're running (so "I'm exploring a candidacy" or something like that wouldn't be good enough).

Which do you think is the best path? [[User:BottleOfChocolateMilk|BottleOfChocolateMilk]] ([[User talk:BottleOfChocolateMilk|talk]]) 15:57, 25 July 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_76598D1|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2025-08-25 07:01 ===
* Id: 76598D1
* User: Chetsford
* Date: 2025-07-31 06:40:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:

*'''Option 1:''' Generally [[WP:RS|reliable]] 
*'''Option 2:''' Unclear or additional considerations apply.
*'''Option 3:''' Generally [[WP:QUESTIONABLE|unreliable]] for factual reporting.
*'''Option 4:''' Publishes false or fabricated information, and should be [[WP:DEPS|deprecated]]

Is ''Simple Flying'' prior to 2024 ... 

*'''Option 1:''' Generally [[WP:RS|reliable]] 
*'''Option 2:''' Unclear or additional considerations apply.
*'''Option 3:''' Generally [[WP:QUESTIONABLE|unreliable]] for factual reporting.
*'''Option 4:''' Publishes false or fabricated information, and should be [[WP:DEPS|deprecated]]

=== [[Talk:Western Sahara#rfc_3A69A20|Talk:Western Sahara]] expired 2025-08-27 08:01 ===
* Id: 3A69A20
* User: Nice4What
* Date: 2025-08-06 06:08:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1304471402|POL 1304471402}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1309643610|POL 1309643610}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the lead provide context that states have rescinded their recognition of the [[SADR]]? Possible wordings with/without context include:
* '''Option A:''' The Polisario Front is primarily supported by Algeria and has won formal recognition for the SADR <u>from 46 UN member states and South Ossetia,</u> and membership in the African Union. 
* '''Option B:''' The Polisario Front is primarily supported by Algeria has won formal recognition for the SADR <u>from 84 UN member states</u> and membership in the African Union. 
* '''Option C:''' The Polisario Front is primarily supported by Algeria and has won <u>limited international recognition for the SADR</u> and membership in the African Union.
* '''Option D:''' The Polisario Front is primarily supported by Algeria and has won formal recognition for the SADR <u>from 84 UN member states‚Äî38 of which have cancelled, frozen, or suspended their recognition‚Äî</u>and membership in the African Union.
[[User:Nice4What|Nice4What]] ([[User talk:Nice4What|talk]] ¬∑ [[Special:Contributions/Nice4What|contribs]]) ‚Äì <small>([[Help:Notifications/Thanks|Thanks]] <span style="color:#4dac8b;">‚ô•</span>)</small> 06:08, 6 August 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:August 2025 Indonesian protests#rfc_71685F2|Talk:August 2025 Indonesian protests]] expired 2025-09-02 12:01 ===
* Id: 71685F2
* User: Jeromi Mikhael
* Date: 2025-09-02 10:37:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1309148709|HIST 1309148709}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|1309148710|LANG 1309148710}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1309148713|POL 1309148713}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1309148715|STYLE 1309148715}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1309155187|HIST 1309155187}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|1309155189|LANG 1309155189}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1309155191|POL 1309155191}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1309155194|STYLE 1309155194}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The current title of the article, August 2025 Indonesian protests, does no longer reflect the reality because the protests have extended into September and may continue further, thus unwieldy and potentially misleading. So far, the proposed titles are not suitable since it mostly focused on sectoral protests and is far from the official or widely adopted name for the protests on the ground. We need help to find an accurate, concise, and representative of a decentralized protest movement that lacks one single, widely-adopted name. Regards, [[User talk:Jeromi Mikhael|Jeromi Mikhael]] 10:37, 2 September 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Airbnb#rfc_581E53B|Talk:Airbnb]] expired 2025-09-02 23:01 ===
* Id: 581E53B
* User: Jjj3190
* Date: 2025-09-02 20:53:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|1309224918|ECON 1309224918}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|1309238623|ECON 1309238623}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the Criticism section of the Airbnb article include sourced content discussing allegations of review suppression and its impact on transparency and consumer trust?

Suggested Content:

'''Censorship of Negative Reviews'''
Airbnb has faced criticism for allegedly censoring or suppressing negative guest reviews, raising concerns about transparency and consumer trust. While the platform maintains policies to remove reviews that violate its content guidelines‚Äîsuch as those deemed irrelevant, retaliatory, or containing prohibited language‚Äîsome critics argue that these mechanisms may be used to remove legitimate complaints. Reports have surfaced of hosts disputing unfavorable reviews and successfully having them removed, sometimes by submitting misleading evidence or citing ambiguous policy violations. Additionally, some guests have reported that Airbnb did not reinstate reviews even after providing documentation supporting their claims. These concerns have led to broader discussions about whether Airbnb‚Äôs moderation practices prioritize brand reputation and host satisfaction over transparency, potentially limiting access to honest feedback and obscuring safety-related issues for future travelers.

Sources:
[https://businessreview.studentorg.berkeley.edu/the-dark-side-of-airbnbs/ The Dark Side of AirBnBs - Business Review at Berkeley] [[User:Jjj3190|Jjj3190]] ([[User talk:Jjj3190|talk]]) 20:53, 2 September 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Speedy deletion#rfc_0862FFF|Wikipedia talk:Speedy deletion]] expired 2025-09-03 22:01 ===
* Id: 0862FFF
* User: ChildrenWillListen
* Date: 2025-08-23 02:32:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1307345506|POLICY 1307345506}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1312694281|POLICY 1312694281}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I've been following [[Wikipedia talk:Speedy deletion#"Should" notify the page creator?|this discussion]] for a while, and seeing how someone was reported to ANI for not notifying page creators, I think it's time for an RfC
*'''Option 1''': Page creators must be notified when their article gets tagged for speedy deletion.
*'''Option 2''': Page creators must be notified when their article gets tagged for speedy deletion, excepting obvious vandalism, attack pages, or pages otherwise created in bad faith.
*'''Option 3''': Page creators should be notified at the discretion of the nominator.
<small><small>(this is my first RfC so please let me know if I'm doing something wrong.)</small></small> [[User:ChildrenWillListen|<span style="color:green">Children</span> <span style="color:purple">Will</span> <span style="color:red">Listen</span>]] ([[User talk:ChildrenWillListen|üêÑ talk]], [[Special:Contributions/ChildrenWillListen|ü´ò contribs]]) 02:32, 23 August 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:July 2025 Central Texas floods#rfc_6A3B39C|Talk:July 2025 Central Texas floods]] expired 2025-09-04 16:01 ===
* Id: 6A3B39C
* User: Geogene
* Date: 2025-08-05 15:30:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1304364626|POL 1304364626}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1309525614|POL 1309525614}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
'''Version A''' [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=July_2025_Central_Texas_floods&diff=prev&oldid=1303703228], While additional funding was made available for the county through the [[American Rescue Plan Act of 2021|American Rescue Plan Act]] of 2021, it was not used for flood warning and monitoring systems. It is unclear whether county officials were aware they could have used the funding for upgrades to their flood warning system. The area is very conservative politically, and many residents were opposed to using the funds for anything at all.  [https://www.texastribune.org/2025/07/10/texas-kerr-county-commissioners-flooding-warning/ Source]. 

'''Version B''' [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=July_2025_Central_Texas_floods&diff=prev&oldid=1304351495] While additional funding was made available for the county through the [[American Rescue Plan Act of 2021|American Rescue Plan Act]] of 2021, it was not used for flood warning and monitoring systems. At the time, some residents were opposed to using the funds for anything as they opposed the requirements attached to federal funds. It is unclear whether county officials were aware they could have used the funding for such upgrades.[https://www.texastribune.org/2025/07/10/texas-kerr-county-commissioners-flooding-warning/ Source]

Questions in dispute are

1) Should this mention political conservatism? 

2) Should it include {{tq|It is unclear whether county officials were aware they could have used the funding for upgrades to their flood warning system.}}

3) Is "some residents" or "many residents" more accurate.

4) Should it mention  {{tq|requirements attached to federal funds}}. [[User:Geogene|Geogene]] ([[User talk:Geogene|talk]]) 15:30, 5 August 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Democratic Party (United States)#rfc_73E6BF4|Talk:Democratic Party (United States)]] expired 2025-09-05 23:01 ===
* Id: 73E6BF4
* User: EarthDude
* Date: 2025-09-03 11:31:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1309325101|POL 1309325101}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1312506918|POL 1312506918}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The infobox of the article previously stated the political position to be "center to center-left". The word "center" was removed following [https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talk:Democratic_Party_(United_States)/Archive_20#Current_proposal a discussion in June 2024], with four in support and three in opposition. However, as it stands, there are currently eight separate discussions in the talk page seeking a change to the political position section of the infobox. I am creating this RfC to consolidate the discussions.<br /><br />Should center be added to the political position section in the infobox? [[User:EarthDude|<span style="font-family: Georgia; color: darkviolet">'''EarthDude'''</span>]] ([[User talk:EarthDude|<span style="Color: cyan">''wanna''</span> <span style="Color: green">''talk?''</span>]]) 11:31, 3 September 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Articles for creation#rfc_7AE6347|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Articles for creation]] expired 2025-09-06 19:01 ===
* Id: 7AE6347
* User: Robert McClenon
* Date: 2025-08-07 18:37:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1304717871|POLICY 1304717871}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1304717873|TECH 1304717873}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1309927418|POLICY 1309927418}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1309927419|TECH 1309927419}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This question is about the terminology to be used when a draft is not accepted but may be reworked or improved and resubmitted.  This action is currently referred to in the AFC Helper script and at the messages provided to the author as being '''Declined'''.  There has been discussion at the Village Pump at [[Wikipedia:Village_pump_(miscellaneous)#Declined_vs_rejected_at_AfC]].  Should the terminology for the three possible actions by a reviewer be:
*'''A''' - '''Accepted''', '''Declined''', and '''Rejected'''?  (The present options)
*'''B''' - '''Accepted''', '''Not Accepted''', and '''Rejected'''?  (The rough consensus at [[WP:VPM|VPM]])
*'''C''' - Something else, please specify.

[[User:Robert McClenon|Robert McClenon]] ([[User talk:Robert McClenon|talk]]) 18:37, 7 August 2025 (UTC)}}

This RFC is a pseudo-continuation of [[Talk:July 2025 Central Texas floods#RFC - CNN, Climate Change, and Texas Floods|a discussion at the Central Texas floods article]]. Points were brought up about the inclusion of sections relating to climate change in severe weather articles in general. However, the RFC did not find consensus for that. As a result, I am opening this RFC. Articles affected include those on specific hurricanes, flood events, tornadoes, et cetera. [[User:Quxyz|<span style="color: goldenrod">‚ú∂Qux</span>]][[User talk:Quxyz|<span style="color: goldenrod">yz</span>]][[special:contributions/Quxyz|<span style="color: goldenrod">‚ú∂</span>]] 22:00, 7 August 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Hector Berlioz#rfc_D98846D|Talk:Hector Berlioz]] expired 2025-09-07 18:01 ===
* Id: D98846D
* User: 161.142.149.36
* Date: 2025-09-03 21:11:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1309405157|HIST 1309405157}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1309405161|MEDIA 1309405161}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1309405165|STYLE 1309405165}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1310097380|HIST 1310097380}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1310097383|MEDIA 1310097383}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1310097390|STYLE 1310097390}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
For context: [[Talk:Hector_Berlioz#Ref_formatting|The preceding discussion]]<br/>
Diff link: {{Diff|Hector_Berlioz|1309360548|1309348852|here}}<br/>
Succinctly: '''I propose systematically replacing instances that address Harriet Smithson by her given name ‚ÄúHarriet‚Äù with her surname ‚ÄúSmithson‚Äù''' and applying a small number of copyedits to better use adverbial commas and improve clarity. Rationale: according to WP:SURNAME, reliable usage should favor a subject‚Äôs surname where appropriate; a Cornell news item and the Wikipedia article on Smithson itself use ‚ÄúSmithson,‚Äù and the editor who made these edits reports that a Google Scholar search found far more independent references to ‚ÄúHarriet Smithson‚Äù (~1,130) than to forms incorporating her husband‚Äôs name (~137), with no clear primary-source evidence that she formally adopted ‚ÄúBerlioz.‚Äù For style/clarity I propose a few sentence-level changes already made in the draft‚Äîfor example, changing ‚ÄúHe never studied the piano, and throughout his life played haltingly at best.‚Äù to ‚ÄúHe never studied the piano and played haltingly at best throughout his life.‚Äù; splitting ‚ÄúThe elder son of a provincial physician, Berlioz was expected to follow his father into medicine, and he attended a Parisian medical college before defying his family by taking up music as a profession.‚Äù into two sentences (‚ÄúThe elder son of a provincial physician, Berlioz was expected to follow in his father‚Äôs footsteps into medicine. He attended a medical college in Paris before defying his family by pursuing music as a profession.‚Äù); adding a comma in ‚ÄúAt the age of twelve, Berlioz fell in love for the first time.‚Äù; and changing ‚ÄúIn 1854 Harriet died.‚Äù to ‚ÄúIn 1854, Smithson died.‚Äù ‚Äî all for better neutrality, accuracy of naming, and readability.<br> 
With these in mind, please do prefix your discussion and arguments with either '''Yes (1)'''/'''No (1)''' or '''Yes (2)'''/'''No (2)'''. <br> Pinging those previously involved in discourse of the matter: {{ping|Tim riley|SchroCat|Fortuna imperatrix mundi|Ssilvers|Cg2p0B0u8m}}<br> Thank you, and have a good day/night ahead of you. :) <br> [[Special:Contributions/161.142.149.36|161.142.149.36]] ([[User talk:161.142.149.36|talk]]) 21:11, 3 September 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Lady Gaga#rfc_E53E699|Talk:Lady Gaga]] expired 2025-09-09 11:01 ===
* Id: E53E699
* User: PHShanghai
* Date: 2025-08-10 10:37:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1305155878|BIO 1305155878}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I let the discussion cool off for a bit as it was getting heated and thought of the best possible compromise that still stays within [[WP:NPOV]]. This is my proposed neutral solution, ''in broad terms:''

:Lady Gaga performed a free concert at Copacabana Beach, Rio de Janeiro, which became the most-attended concert by a female artist with an estimated audience of over 2.1 million people.{{efn|Local authorities and government figures, including the Mayor of Rio [[Eduardo Paes]], estimated an audience of 2.1 to 2.2 million.<ref>{{Cite tweet |number=1945131355022499928 |user=eduardopaes |title=Sabem de nada!  N√£o entendem de Rio!   No mesmo espa√ßo que cabem 660 mil  brit√¢nicos, cabem 2.2 milh√µes de brasileiros animados e felizes!  E calientes! |first=Eduardo |last=Paes |date=July 15, 2025}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|last=Torres |first=Mauricio |last2=Ulloa |first2=Christopher |date=2025-05-04 |title=2.1 million person crowd estimated at free Lady Gaga concert on Rio‚Äôs Copacabana beach |url=https://www.cnn.com/2025/05/04/americas/rio-millions-crowd-copacabana-lady-gaga-intl-hnk |access-date=2025-08-10 |website=CNN |language=en |quote=Guests started queuing from early Saturday morning to secure a good spot for the show, which is paid for by local authorities. Organizers said about 2.1 million revelers were estimated to have been in the crowd.}}</ref>
 However, Pollstar, Billboard, Rolling Stone, and multiple other reliable sources have reported an audience of 2.5 million.
<ref>{{Cite web |date=2025-05-05 |title=Lady Gaga Sets Record With 2.5 Million Attendees For Rio Concert - Pollstar News |url=https://news.pollstar.com/2025/05/05/lady-gaga-sets-record-with-2-5-million-attendees-for-rio-concert/ |access-date=2025-08-10 |language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Peters |first=Mitchell |date=2025-05-04 |title=Lady Gaga Draws 2.5 Million Fans to Record-Breaking Free Concert at Rio‚Äôs Copacabana Beach |url=https://www.billboard.com/music/music-news/lady-gaga-copacabana-beach-rio-concert-record-breaking-1235961924/ |access-date=2025-08-10 |website=Billboard |language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Kreps |first=Daniel |date=2025-05-04 |title=Lady Gaga Performs to Record-Breaking Crowd at Rio's Copacabana Beach |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-news/lady-gaga-record-breaking-crowd-bio-brazil-copacabana-beach-1235331033/ |access-date=2025-08-10 |website=Rolling Stone |language=en-US}}</ref>}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)#rfc_D90E1F5|Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)]] expired 2025-09-09 17:01 ===
* Id: D90E1F5
* User: Locke Cole
* Date: 2025-08-12 00:38:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1306051853|POLICY 1306051853}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1306051857|PROP 1306051857}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1310676270|POLICY 1310676270}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1310676272|PROP 1310676272}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
We had an RFC earlier this year around how to handle LLM/AI generated comments. That resulted in [[WP:HATGPT]] after further discussion at [[WT:TPG]]. Recently, an editor [[Special:Diff/1304748131|started a requested move using LLM generated content]]. I ran that content through two different AI/LLM detection utilities: GPT Zero says "highly confident", and 100% AI generated; Quillbot stated 72% of the text was likely AI generated. 

Should HATGPT be expanded to allow for the closure of discussions seeking community input (RFC/VPR/CENT/RFAR/AFD/RM/TFD/RFD/FFD/etc) that are started utilizing content that registers as being majority written by AI? 

I was tempted to just start an RFC on this, but if there's alternate proposals or an existing [[WP:PAG]] that already covers this, I'm all ears. =) ‚Äî[[User:Locke Cole|Locke Cole]] ‚Ä¢ [[User talk:Locke Cole|t]] ‚Ä¢ [[Special:Contributions/Locke Cole|c]] 00:38, 12 August 2025 (UTC)}}


=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)#rfc_E526D0C|Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)]] expired 2025-09-09 17:01 ===
* Id: E526D0C
* User: ElijahPepe
* Date: 2025-08-10 16:38:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1305444268|POLICY 1305444268}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1310444660|POLICY 1310444660}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I am an AMPOL editor and I often see articles with party affiliation assumed in the infobox. For instance, [[Adriana Kugler]]'s infobox states that she is a Democrat, but no inline citation is provided. On the other hand, [[Todd Blanche]] does provide a citation for having registered as a Republican. I am questioning the purpose of this parameter for individuals who are not directly associated with politics‚Äîin other words, their profession does not pertain to being a politician or political consultant. "If relevant" in the {{T|Infobox person}} documentation is rather vague. The misuse of this parameter warrants some action.

The rationale for removing the party affiliation parameter is similar to [[Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)/Archive 126#RfC: Religion in biographical infoboxes|the RfC over the religion parameter]]. As was stated then, "This would be consistent with our treatment of sexual orientation and various other things we don't include in infoboxes that are matters which may be nuanced, complex, and frequently controversial. The availability of a parameter encourages editors to fill it, whether they have consensus to do so or not, regardless of instructions in template documentation to gain consensus first; new and anon IP editors generally do not read documentation, they simply see a "missing" parameter at article B that they saw at article A and add it." <span style="font-family: monospace;">[[User talk:ElijahPepe|elijahpepe@wikipedia]] (he/him)</span> 16:38, 10 August 2025 (UTC)}}

[[User:Freedoxm|<b style="color: #f8f8f8; background-color: #011236">Freedoxm</b>]] ([[User talk:Freedoxm|<b style="color:#025f96">talk</b>]] '''¬∑''' [[Special:Contributions/Freedoxm|<b style="color:#025f96">contribs</b>]]) 19:40, 2 September 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)#rfc_A84A0DF|Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)]] expired 2025-09-11 01:02 ===
* Id: A84A0DF
* User: RetroCosmos
* Date: 2025-08-26 01:45:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1307852530|POLICY 1307852530}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1313232474|POLICY 1313232474}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The [[WP:MOS|Manual of Style]] varies in [[WP:CONLEVEL|levels of consensus]]. In [[Wikipedia:Arbitration/Requests/Case/Article_titles_and_capitalisation_2]] it was alleged for some parts of MOS: {{tq|some of those guidelines have fewer watchers than my talk page, and are largely written by parties to this case}} [[Special:Diff/1307322181|(see discussion)]]. Meanwhile, CONLEVELS states: 

{{tqb|Consensus among a limited group of editors, at one place and time, cannot override community consensus on a wider scale. For instance, unless they can convince the broader community that such action is right, participants in a WikiProject cannot decide that some generally accepted policy or guideline does not apply to articles within its scope.}}

I don't think it's unreasonable to conclude that while some parts of MOS are the result of consensus with significant participation, there may be other parts that are indeed {{tq|consensus among a limited group of editors, at one place and time}}.

Also of note are the [[Special:Diff/1306799581|proposals]] by L235 that did not make principles for that case. Specifically, 

{{tqb|Policies and guidelines have a combination of prescriptive and descriptive characteristics. Policies and guidelines document community consensus as to {{tq|"standards [that] all users should normally follow"}} ([[Wikipedia:Policies and guidelines]]), giving them some degree of prescriptive force. Simultaneously, policies and guidelines seek to describe {{tq|"behaviors practiced by most editors"}} ([[Wikipedia:Policies and guidelines]]), and change with community practice, giving them a descriptive quality. Naturally, disagreements regarding the extent of a policy's consensus or prescriptive effect arise from this combination, and the text of a policy can sometimes diverge from or lag behind community consensus. These disagreements, like all disputes on Wikipedia, should be resolved by discussion and consensus.}}

'''Does MOS necessarily indicate community consensus on a wider scale?''' In other words, should closers examine the specific text for level of consensus before using it to overrule a (potentially larger) group of editors? <span style="font-family:Ink Free"> Good day‚Äî[[User:RetroCosmos|<span style="color:navy">RetroCosmos</span>]] <sup>[[User talk:RetroCosmos|<span style="color:black">talk</span>]]</sup></span> 01:45, 26 August 2025 (UTC)}}


=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_AA16E69|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2025-09-11 21:01 ===
* Id: AA16E69
* User: Chetsford
* Date: 2025-08-31 01:02:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1308658824|MEDIA 1308658824}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1314164645|MEDIA 1314164645}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Is [[encyclopedia.com]] ... 

*'''Option 1:''' Generally [[WP:RS|reliable]] 
*'''Option 2:''' Unclear or additional considerations apply.
*'''Option 3:''' Generally [[WP:QUESTIONABLE|unreliable]] for factual reporting.
*'''Option 4:''' Publishes false or fabricated information, and should be [[WP:DEPS|deprecated]]
[[User:Chetsford|Chetsford]] ([[User talk:Chetsford|talk]]) 01:02, 31 August 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)#rfc_A5E46F8|Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)]] expired 2025-09-17 13:04 ===
* Id: A5E46F8
* User: FOARP
* Date: 2025-09-17 11:16:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|1311879065|UNSORTED 1311879065}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|1311885312|UNSORTED 1311885312}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
[https://web.archive.org/web/20150203040050/http://olympstats.com/2015/01/30/how-many-olympians-have-there-been According to the Olympstats blog], one possible estimate for the total number of people to have participated in the Olympics as of 2015 was 128,420, though as it notes other estimates could be created. It has been proposed to create a complete alphabetical listing of all participants of the Olympics, spread across a number of articles. An example of one of these lists can be seen [[List of Olympic competitors (Che‚ÄìChz)|here]].

'''Previous discussions'''

* [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Olympics#Creating a list of Olympic competitors|Discussion on the Olympics project]].
* [[Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/List of Olympic competitors (Aa‚ÄìAk)|AFD discussion]] (nb. this RFC was recommended in the close here).

'''Survey'''

Do you:
*'''Oppose''' creation of these articles
*'''Support''' creation of these articles

'''Responses'''

*'''Oppose''' - The possible number of entrants makes this essentially a phonebook, something which Wikipedia is clearly [[WP:NOT]]. It would not be useful for navigation because of its length - a figure that is not even fixed but grows by thousands with each edition of the summer and winter games. [[User:FOARP|FOARP]] ([[User talk:FOARP|talk]]) 11:16, 17 September 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Biographies of living persons#rfc_3E9FD45|Wikipedia talk:Biographies of living persons]] expired 2025-09-19 16:02 ===
* Id: 3E9FD45
* User: Beland
* Date: 2025-09-18 19:23:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1312125265|BIO 1312125265}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1312257806|BIO 1312257806}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the following sentence in [[WP:BLPCRIME]]:

"A living person accused of a crime is presumed innocent until convicted by a court of law."

be replaced with:
 
"Wikipedia remains neutral on whether an accused person is guilty of a crime until a conviction by a reliable court, or guilty plea or public confession (unless reliable sources report coercion or recanting or other reason for credible doubt)."

? -- [[User:Beland|Beland]] ([[User talk:Beland|talk]]) 19:23, 18 September 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Draft talk:Peter Renz#rfc_3E5B2CF|Draft talk:Peter Renz]] expired 2025-09-20 18:07 ===
* Id: 3E5B2CF
* User: Toploftical
* Date: 2025-09-20 13:22:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1312411473|BIO 1312411473}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1312411477|SCI 1312411477}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1312448793|BIO 1312448793}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1312448796|SCI 1312448796}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
.

Submission of this draft was declined on 3 September 2025 by [[User:Royiswariii]].  

Royiswariii said the article does not meet any of the eight academic-specific criteria. Here are two such criteria that the article did meet:  See [[Wikipedia:Notability (academics)]]

1. The person has received a highly prestigious academic award or honor at a national or international level.
: Renz received the [[George P√≥lya Award]] in 1981.

2. The person has been the head or chief editor of a major, well-established academic journal in their subject area.
: Starting in 1961, Renz was the editor of the journal [[Advances in Mathematics]].

Royiswariii said the article does not meet cite multiple reliable, secondary sources independent of the subject, which cover the subject in some depth.  Here are citations that do cover Dr Renz in some depth:

: [https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/abs/10.1080/00494925.1979.11972357 Martin Gardner: Defending the Honor of the Human Mind] The Two-Year College Mathematics Journal, vol. 10, no. 4, 1979, pp. 227-232

: [https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Peter-Renz-4  Peter Renz at ResearchGate]

: [https://martin-gardner.org/SciAm4.html What made 'Mathematical Games' special]

: [https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/abs/10.1080/00494925.1979.11972357 Journal Article]  Notes on Contributors
[[User:Toploftical|Toploftical]] ([[User talk:Toploftical|talk]]) 13:22, 20 September 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Richard Desmond#rfc_146B6FB|Talk:Richard Desmond]] expired 2025-09-23 11:01 ===
* Id: 146B6FB
* User: MacFleet76
* Date: 2025-09-09 15:13:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1310437389|BIO 1310437389}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1312927098|BIO 1312927098}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I propose renaming the section header from ‚ÄúPornography‚Äù to ‚ÄúAdult media‚Äù. This terminology is more neutral and accurately reflects the scope of the section, which covers adult publications and adult television channels‚Äînot just pornography.

For context, in reviewing a broad range of reliable sources, including The Guardian, The Independent, Reuters, and City A.M., I found that the majority of coverage refers to Desmond‚Äôs former businesses as either ‚Äúadult‚Äù or a combination of ‚Äúadult‚Äù and ‚Äúpornography.‚Äù Only one article published post-2010 uses ‚Äúporn‚Äù exclusively. In at least three cases, ‚Äúporn‚Äù appears only in the headline, while the body of the article consistently uses ‚Äúadult‚Äù terminology, which I interpret as editorial choices for attention rather than strict categorisation.

Based on this research, I believe that ‚Äúadult‚Äù is a commonly accepted and broader descriptor in mainstream reporting, not merely a euphemism. 

The current term ‚ÄúPornography‚Äù carries negative connotations and may inadvertently frame the subject in a pejorative way, which risks violating [[Wikipedia:Neutral point of view|WP:NPOV]] (neutral point of view). Using ‚ÄúAdult media‚Äù avoids these implications and provides a broader, more balanced descriptor that reflects the actual content.

Additionally, framing the section under ‚ÄúPornography‚Äù could be seen as giving undue weight to a single aspect of adult entertainment, raising WP:DUE concerns. It also risks falling afoul of [[Wikipedia:Criticism|WP:CSECTION]], since labeling a section with a term that implies criticism rather than neutrally describing its contents may constitute a non-neutral section title.

‚ÄúAdult media‚Äù is therefore preferable to both ‚ÄúPornography‚Äù and ‚ÄúAdult content,‚Äù as it is descriptive, inclusive of the different types of adult-oriented material covered in the section, and consistent with Wikipedia‚Äôs policy requirements for neutrality and due representation.

Should the section heading ‚ÄúPornography‚Äù in this article be changed to ‚ÄúAdult content,‚Äù reflecting the terminology used in the majority of reliable sources (which often alternate between ‚Äúpornography‚Äù and ‚Äúadult‚Äù), while retaining ‚Äúpornography‚Äù in the article text where supported?

Please indicate clearly whether you support or oppose the change. [[User:MacFleet76|MacFleet76]] ([[User talk:MacFleet76|talk]]) 15:13, 9 September 2025 (UTC)}}

* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1313705972|HIST 1313705972}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1313744607|HIST 1313744607}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The claim of ''Caledonia'' launching with 64-cwt 32-pounder cannon seems dubious... but the only sources I am able to access either don't give a weight for these (lower-gundeck) cannons, or‚Äîin the one case‚Äî''do(es)'' list such a measurement (but ''also'' implicitly contradicts it). Hoping that, perhaps, an expert might have access to a way to check, or else might be able to say "no bro u dumb it is totally right", heh; see below for more.  

['''Note:'''  ''not sure if I'm doing this right; maybe it doesn't warrant an RfC.  If so, please feel free to remove the RfC tag or let me know & I'll do it.'']

<hr>

I think this may be an error in Winfield: in his ''British Warships ... 1793‚Äì1817,'' he doesn't specifically mention the weight of the guns for ''Caledonia;'' '''but''' he '''does''' mention that all post-''Hibernia'' first-rates‚Äîwhich would incl. ''Caledonia,'' I believe‚Äîwere to have 56-cwt 32-pdr cannon on their lower gundecks... and this ''is'' the standard weight for these (Blomefield) guns.

''As far as I know,'' in fact, there '''was no such thing''' as a 64-cwt 32-pdr, in the Royal Navy of this period; at least, I cannot find such a thing in Douglas‚Äôs (1855 4th ed.) ''Treatise on Naval Gunnery,'' nor McConnell‚Äôs ''British Smooth-Bore Artillery'' (1988).

And, indeed, these supposed 64-cwt 32-pound cannon are listed '''only''' this single time, in Winfield's ''British Warships ... 1817‚Äì1863,'' and '''nowhere at all''' in ''...1793‚Äì1817''‚Äîso either no other ship ever had 'em, and Winfield forgot to mention them in the previous volume¬π...

...or else it's an error.

<hr>

I am struggling to figure out what Winfield might have ''meant,'' though:  if we suppose that the original 32-pdrs likely weighed 56 cwt, and that the 1831 refit replaced them with 55-cwt guns... then the 1840 re-armament is again, apparently, replacing the latter with 56-cwt models‚Äîpossible, but maybe a bit odd...?

The 63-cwt Millar models might be a possibility for the 1831 replacements‚Äîthe time-line works, I think (1829 or so being about when they were introduced, IIRC)‚Äîbut that would require Winfield to have both ('''a''') accidentally transposed the two weights (easily done), ''and'' ('''b''') written "55" when he meant "56" & "64" when he meant "63" (not-so-easily done, perhaps:  off-by-1 errors are less common in humans than in computers, I think!).


Anyway, just thought I'd leave this here in case anyone knows better, or can suggest another source to check (+ I'm working on getting Winfield's latest book in case it's got something relevant). Cheers.

&nbsp;

<hr>

¬π:  ''[One might be tempted to say here "ah, but what if they weren't introduced to'' Caledonia ''until after 1817?  that'd explain at least the latter fact"‚Äîbut can't be:  they're mentioned as'' being '''replaced''' ''in her first refit, in 1831.  Hence, she must have started with 'em‚Äîif they existed!]''

[[User:Himaldrmann|Himaldrmann]] ([[User talk:Himaldrmann|talk]]) 00:52, 27 September 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Notability#rfc_96FC34E|Wikipedia talk:Notability]] expired 2025-10-02 05:01 ===
* Id: 96FC34E
* User: Katzrockso
* Date: 2025-09-29 14:28:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1314480616|POLICY 1314480616}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1314580567|POLICY 1314580567}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I've been wondering what the exact scope of [[WP:NOPAGE]] is supposed to refer to. Is [[WP:NOPAGE]] supposed to be a reason to delete content or determine whether something should be included in another article?  I think that the examples provided in the guideline are narrow in scope and refer to topics in which standalone pages would require too much background context and repeat content. However, I have seen it interpreted in different contexts as a reason to remove notable content altogether. [[User:Katzrockso|Katzrockso]] ([[User talk:Katzrockso|talk]]) 14:28, 29 September 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_F106634|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2025-10-02 17:01 ===
* Id: F106634
* User: Chetsford
* Date: 2025-10-01 22:50:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1314533385|SCI 1314533385}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1314666844|SCI 1314666844}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
'''Q1:'''<small><del>Under [[WP:FRIND]], is material from UFO content creators a reliable source for UFOs and adjacent topics including physics, aviation, armed forces, engineering, astronomy, government secrecy, and the paranormal?</del></small><br/>
<ins>With respect to UFOs and adjacent topics (including astronomy, engineering, physics, and political science) are UFO content creators covered by [[WP:FRIND]] and should they be used only to the extent they "have been noticed and given proper context in mainstream sources"?</ins> 
*'''Yes'''
*'''No''' 
<del>For operationalization of this RfC, "UFO content creator" means a person ''principally known'' for appearances in UFO-themed podcasts/documentaries/broadcasting; speaking at UFO conventions; or writing popular texts on UFOs. It does not include persons writing on the topic of UFO belief or its history, distinct from UFOs as an alleged physical occurrence.</del> [[User:Chetsford|Chetsford]] ([[User talk:Chetsford|talk]]) 22:50, 1 October 2025 (UTC)}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1314924139|POL 1314924139}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I have reverted your edit to [[List of companies involved in the Gaza war]] as it added potentially libelous content, and I have requested [[WP:OVERSIGHT]] to hide the affected revisions.  [[WP:LIBEL]] is one policy [[WP:Legal policies|we absolutely can't ignore]] as violations can lead to legal action being taken against Wikipedia or even individual editors.  We have to be ''extra'' careful to not make accusations of involvement in genocide in Wikivoice against individuals or companies without a court of law finding said individuals/companies guilty of such.  The consensus at [[Talk:Gaza genocide]] is not a green light for people to make accusations of involvement in Wikivoice.

This is not a legal threat per [[WP:NOTLEGAL]]. - [[User:ZLEA|<span style="color:#6B8E23">ZLEA</span>]] <sup>[[User talk:ZLEA|<span style="color:#6B8E23">T</span>]]<span style="color:#6B8E23">«Ä</span>[[Special:Contributions/ZLEA|<span style="color:#6B8E23">C</span>]]</sup> 18:48, 30 September 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Libel#rfc_5EEF616|Wikipedia talk:Libel]] expired 2025-10-06 19:01 ===
* Id: 5EEF616
* User: Alexandraaaacs1989#Libel
* Date: 2025-10-06 09:19:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1315440911|POL 1315440911}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1315450161|POL 1315450161}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Hi all. On my [[User talk:Alexandraaaacs1989#Libel|talk page]], there was a discussion about the role of [[WP:LIBEL]] related to genocide allegations in Wikivoice against companies not convicted of genocide, which then [[Talk:List of companies involved in the Holocaust# RFC on WP:LIBEL - interpretation of policy relating to this page|went to another place]], and it was finally decided the discussion be moved here.

'''What are interpretations surrounding [[WP:LIBEL]] as it applies to companies that are documented, but not convicted, facilitating a genocide?'''

For context, per [[Talk:Gaza genocide#RfC on first sentence]] we can refer to the [[Gaza genocide]] as "the" genocide in other articles assuming [[WP:LIBEL]] does not apply. An example where this is relevant: in the [[World Central Kitchen aid convoy attack]], the drone used was produced by [[Elbit Systems]] according to [[WP:V]] and [[WP:RS]] sources. Does [[WP:LIBEL]] apply? [[User:Alexandraaaacs1989|Alexandraaaacs1989]] ([[User talk:Alexandraaaacs1989|talk]]) 09:19, 6 October 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Benjamin Netanyahu#rfc_8665435|Talk:Benjamin Netanyahu]] expired 2025-10-07 08:01 ===
* Id: 8665435
* User: Nehushtani
* Date: 2025-10-01 05:54:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1314417109|POL 1314417109}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1315548490|POL 1315548490}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
[[MOS:FIRSTBIO]] states that the opening sentance should be "avoiding subjective or contentious terms". I furthermore states that one should "try to not overload the first sentence by describing everything notable about the subject; instead, spread relevant information over the lead paragraph." As such, calling him a "fugitive under international law" seems out of place. [[User:Nehushtani|Nehushtani]] ([[User talk:Nehushtani|talk]]) 05:54, 1 October 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Vanessa Kirby#rfc_C7D4DAB|Talk:Vanessa Kirby]] expired 2025-10-07 23:01 ===
* Id: C7D4DAB
* User: Betty Logan
* Date: 2025-09-07 22:31:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1310139847|BIO 1310139847}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1315659878|BIO 1315659878}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Sources disagree other Vanessa Kirby's age/dob. The dominant dob in secondary reliable sources is April 18, 1988. There are other sources, however, that give 1987 as a date and articles where her given age is consistent with the 1987 date rather than the 1988 date. Primary source information such as the government registration of her company also favor the 1987 date. The crux of the debate is the tension between [[WP:BLPPRIMARY]] (which favors 1988) and [[WP:TRUTHMATTERS]] (which favours 1987).

There are four options:
# 1987 
# 1988 [per [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Vanessa_Kirby&oldid=1310129798]
# Both dates with accompanying note (the [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Vanessa_Kirby&oldid=1310132902 status quo version])
# No date

[[User:Betty Logan|Betty Logan]] ([[User talk:Betty Logan|talk]]) 22:31, 7 September 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_C93845D|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2025-10-09 03:01 ===
* Id: C93845D
* User: Chetsford
* Date: 2025-09-09 02:30:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1310354330|SCI 1310354330}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1315863330|SCI 1315863330}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
In relation to flying saucers (sometimes also called "UFOs", "UAPs", "USOs", etc.) are online-only (versus print) articles by ''[[Popular Mechanics]]'':  
*'''Option 1:''' Generally [[WP:RS|reliable]] for factual reporting.
*'''Option 2:''' Unclear or additional considerations apply.
*'''Option 3:''' Generally [[WP:QUESTIONABLE|unreliable]] for factual reporting.
*'''Option 4:''' Publishes false or fabricated information, and should be [[WP:DEPS|deprecated]].
[[User:Chetsford|Chetsford]] ([[User talk:Chetsford|talk]]) 02:30, 9 September 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Coptic language#rfc_BC18098|Talk:Coptic language]] expired 2025-10-09 10:01 ===
* Id: BC18098
* User: 172.91.72.116
* Date: 2025-09-27 01:09:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1313586971|HIST 1313586971}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1313586987|POLICY 1313586987}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1315903468|HIST 1315903468}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1315903473|POLICY 1315903473}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Request For Comment for the discussion [[Talk:Coptic_language#c-Squatch347-20250922140900-172.91.72.116-20250921003600| Coptic Language Prohibition?]] on the Coptic Language talk page. 

It is a VERY long 49 page discussion in full; I would start reading about half way through where the WP:3O user Squatch comes in for the sake of brevity and summary as everything said before is only either reiterated in more refined form after, dropped, or expanded upon with new sources. For max brevity you may even be able to make do with just the last reply by each of us in the discussion although I'd say the last 2 replies from each might be better. But of course read the entirety if you feel so inclined to see all the evolutions. 

I definitely think Policy has something to say here, and I wasn't sure to also call on History or Language RFC but since this is dealing with the HISTORY of the language I figured that was what made sense. But arguably the more eyes on this the better to ensure prevention of [[ WP:FALSECON]].

Basically we are disagreeing on how to phrase something based on whether a claim regarding the history of the Coptic Language is exclusive to a single Coptologist or more widely held. The particular claim is the order by the Caliph Al-Hakim on the prohibition of the Coptic Language and the penalties for it. The other user wishes to rephrase it in such a way to suggest this claim is a fringe belief by a single academic. I believe should it be phrased more generally as is the status quo as it is supported by the most authoritative work on the topic and several other works with nothing opposing it in secondary sources. 

At any rate this debate has gone on for a week and I'd like it resolved as it is just going in circles at this point and I've spent enough hours on it I think to warrant an escalation and I'm losing faith a resolution is possible as things stand. [[Special:Contributions/172.91.72.116|172.91.72.116]] ([[User talk:172.91.72.116|talk]]) 01:09, 27 September 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Java (programming language)#rfc_97BFDA9|Talk:Java (programming language)]] expired 2025-10-09 20:01 ===
* Id: 97BFDA9
* User: 24.50.56.74
* Date: 2025-10-07 18:03:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1315627545|SCI 1315627545}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1315981519|SCI 1315981519}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Java 25 introduces a new "Hello, world" program:
<syntaxhighlight lang="java">
void main() {
    IO.println("Hello, world!");
}
</syntaxhighlight>
contrasting the traditional, more verbose version:
<syntaxhighlight lang="java">
public class Main {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        System.out.println("Hello, world!");
    }
}
</syntaxhighlight>
While I personally prefer to present modern examples of code as much as possible, it is still undeniable that the second (older) example is essentially ubiquitous in both the literature and any tutorials on the language. Indeed the first is perhaps far more beginner-friendly (avoids having to demonstrate keywords and constructs that are new to a beginner), however it is still far too recent to be accepted as ''the'' Java "Hello, world" program. This is the case on the [[C++]] page, which similarly has a "Hello, world" program that is superseded by a newer version. For this reason I want to gather comments regarding which "Hello, world" program is preferred and appropriate to show. I started a [[Talk:C++#Request for comments regarding C++ "Hello, world" program|similar RfC]] on the C++ page as well. [[Special:Contributions/24.50.56.74|24.50.56.74]] ([[User talk:24.50.56.74|talk]]) 18:03, 7 October 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Russian Wikipedia#rfc_1CEDE77|Talk:Russian Wikipedia]] expired 2025-10-12 22:01 ===
* Id: 1CEDE77

{{rfcquote|text=
@[[User:Ymblanter|Ymblanter]] [[WP:RUS]] is not a Wikipedia policy, it is an essay. That has no weight on anything. Especially not when there are countless English Wikipedia articles each of varying Romanization systems for Russian topics. ja is the romanization given by [[Scientific transliteration of Cyrillic]] and has been used for decades, and /ja/ is more correct as it matches the IPA pronunciation of the letter. 

For transliterating ¬´—è¬ª, should "ja" be used or "ya"? (This could also be extended to other Cyrillic letters (—à as ≈°, etc.) [[Special:Contributions/2605:8D80:6C21:7EF8:E15E:B72C:BEBC:AE40|2605:8D80:6C21:7EF8:E15E:B72C:BEBC:AE40]] ([[User talk:2605:8D80:6C21:7EF8:E15E:B72C:BEBC:AE40|talk]]) 21:09, 12 September 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:C++#rfc_AD73A41|Talk:C++]] expired 2025-10-14 18:01 ===
* Id: AD73A41
* User: 24.50.56.74
* Date: 2025-10-07 18:12:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1315627545|SCI 1315627545}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1316822891|SCI 1316822891}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
C++23 introduces a new "Hello, world" program:
<syntaxhighlight lang="cpp">
import std;

int main() {
    std::println("Hello, world!");
}
</syntaxhighlight>
contrasting the traditional, more verbose version:
<syntaxhighlight lang="cpp">
#include <iostream>

int main() {
    std::cout << "Hello, world!" << std::endl;
}
</syntaxhighlight>
While I personally prefer to present modern examples of code as much as possible, it is still undeniable that the second (older) example is essentially ubiquitous in both the literature and any tutorials on the language. Indeed the first is perhaps far more beginner-friendly (avoids explaining the <code>operator<<</code>, I/O streams, etc.), however it is still far too recent to be accepted as ''the'' C++ "Hello, world" program. (Do note that currently, the "Hello world" program has a note requesting that users first discuss changes on the talk page/get consensus before actually changing it.) I contrast this with the [[Java (programming language)]] page, where the Java 25 updated "Hello, world" program was adopted on the page, and I started a [[Talk:Java (programming language)#Request for comment regarding Java "Hello, world" program|related RfC]] on that page. I also noticed that there was a talk about this about a year and a half ago, but I think that enough time has passed to revisit this discussion. It was mentioned that the newer version appears in Stroustrup's new books, but I haven't looked at those books. [[Special:Contributions/24.50.56.74|24.50.56.74]] ([[User talk:24.50.56.74|talk]]) 18:12, 7 October 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Australian Wikipedians' notice board#rfc_60CB85A|Wikipedia:Australian Wikipedians' notice board]] expired 2025-10-14 20:01 ===
* Id: 60CB85A
* User: Beland
* Date: 2025-09-14 19:02:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1311336752|STYLE 1311336752}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1316839980|STYLE 1316839980}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should [[WP:NCAUST]] be changed to say the state or territory name "may" be in an article title for a place name, to say that these should only be used if needed for disambiguation? (Other changes are also included in the proposed text.) -- [[User:Beland|Beland]] ([[User talk:Beland|talk]]) 19:02, 14 September 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Weather#rfc_E3DB051|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Weather]] expired 2025-10-14 23:01 ===
* Id: E3DB051
* User: WeatherWriter
* Date: 2025-09-14 22:13:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1311364229|HIST 1311364229}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1311364230|SCI 1311364230}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1316863854|HIST 1316863854}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1316863857|SCI 1316863857}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Weather|WikiProject Weather]] encourage the use of [[WP:COLLAGE|infobox collages]] for weather with standalone articles?

Brief background: Infobox images are an often-debated topic for weather articles, sometimes leading to edit wars. In fact, [[tropical cyclones]] has an extremely detailed ordering of what image should take precedent ([[WP:WPTC/IMG]]), due to how many edit wars have occurred. Very few weather articles currently contain infobox collages; four examples include [[2020 California wildfires]], [[Joplin tornado]], [[Tornadoes of 2024]], and the very recent [[July 2025 Central Texas floods]]. I am able to locate less than 20 weather articles with infobox collages. Some of the most notable weather disasters only display a single image in their infobox including these five examples: [[Hurricane Katrina]], [[Hurricane Harvey]], [[Hurricane Maria]], [[Tornadoes of 2025]] and [[Hurricane Helene]] (along with [[Effects of Hurricane Helene in North Carolina|Effects in North Carolina]] subpage). According to [[WP:COLLAGETIPS]], "{{tq|The great benefit of collages is that they allow an article to present multiple visuals for the topic. This makes them particularly useful for leads of broad subjects such as many cities, where using a single image could never be representative enough to suffice by itself.}}"

Just in September 2025, [[Effects of Hurricane Helene in North Carolina]] and [[Hurricane Maria]] have both had infobox image debates and edit wars. To reduce edit wars, should infobox collages be more widely encouraged for all weather articles, should they be discouraged, or should be encouraged for certain types and discouraged for certain types? '''The [[User:WeatherWriter|Weather Event Writer]]''' ([[User talk:WeatherWriter|Talk Page)]] 22:13, 14 September 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Article titles#rfc_7DDDA4E|Wikipedia talk:Article titles]] expired 2025-10-14 23:01 ===
* Id: 7DDDA4E
* User: Surtsicna
* Date: 2025-10-02 00:27:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1314548118|POLICY 1314548118}}

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the titles of articles about parliament constituencies (e.g. [[:Category:Parliamentary constituencies in Essex|in Essex]]) always contain the parenthetical "(UK Parliament constituency)" or only when one is needed for disambiguation? [[User:Surtsicna|Surtsicna]] ([[User talk:Surtsicna|talk]]) 00:27, 2 October 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Lists#rfc_90998AB|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Lists]] expired 2025-10-15 19:01 ===
* Id: 90998AB
* User: RanDom 404
* Date: 2025-09-15 18:42:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1311559026|MEDIA 1311559026}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1311559031|STYLE 1311559031}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1317000240|MEDIA 1317000240}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1317000243|STYLE 1317000243}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
What should the standard naming convention, if any, be, for lists of characters in media franchises? As of now, there appear to be three different ways of naming these. Here I use the Cars franchise as an example:
* '''A:''' List of Cars characters
* '''B:''' List of Cars (franchise) characters
* '''C:''' List of characters in the Cars franchise
Should any of these be adopted as a standard naming convention rather than the other two? [[User:RanDom 404|RanDom 404]] ([[User talk:RanDom 404|talk]]) 18:42, 15 September 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of entertainment affected by the September 11 attacks#rfc_2F51158|Talk:List of entertainment affected by the September 11 attacks]] expired 2025-10-18 06:01 ===
* Id: 2F51158
* User: MrPersonHumanGuy
* Date: 2025-10-17 17:20:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1317354207|MEDIA 1317354207}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1317354209|SOC 1317354209}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1317460080|MEDIA 1317460080}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1317460084|SOC 1317460084}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I'd like to have the following done with this article:
* Change its title to one that doesn't contain "{{!xt|List of entertainment affected}}...".
::The current title is the equivalent of there being an article titled [[List of education affected by the COVID-19 pandemic]] as opposed to [[Impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on education]].
* Convert its content into prose like on [[Draft:Impact of the September 11 attacks on entertainment]] so that the new title would be justified.
Earlier this year, I requested that this article be moved to [[Impact of the September 11 attacks on the entertainment industry]], but no consensus had been established, so I'm starting an RfC to continue this debate.

* '''Option A''': Change this article's title to:
** '''A1''': [[Impact of the September 11 attacks on entertainment]]
** '''A2''': [[Impact of the September 11 attacks on the entertainment industry]]
** '''A3''': [[Entertainment affected by the September 11 attacks]]
** '''A4''': Some other title (please specify)
* '''Option B''': Keep this article at its current title and create a non-list article with a redundantly similar scope, titled:
** '''B1''': [[Impact of the September 11 attacks on entertainment]]
** '''B2''': [[Impact of the September 11 attacks on the entertainment industry]]
** '''B3''': [[Entertainment affected by the September 11 attacks]]
** '''B4''': Some other title (please specify)
* '''Option C''': Keep this article at its current title and don't create a non-list counterpart.
I've been wishing for '''Option A''', but I would consider Option B to be a fair compromise. If you're arguing for Option A or B and can't decide on a title, you may simply omit the number from your !vote. ‚Äì [[User:MrPersonHumanGuy|MrPersonHumanGuy]] ([[User talk:MrPersonHumanGuy|talk]]) 17:20, 17 October 2025 (UTC)}}
