=== [[Wikipedia:Neutral point of view/Noticeboard#rfc_6CE8DD5|Wikipedia:Neutral point of view/Noticeboard]] expired 2025-11-18 22:01 ===
* Id: 6CE8DD5
* User: Gitz6666
* Date: 2025-11-12 16:11:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1321781440|SCI 1321781440}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1321781442|POL 1321781442}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1322968309|SCI 1322968309}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1322968312|POL 1322968312}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the statement "Gender exploratory therapy (GET) is a form of conversion therapy" appear in wikivoice? {{ordered list |list-style-type=upper-alpha

| Keep the current [[WP:WIKIVOICE|wikivoice]] statement that "GET is a form of conversion therapy".

| Revise to [[WP:ATTRIBUTION|in-text attribution]] with conditional phrasing (example: "GET has been described by major medical organizations and scholars as tantamount to conversion therapy when used to delay or deny indicated gender-affirming care").

| Revise to [[Wikipedia:Neutral point of view#Balance|balanced attribution]], summarizing both main viewpoints (example: "Some professional and academic sources describe GET as a form of conversion therapy, while others caution against conflating neutral exploration with conversion practices").

| Other (please propose alternative wording). }} [[User:Gitz6666|Gitz]] ([[User talk:Gitz6666|talk]]) ([[Special:Contributions/Gitz6666|contribs]]) 16:11, 12 November 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Azim Premji#rfc_431C98F|Talk:Azim Premji]] expired 2025-11-20 10:01 ===
* Id: 431C98F
* User: Niranjan Ramamurthy
* Date: 2025-10-21 09:56:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1318005000|BIO 1318005000}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1323207246|BIO 1323207246}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Dear editors, 

I'm hoping to get some fresh eyes on a content dispute here. The core issue is whether two major, long-running court cases against Premji, which were ultimately dismissed, should be included in the article.

*   '''My position''' is that they must be included for the article to be neutral and balanced. These cases were not minor; they were covered for years in major newspapers and one went to the Supreme Court. Omitting them entirely feels like a case of bias by omission. 

On Wikipedia, even serving prime ministers like [[Narendra Modi]] have their articles cover quashed legal cases in detail because they were significant public events. I believe the same standard should apply here. The proposal is to put them in a neutral "Legal affairs" section, clearly stating the final outcomes.

*   '''The counter-argument''' has been that since the cases were dismissed, they are "fringe" issues that lack [[WP:UNDUE|due weight]] for a biography. It was the same editor who brought up the Modi rhetoric. 

The content (the legal cases on Premji and criticisms) was removed from the article while the talk page discussion was ongoing, and that discussion has now stalled. It would be great to get a clear community consensus on this. 

Multiple attempts were made to make this BLP promotional, removing anything that's negative. Need some neutral eyes on this please.

Thanks,
[[User:Niranjan Ramamurthy|Niranjan Ramamurthy]] ([[User talk:Niranjan Ramamurthy|talk]]) 09:56, 21 October 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Requests for comment/Recall check-in#rfc_3D67C14|Wikipedia:Requests for comment/Recall check-in]] expired 2025-11-20 15:01 ===
* Id: 3D67C14
* Date: 2025-10-21 14:31:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1323236805|POLICY 1323236805}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1323236807|PROP 1323236807}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
English Wikipedia's recall process was largely based on German Wikipedia's recall process, but it has played out differently here than it did on German Wikipedia. Now that we've had 10 recall petitions it seems like a good time to examine the process.

Support 1 or more of the following: {{ordered list |list_style_type=upper-alpha
| Process is working well, no changes needed
| There should be some way of enabling support for the admin during the petition phase
| There should be fewer signatures needed
| There should be more signatures needed
| 30 days is too long, the petition process should be shorter
| 30 days is too short, the petition process should be longer
| Keep recall, but develop a different process than petition leading to a re-RFA
| Keep recall, but do some other change to how re-RFA works
| Keep recall, but do some other change to how the petition works
| Recall should be abolished
| Prohibit admins from !voting in RFCs to amend recall}}

When closing the closer is encouraged to think about overall support relative to participation in the RfA (e.g. if 5 people support Foo, 10 people support the opposite of Foo, and 30 people didn't support either but participate elsewhere, the consensus may be no change rather than opposite of Foo) and where a [[WP:BARTENDER|bartender's close]] may be appropriate. [[User:Barkeep49|Barkeep49]] ([[User_talk:Barkeep49|talk]]) 14:31, 21 October 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_4E3E4A1|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2025-11-21 00:01 ===
* Id: 4E3E4A1
* Date: 2025-11-20 14:08:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1322968304|BIO 1322968304}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1322968317|SOC 1322968317}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1328192347|BIO 1328192347}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1328192353|SOC 1328192353}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Which describes the reliability of Olympedia best:
*Option 1: The source is recognized as being generally reliable.
*Option 2: There is no consensus or additional considerations apply.
*Option 3: The source is recognized as being generally unreliable in most cases, though it can be used under certain circumstances.
*Option 4: The source is recognized as being generally unreliable and should be deprecated.
*Option 5: The source is:
:*a) Generally reliable for sports-statistics data.
:*b) Of unclear reliability for biographical data.
:*c) Not independent of the International Olympic Committee (IOC).
*Option 6: Another option (please specify) 
14:08, 20 November 2025 (UTC)}}


=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)#rfc_A851D73|Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)]] expired 2025-11-21 00:01 ===
* Id: A851D73
* User: Zackmann08
* Date: 2025-10-21 23:43:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1318108140|BIO 1318108140}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1318108147|POLICY 1318108147}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1318108153|TECH 1318108153}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1323305902|BIO 1323305902}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1323305917|POLICY 1323305917}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1323305926|TECH 1323305926}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
With the implementation of [[Module:Person date]], all {{para|birth_date}} and {{para|death_date}} values in Infoboxes (except for deities and fictional characters) are now parsed and age automatically calculated when possible.

With this implementation, it was found that there are a large number of cases (currently {{cconly|Pages with invalid birth or death dates}}) where the birth/death date is set to {{code|Unk}}, {{code|Unknown}}, {{code|?}} or {{code|##??}} (such as 19??). Full disclosure, [[Module:Person date]] was created by me and because of an issue early on I added a number of instances of {{para|death_date|Unknown}} in articles a few weeks ago. (I had not yet been informed about the MOS I link to below, that's my bad). 

Per [[MOS:INFOBOX]]: {{tq|If a parameter is not applicable, or no information is available, it should be left blank, and the template coded to selectively hide information or provide default values for parameters that are not defined.}}. 

There is also the essay [[WP:UNKNOWN]] which says, in short, {{tq|Don't say something is unknown just because you don't know}}.

So the question is what to do about these values? Currently [[Module:Person date]] is simply tracking them and placing those pages in {{clc|Category:Pages with invalid birth or death dates}}. It has been growing by the minute since I added that tracking. Now I am NOT proposing that this sort of tracking be done for every parameter in every infobox... There are plenty of cases of {{para|some_param|Unknown}}, but with this module we have a unique opportunity to address one of them.

I tried to find a good case where the {{para|death_date}} truly is Unknown, but all the cases I could think of use {{para|disappeared_date}} instead. (See [[Amelia Earhart]] for example).

;The way I see it there are a few options:
* '''Option A''' - Essentially do nothing. Keep the tracking category but make no actual changes to the pages.
* '''Option B''' - Implement a {{tl|preview warning}} that would say ''{{red|This value "VALUE" is invalid per [[MOS:INFOBOX]] & [[WP:UNKNOWN]].}}'' (Obviously open to suggestions on better language).
* '''Option C''' - Take B one step further and actually suppress the value. Display a preview warning that says ''{{red|This value "VALUE" is invalid per [[MOS:INFOBOX]] & [[WP:UNKNOWN]]. It will not be displayed when saved.}}'' then display nothing on the page. In other words treat {{para|death_date|Unknown}} the same as {{para|death_date}}. (Again open to suggestions on better language for the preview warning).
* '''Option D''' - Some other solution, please explain. 

Thanks in advance! --'''[[User:Zackmann08|<span style="color:#00ced1">Zack</span><span style="color:#007F94">mann</span>]]''' (<sup>[[User_talk:Zackmann08|Talk to me]]</sup>/<sub>[[Special:Contributions/Zackmann08|<span style="color:orange;">What I been doing</span>]]</sub>) 23:43, 21 October 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Template talk:Infobox tennis biography#rfc_ED967D2|Template talk:Infobox tennis biography]] expired 2025-11-22 07:01 ===
* Id: ED967D2
* User: Zackmann08
* Date: 2025-10-23 06:09:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1318326473|BIO 1318326473}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1318326481|SOC 1318326481}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1318326482|POLICY 1318326482}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1323521997|BIO 1323521997}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1323522000|SOC 1323522000}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1323522003|POLICY 1323522003}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
At an [[Template_talk:Infobox_person/Archive_34#Residence_parameter|RFC]] in 2019, there was overwhelming support to remove {{para|residence}} from {{tl|Infobox person}} and from {{tl|Infobox sportsperson}}. 

In 2024, at a [[Template_talk:Infobox_person/Archive_38#RfC:_Do_you_support_overturning_the_2020_consensus_to_remove_residence_from_the_Infobox_person_template?|second RFC]] that decision was affirmed and overwhelming agreed to for a second time. 

Given that {{tl|Infobox person}} and {{tl|Infobox sportsperson}} both had this parameter removed, should {{tl|Infobox tennis biography}} do the same. 

For the record and for full disclosure, I initially went ahead and removed it as I felt that the 2 RFCs made it clear that this change was to be made. That removal was objected to fiercely by another editor who felt I had overstepped. I have reverted my change and here we are. 

;A few arguments
* Per [[MOS:IBXPURPOSE]]: {{tq|The less information it contains, the more effectively it serves that purpose, allowing readers to identify key facts at a glance}}
* The "residence" is almost never sourced and is not really relevant to the player's biography
* To quote one editor at the previous RFC, "{{tq|Completely non-educational unless you're some sort of celebrity stalker}}".
'''[[User:Zackmann08|<span style="color:#00ced1">Zack</span><span style="color:#007F94">mann</span>]]''' (<sup>[[User_talk:Zackmann08|Talk to me]]</sup>/<sub>[[Special:Contributions/Zackmann08|<span style="color:orange;">What I been doing</span>]]</sub>) 06:09, 23 October 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Crusades#rfc_D5290EA|Talk:Crusades]] expired 2025-11-22 09:01 ===
* Id: D5290EA
* User: Borsoka
* Date: 2025-10-23 08:17:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1318338413|HIST 1318338413}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1323532267|HIST 1323532267}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
What should be the scope of the article "[[Crusades]]"?
*''Option A:'' The article should focus on the papally sanctioned anti-Muslim military campaigns launched for the Holy Land between 1095 and 1291, and only briefly discuss the connections between these "numbered Crusades" and other papally endorsed campaigns that formed part of the wider [[crusading movement]].
*''Option B:'' The article should cover all papally sanctioned military campaigns, including those treated in separate articles, such as the [[Albigensian Crusades]], the [[Iberian Crusades]], and the [[Northern Crusades]].
*''Option C:'' The article should cover both the Crusades for the Holy Land and, in brief, other campaigns authorised by papal indulgence, but as distinct topics.
[[User:Borsoka|Borsoka]] ([[User talk:Borsoka|talk]]) 08:17, 23 October 2025 (UTC)}}

| Moved to [[Wikipedia:Naming conventions (Brussels)]] and made [[WP:SUPPLEMENTAL|a supplemental information page]] of [[Wikipedia:Naming conventions (geographic names)]], commonly known as 'NCPLACE'?

| Marked historical as unneeded, unenforced or lacking consensus? }}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Ireland/Ireland Category Norms#rfc_6AC01EB|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Ireland/Ireland Category Norms]] expired 2025-11-24 22:01 ===
* Id: 6AC01EB
* User: WhatamIdoing
* Date: 2025-10-25 21:47:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1318769289|POLICY 1318769289}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1323981454|POLICY 1323981454}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This page was tagged as a sitewide {{tl|guideline}} after [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Ireland/Archive 16#RFC: Categorising Northern Ireland under Ireland|an RFC in 2013]].  The RFC was not a [[WP:PROPOSAL]] for guideline status; instead, it was about [[Wikipedia:Categories for discussion/Log/2013 April 12#Category:People by city in Ireland|a dispute over a CFD]].  A couple of participants in the RFC casually referred to this page as a "guideline", and on the basis of their comments, the page was later tagged as a {{Tl|Guideline}} instead of as a {{tl|WikiProject advice page}}.  

The [[WP:PROJPAGE]] guideline says:  {{xt|Some important site-wide topical guidelines, such as [[Wikipedia:Identifying reliable sources (medicine)]], and [[Wikipedia:Notability (books)]], originally began as advice pages written by WikiProjects.  However, after being adopted by the community, they are no longer WikiProject advice pages and have the same status as any other guideline.  When this happens, the WikiProject's participants cede any notion of control over the page, and everyone in the community participates equally in further development of the guidelines. Such pages move out from under their original "Wikipedia:WikiProject {{var|Something}}/" path.}}

I therefore propose that editors choose one of two options:

# Mark this page as a {{tl|WikiProject advice page}}, and leave it at the present page title, or
# Leave this page marked as a {{tl|guideline}}, and move the page to a title that does not refer to WikiProject Ireland.
[[User:WhatamIdoing|WhatamIdoing]] ([[User talk:WhatamIdoing|talk]]) 21:47, 25 October 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Template talk:Video game reviews#rfc_3D5965C|Template talk:Video game reviews]] expired 2025-11-25 04:01 ===

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)#rfc_98DCF44|Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)]] expired 2025-11-25 11:01 ===
* Id: 98DCF44
* User: ChildrenWillListen
* Date: 2025-10-28 05:04:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1319172392|TECH 1319172392}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1324372105|TECH 1324372105}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
An [[WP:EF|edit filter]] can perform certain actions when triggered, such as warning the user, disallowing the edit, or applying a [[WP:TAG|change tag]] to the revision. However, there are lesser known actions that aren't currently used in the English Wikipedia, such as blocking the user for a specified amount of time, desysopping them, and something called "revoke autoconfirmed". Contrary to its name, this action doesn't actually revoke anything; it instead prevents them from being "autopromoted", or automatically becoming auto- or extended-confirmed. This restriction can be undone by any EFM at any time, and automatically expires in five days provided the user doesn't trigger that action again. Unlike block and desysop (called "degroup" in the code), this option is enabled for use on enwiki, but has seemingly never been used at all.

Fast forward to today, and we have multiple abusers and vandalbots gaming extended confirmed in order to vandalize or edit contentious topics. One abuser in particular has caused an edit filter to be created for them, which is reasonably effective in slowing them down, but it still lets them succeed if left unchecked. As far as I'm aware, the only false positive for this filter was triggered by {{noping|PaulHSAndrews}}, who has since been [[WP:CBAN|community-banned]]. In theory, setting this filter to "revoke autoconfirmed" should effectively stop them from being able to become extended confirmed. Some technical changes were recently made to allow non-admin EFMs to use this action, but since it has never been used, I was told to request community consensus here.

So, should edit filter managers be allowed to use the "revoke autoconfirmed" action in edit filters? [[User:ChildrenWillListen|<span style="color:green">Children</span> <span style="color:purple">Will</span> <span style="color:red">Listen</span>]] ([[User talk:ChildrenWillListen|üêÑ talk]], [[Special:Contributions/ChildrenWillListen|ü´ò contribs]]) 05:04, 28 October 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Good article nominations#rfc_BE2CCD7|Wikipedia talk:Good article nominations]] expired 2025-11-25 18:01 ===
* Id: BE2CCD7
* User: MSincccc
* Date: 2025-11-14 06:29:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1322086623|PROP 1322086623}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1324122803|PROP 1324122803}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I would like to propose the addition of a feedback link on new GA and FAC review pages.  
The '''objective''' is to provide nominators with a simple means of offering constructive comments to reviewers, particularly newer or less experienced ones who may still be developing their reviewing skills. I have myself benefited from valuable suggestions left to me by nominators and experienced reviewers.

A sample prototype of the proposed feedback page can be found [[User:MSincccc/sandbox3|here]], where nominators can leave brief suggestions or comments at their convenience once a review is closed. This would not alter any existing review procedures, nor would it be mandatory for nominators or reviewers.

I welcome any thoughts on whether this might be a useful addition to the process. [[User:MSincccc|MSincccc]] ([[User talk:MSincccc|talk]]) 06:29, 14 November 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Lead section#rfc_669B047|Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Lead section]] expired 2025-11-26 01:01 ===
* Id: 669B047
* User: PersusjCP
* Date: 2025-11-25 21:52:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1324155360|HIST 1324155360}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1324155364|STYLE 1324155364}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1324175696|HIST 1324175696}}

* RFC Text:

Per [[MOS:FOREIGNEQUIV]], {{tqi|"If the subject of the article is closely associated with a non-English language, a single equivalent name in another language may be included in the lead sentence"}}. There has been much contention over the years on whether or not local Native Americans/First Nations (or other Indigenous minority communities) and their languages are closely-associated to articles about places, including both modern settlements and natural features.<br>
Please forgive me if I added the wrong categories, this is my first RFC.<br>

1. Can minority native languages be closely related to articles about places? What determines "close association"?<br>
2. Can a reliably-sourced name belonging to a minority native language be used as the foreign equivalent? [[User:PersusjCP|PersusjCP]] ([[User talk:PersusjCP|talk]]) 21:52, 25 November 2025 (UTC)}}

Should the first sentence of this article continue to describe the practice of Sati as having declined, but not disappeared, through a descriptor such as "a largely historical practice", or not? 

Please see the [[Talk:Sati_(practice)#Source_misrepresentation_in_lead|discussion above]] for additional context. 16:57, 28 October 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Dingo#rfc_F24DD25|Talk:Dingo]] expired 2025-11-29 00:01 ===
* Id: F24DD25
* User: Hemiauchenia
* Date: 2025-10-29 23:39:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1319462034|SCI 1319462034}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1324668434|SCI 1324668434}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
What should the Dingo be listed as in the taxobox?

*A. As a member of the dog species ''Canis familiaris'', Linnaeus 1758 (example [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Dingo&oldid=1319457936])
*B. As the species ''Canis dingo'' Meyer, 1793 (example [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Dingo&oldid=823379276])
*C. As the subspecies ''Canis lupus dingo'' Meyer, 1793 (example [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Dingo&oldid=1247239820])
*D. As the subspecies ''Canis familiaris dingo'' Meyer, 1793
*E. As the subspecies ''Canis lupus familiaris'' Linnaeus, 1758 (treating the dog as a subspecies of the grey wolf).
*F. Omit a taxobox entirely
[[User:Hemiauchenia|Hemiauchenia]] ([[User talk:Hemiauchenia|talk]]) 23:39, 29 October 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)#rfc_D145677|Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)]] expired 2025-11-30 07:01 ===
* Id: D145677
* User: CR90
* Date: 2025-11-10 18:07:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1321469890|POLICY 1321469890}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1326761942|POLICY 1326761942}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This request for comment proposes deprecating the Associated Press Stylebook as a naming authority within [[WP:USPLACE]]. The current guideline ties certain U.S. city article titles to whether the AP Stylebook lists them as not requiring a state name, a practice that dates back to Wikipedia‚Äôs early years. However, this external dependency conflicts with Wikipedia‚Äôs self-governed policy hierarchy and with the way other countries‚Äô naming conventions are structured. No other national convention relies on an outside publication to determine article titles. This discussion invites editors to consider whether Wikipedia should instead base U.S. city naming solely on internal principles such as [[WP:TITLE]], [[WP:COMMONNAME]], and [[WP:PRIMARYTOPIC]], supported by verifiable usage data such as pageviews and clickstreams.

'''Proposal'''

Deprecate the Associated Press Stylebook as a naming authority within [[WP:USPLACE]]. Future decisions about the inclusion or omission of state names in U.S. city article titles should be based solely on Wikipedia‚Äôs internal policies and verifiable usage evidence.

Replace the existing paragraph:

:"Cities listed in the AP Stylebook as not requiring the state modifier in newspaper articles have their articles named 'City' unless they are not the primary topic for that name."

with:

:"Cities are titled by the most common and unambiguous name used by readers and reliable sources, in accordance with [[WP:TITLE]] and [[WP:PRIMARYTOPIC]]. The inclusion or omission of a state name is determined by actual disambiguation need, not by external style guides.""

Add an explanatory note:

:"References to the AP Stylebook in earlier versions of this guideline are deprecated. Wikipedia naming conventions should rely on internal policy and verifiable data, such as reader behavior or reliable source usage, rather than on external editorial manuals."

'''Background'''

The current wording of [[WP:USPLACE]] incorporates the Associated Press Stylebook as part of its reasoning for which United States cities are exempt from the ‚ÄúPlacename, State‚Äù format. This reliance on an external publication is unusual within Wikipedia‚Äôs system of self-contained policies and guidelines. Other country-specific naming conventions (for example [[WP:UKPLACE]], [[WP:CANPLACE]], [[WP:NCAUST]], [[WP:NCIND]]) rely only on internal policy principles such as [[WP:TITLE]], [[WP:COMMONNAME]], and [[WP:PRIMARYTOPIC]].

'''Rationale'''

The AP Stylebook was created for journalistic brevity, not encyclopedic clarity. Wikipedia‚Äôs naming standards are designed for reliability and reader intent, not for newspaper copy.
No other country‚Äôs naming convention cites an external editorial manual as authority. The United States should not be an exception.
The AP list of cities without state modifiers is dated and arbitrary, reflecting mid-20th-century newspaper familiarity rather than modern global recognition.
Wikimedia‚Äôs pageview and clickstream data provide transparent, empirical evidence of what readers mean when they search for a city name.
This change aligns [[WP:USPLACE]] with [[WP:TITLE]] and [[WP:PRIMARYTOPIC]], ensuring that the same principles apply worldwide.

'''Intended outcome'''

Consensus to remove or deprecate references to the Associated Press Stylebook from [[WP:USPLACE]] and clarify that U.S. city naming follows the same internally governed, data-based principles used for other countries. <b style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;text-shadow:1px 1px 1px #69b3e7;color:#fd0;">[[User:CR90|<span style="color:#041e42;">TrueCRaysball</span>]] <sup>[[User talk:CR90|üí¨]]&#124;[[Special:Contributions/TrueCRaysball|‚úèÔ∏è]]</sup></b> 18:07, 10 November 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Scientology#rfc_D08AB6D|Talk:Scientology]] expired 2025-11-30 15:01 ===
* Id: D08AB6D
* Date: 2025-10-31 14:52:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1319734284|RELI 1319734284}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1319741801|SCI 1319741801}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1324976301|SCI 1324976301}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1324976304|RELI 1324976304}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There is ongoing disagreement about how to phrase the following sentence in the article:
* Current version: "Hubbard established an organization to promote his pseudoscientific ideas about the mind, which he called Dianetics, in 1950." 
* Alternative proposal: "Hubbard established an organization to promote Dianetics in 1950, a system widely described by scholars as pseudoscientific."

The core issue is whether Wikipedia should state in its own voice that Hubbard promoted "his pseudoscientific ideas", or whether the pseudoscience characterization should be attributed to reliable sources in a separate clause. The earlier discussion is at {{section link|Talk:Scientology|Wikivoice}}.

Input from uninvolved editors is welcome to help determine the most neutral and policy-compliant phrasing.

* '''Option 1''': Keep the current version.
** '''Option 1b''': Text should continue to describe as pseudoscience in wikivoice but may revise to clarify whether Hubbard intended to deceive. (option added 09:10, 6 November 2025)
* '''Option 2''': Change it to the alternative proposal.
* '''Option 3''' (please specify): There is some other consideration, and how that consideration may be satisfied. (option added 09:10, 6 November 2025)
* '''Option 4''' Hubbard established an organization to promote Dianetics in 1950, a method that academic analyses commonly/generally classify as [[pseudoscience]]. (option added 17:06, 20 November 2025)

14:52, 31 October 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Aviation#rfc_D0E4BE0|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Aviation]] expired 2025-12-01 03:01 ===
* Id: D0E4BE0
* User: Zaptain United
* Date: 2025-11-01 02:34:00

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the article title be styled as the IATA name, Branded name, or the ICAO name?
* American Airlines Flight 5342 (IATA name)
** Consistency with sources including the NTSB, NY Times, and Washington Post
** Brand recognition of American
* American Eagle Flight 5342 (Branded name)
** Ticketing and passenger experience
* PSA Airlines Flight 5342 (ICAO name)
** Operational and legal accuracy

The same question applies to the recent Delta accident:

* Delta Air Lines Flight 4819
* Delta Connection Flight 4819
* Endeavor Air Flight 4819

All follow the style of <airline> Flight <flight-number> as described in the [<nowiki/>[[Wikipedia:WikiProject Aviation/Aviation accident task force#Accident article naming conventions%7Cnaming|conventions section]]]

Should the title be styled as the IATA name, Branded name, or the ICAO name? [[User:Zaptain United|Zaptain United]] ([[User talk:Zaptain United|talk]]) 02:34, 1 November 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)#rfc_2E8F1D1|Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)]] expired 2025-12-02 08:01 ===
* Id: 2E8F1D1
* Date: 2025-11-29 22:52:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1324859906|POLICY 1324859906}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1325832449|POLICY 1325832449}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There are currently four general categories of [[WP:GS|general sanctions]] (i.e., sets of special rules or restrictions that apply across entire topic areas):
# '''ArbCom-designated contentious topics''' ([[WP:CTOP]]s);
# '''Community-designated contentious topics''' ([[WP:CCTOP]]s), which were recently formalized at [[Special:Permalink/1324159302#RfC:_Aligning_community_CTOPs_with_ArbCom_CTOPs|this recent RfC]];
# '''ArbCom-imposed topicwide restrictions''' (for example, the topic of [[WP:CT/SASG|South Asian social groups]] is subject to an extended-confirmed restriction; the topic of [[Wikipedia:Contentious_topics/Genetically_modified_organisms#1RR_imposed|genetically modified organisms]] is subject to 1RR); and
# '''Community-imposed topicwide restrictions''' (for example, the topic of [[WP:GS/KURD|Kurds and Kurdistan]] is subject to a community-imposed extended-confirmed restriction; the topic of [[WP:GS/Crypto|cryptocurrency]] is subject to 1RR).

Currently, enforcement requests and appeals arising from categories #1-3 can go to either the [[WP:AE|arbitration enforcement noticeboard]] (AE) or the [[WP:AN|administrators' noticeboard]] (AN), as appropriate. (Enforcement requests tend to go to AE, whereas appeals can go to either venue at the sanctioned editor's choice, as guaranteed by [[Wikipedia:Arbitration_Committee/Procedures#Appeals_by_sanctioned_editors|ArbCom's procedures]]). By contrast, enforcement requests and appeals arising from category #4 can only go to AN.

The question is: should the community allow enforcement requests and appeals arising from all [[Wikipedia:General_sanctions#Community_sanctions|community-imposed general sanctions]] (including category #4) to be heard at AE (in addition to AN)? 22:52, 29 November 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Dead Internet theory#rfc_22FE213|Talk:Dead Internet theory]] expired 2025-12-04 13:01 ===
* Id: 22FE213
* User: Rose Abrams
* Date: 2025-11-04 12:36:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1320397121|SCI 1320397121}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1320397130|SOC 1320397130}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1325666987|SCI 1325666987}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1325666989|SOC 1325666989}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I feel like we need to gather broad consensus for what we should talk about under this topic. Over the years, this talk page has had loads of topics saying "it's not a conspiracy theory" to which people reply "yes it is, because sources says so". Therefore, let me state very clearly that my intention of this RFC is '''''not'' to discuss the article's sourcing''', be it what they say nor which are reliable. Instead, I want to create consensus for '''what the article should be about''' ‚Äì  in other words, what text and topic should be discussed inside a Wikipedia article titled "Dead Internet theory"?
 
There is really 2 theories here ‚Äì the sentiment "bot activity online is drowning out humans and [[Appeal to emotion|it feels depressing]]" and the sentiment "bot activity online is [[brainwashing]] by {{small caps|[[In-group and out-group|them]]}} to [[New World Order conspiracy theory|control the world]]". And although both theories are generally referred to with the article title, they are extremely different in terms of what they propose, how they came about, and what emotions are targeted by their respective theorists. One is rooted in [[anti-AI]] and general [[doomerism]] which are quite recent phenomena, and the other is a renewed phrasing of the good-ol' "evil people are secretly controlling us" which is as old as antisemitism.
 
As such, I don't believe it works very well to describe the two in interwoven prose as if they were equal. For example, the topic named "[[New World Order (disambiguation)|New World Order]]" has been split across several articles, including [[New world order (politics)|the political sense]] and [[New World Order conspiracy theory|the conspiratorial sense]]. Similarly, [[brainrot]] is a separate topic from [[brainwashing]] although the two concepts largely present the same methodology. And as a third, and blatantly more obvious example, we don't talk about [[goyslop]] in [[Criticism of fast food]].
 
So we should pick one and only one topic to discuss in this article. And it should be whatever the [[WP:COMMONNAME]] of "Dead Internet theory" is used for, as to be determined by the community. <small>By my personal unsourced observation, the by far most prominent topic of the two is the anti-AI one.</small>
 
How to accomplish this and what to do with the other topic should also be a point of debate ‚Äì we could [[WP:SPLIT|split]] or [[WP:SPINOFF|fork]] it off into a separate article, we could put it under its own heading here, we could deem it [[WP:NOT|not within project scope]] and delete it, or do something completely different. Let‚Äôs hear it.
 
{{quote|My personal opinion of how to resolve this: '''Contentfork''' this article into its two constituent topics, perhaps titled [[Dead Internet theory]] and [[Dead Internet conspiracy theory]]. They are separate topics that both deserve coverage but should be covered separately. Any actual overlap between the two may be described in the destination articles. If the community supports this path, I'd be happy to start writing towards it myself.}} [[User:Rose Abrams|<span style="color:#0000ff;">Rose Abrams</span>]] ([[User talk:Rose Abrams|T]] [[Special:Contributions/Rose Abrams|C]] [[Special:Log/Rose Abrams|L]]) 12:36, 4 November 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of states with limited recognition#rfc_1939F4F|Talk:List of states with limited recognition]] expired 2025-12-04 19:01 ===

=== [[Talk:Clayton Kershaw#rfc_2D66E0A|Talk:Clayton Kershaw]] expired 2025-12-04 20:01 ===
* Id: 2D66E0A
* Date: 2025-11-04 19:59:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1320455025|BIO 1320455025}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1320455031|SOC 1320455031}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1325722109|BIO 1325722109}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1325722115|SOC 1325722115}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
[[Clayton Kershaw]] pitched in the 2020 and 2025 World Series. In 2024 he pitched in the regular season, but [https://www.espn.com/mlb/story/_/id/41627673/los-angeles-dodgers-shut-clayton-kershaw-postseason was put on the injured list at the end of August and did not appear on any post-season rosters] as the Dodgers went on to win the World Series.

In the wake of last week's championship and his retirement:
*Secondary source news reports ([https://www.ocregister.com/2025/11/02/dodgers-send-clayton-kershaw-into-retirement-as-a-three-time-world-series-champion/ example]) credit Kershaw as a "3-time World Series champion" for 2020, 2024, and 2025. 
*His [https://www.mlb.com/player/clayton-kershaw-477132 MLB.com profile] and the statistics website [https://www.baseball-reference.com/players/k/kershcl01.shtml Baseball Reference] instead give him credit for "2x World Series" and "World Series Championship (2020, 2025)", omitting 2024 when he was not on the active WS roster.
Should Clayton Kershaw be called a '''two'''-time World Series champion? Or a '''three'''-time World Series champion? <small>Long-running content dispute that has gone on for an entire year since the [[2024 World Series]] concluded.</small> 19:59, 4 November 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Category talk:Canadian sportspeople by country of descent#rfc_1127EA8|Category talk:Canadian sportspeople by country of descent]] expired 2025-12-08 03:01 ===
* Id: 1127EA8
* User: Crowsus
* Date: 2025-12-01 09:55:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1325141543|POLICY 1325141543}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1326281384|POLICY 1326281384}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Following a CfD for categories relating to British sportspeople in 2023 [[Wikipedia:Categories for discussion/Log/2023 December 28#Britsh sportspeople by descent|'''here''']], followed by those for several other groupings nominated by myself in September 2025 [[Wikipedia:Categories for discussion/Log/2025 September 3#American sportspeople by country of descent|'''here''']], all of which resulted in upmerging apart from the Canadians and French, I submitted a deletion review in November '''[[Wikipedia:Deletion review/Log/2025 November 21|here]]''' which endorsed the no-consensus closure. I have no problem with that, my purpose was to seek a logical global consistency on the suitability of this intersection - it was suggested that RfC was the best place for that, so here I am, again. 

Of course there are valid sources discussing the ethnic origins of many competitors in many sports from many countries, but that would suggest that it would be of more benefit to expand on the specific subject(s) in an article or a series of articles, and similar evidence did not prevent almost all of the other categories being upmerged, resulting in these two groupings being retained in a completely illogical manner; either this is valid for a categorisation fork across the board, or it isn't, because 20 years of this project have shown that the proliferation and maintenance of categories is not adequately patrolled and policed to have narrow, particular forks without 'siblings' being created and populated for similar matters.

There is no evidence that [[:Category:Canadian sportspeople of Slovak descent]] has specific sourcing for its individual importance, and also nothing to prevent [[:Category:Canadian sportspeople of Czech descent]] being created if half a dozen qualifying biographies were found (by the way, glancing at [[:Category:Canadian people of Czech descent]], about half of the 68 articles there look to be sportspeople, so in that respect it would be perfectly valid), regardless of sourcing. On the French side, there is no evidence that [[:Category:French sportspeople of Portuguese descent]] has specific sourcing for its individual importance, and also nothing to prevent [[:Category:French sportspeople of Spanish descent]] being created if half a dozen qualifying biographies were found (by the way, glancing at [[:Category:French people of Spanish descent]], perhaps 100 of the 336 articles there look to be sportspeople, so in that respect it would be perfectly valid) ‚Äì because that's not the way categories work in practice and never has been: it is assumed that the source exists in the article if there is already a category present which prompts another to be added.

Finally, the deletion of other groupings has left a silly imbalance for certain intersections: [[:Category:French sportspeople of Turkish descent]] is still present but [[:Category:German sportspeople of Turkish descent]] was upmerged, somewhat farcical for any reader with a passing interest in German/Turkish culture and/or sport in the past 50+ years, and of course that complex relationship is a published topic of relevance (see [[Turks in Germany#Sports]]) but that did not 'save' the particular category at the earlier CfD.  We are not discussing whether the topic exists independently but whether it is relevant for the continued existence of this entire intersection of categorisation. And in that regard, there is no difference between the surviving Canadian / French groupings and the deleted American / Australian / British / Spanish groupings other than one or two people contributing to the CfD. The principle is identical, either those should be restored or these other 'survivors' merged too. 

PS I'm not certain if the RfC type I have selected is the most suitable, please change it if not. [[User:Crowsus|Crowsus]] ([[User talk:Crowsus|talk]]) 09:55, 1 December 2025 (UTC)}}

* Id: A21DE5B
* User: Jtbobwaysf
* Date: 2025-11-08 10:39:00

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1326330276|SOC 1326330276}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Shall we add a one word summary of the controversy/dispute in the [[WP:LEAD]] of the [[WP:BLP]] of [[Max Verstappen]]? 

Choices:
*No 1: diff [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Max_Verstappen&diff=1320872445&oldid=1320724250 "'''disputed'''"] "Verstappen won his maiden title in {{F1|2021}} after overtaking [[Lewis Hamilton]] on the final lap of the disputed [[2021 Abu Dhabi Grand Prix|Abu Dhabi Grand Prix]]..." 
*No 2: diff [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Max_Verstappen&diff=1321054286&oldid=1320983421 "'''controversial'''"] "Verstappen won his maiden title in {{F1|2021}} after overtaking [[Lewis Hamilton]] on the final lap of the controversial [[2021 Abu Dhabi Grand Prix|Abu Dhabi Grand Prix]]..." 
*No 3: No change

(Essentially we are adding the word '''disputed,''' '''controversial''', or leaving as is). Also has been discussed in the talk page section above this. 

Thanks! [[User:Jtbobwaysf|Jtbobwaysf]] ([[User talk:Jtbobwaysf|talk]]) 10:39, 8 November 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of communist states#rfc_02BB862|Talk:List of communist states]] expired 2025-12-09 23:01 ===

* Date: 2025-12-09 13:24:00

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Hello, I have noticed that most all Wikipedia articles in this list have the "government type" subsection of the introbox be either simply "communist state", "unitary communist state" or "federal communist state", however it seems like these changes have been done mostly without formal consensus. Therefore, in the interest of clarification, I would like to ask which of these two options be used in introboxes going forward:

*'''Option A:''' The governments of these states be identified as "unitary communist state" or "federal communist state"
*'''Option B:''' The governments of these states be identified as "unitary one-party socialist republic" or "federal one-party socialist republic"
Thanks, [[User:ST15RMwikipedia]] 13:24, 9 December 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Primerica#rfc_1D5E3D1|Talk:Primerica]] expired 2025-12-12 18:01 ===
* Id: 1D5E3D1
* User: TermLifeOG
* Date: 2025-11-12 17:49:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|1321788809|ECON 1321788809}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|1327111853|ECON 1327111853}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should research products of Primerica be included on the page? 
 
The following language is under discussion: 
 
Primerica conducts quarterly surveys that monitor the financial health of Americans.<ref name="usatoday2021">{{cite news |last1=Menton |first1=Jessica |title=A year after COVID, personal finances are not so grim for millions of Americans |url=https://www.usatoday.com/in-depth/money/2021/04/09/irs-stimulus-check-2021-third-covid-payment-unemployment-benefits/7015277002/ |access-date=23 December 2024 |publisher=USA Today |date=9 Apr 2021}}</ref> earning between $30,000 and $130,000 annually called the Financial Security Monitor.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Dumas |first1=Breck |title=Middle-income households with negative views of their personal finances surges to new high |url=https://www.foxbusiness.com/personal-finance/middle-income-households-negative-view-personal-finances-surges-new-high |access-date=27 January 2025 |publisher=Fox Business |date=13 October 2024}}</ref>
 
In 2023,<ref name="ajc2023">{{cite news |last1=Kanell |first1=Michael E. |title=New Primerica index shows household finances improving, still burdened |url=https://www.ajc.com/news/atlanta-news/new-primerica-index-shows-household-finances-improving-still-burdened/PWTODJFLWNGD3I4XUX7SJBS77Y/ |access-date=23 December 2024 |publisher=The Atlanta Journal Consitution |date=22 August 2023}}</ref> the company created the Household Budget Index, a monthly index<ref name="usatoday2024">{{cite news |last1=Lee |first1=Medora |title=Inflation-shocked low- and middle-income Americans may not spend normally for years |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/personalfinance/2024/10/25/inflation-low-middle-income-lasting-impact/75796197007/ |access-date=23 December 2024 |publisher=USA Today |date=25 October 2024}}</ref> that measures middle-income Americans‚Äô [[purchasing power]] for necessities such as food, health care, gas and utilities.<ref name="ajc2023" />
 
[[User:TermLifeOG|TermLifeOG]] ([[User talk:TermLifeOG|talk]]) 17:49, 12 November 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)#rfc_09C1143|Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)]] expired 2025-12-15 12:01 ===
* Id: 09C1143
* User: Qcne
* Date: 2025-12-04 11:28:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1325661210|POLICY 1325661210}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1328906531|POLICY 1328906531}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
'''Request for comment:''' Should we replace the current text of the guideline at [[Wikipedia:Writing articles with large language models]] with the draft guideline at [[User:Qcne/LLMGuideline]]?

The new draft guideline defines an LLM, strongly advises editors not to use LLMs to add content to Wikipedia, and describes how to handle LLM-generated content that is already present.

This follows on from the RFCBEFORE discussion at [[Wikipedia talk:Writing articles with large language models#Further amendment proposal #2: qcne]], where several alternative drafts were discussed. <span style="background-color: RoyalBlue; border-radius: 1em; padding: 3px 3px 3px 3px;">'''[[User:Qcne|<span style="color: GhostWhite">qcne</span>]]''' <small>[[User talk:Qcne|<span style="color: GhostWhite">(talk)</span>]]</small></span> 11:28, 4 December 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Hayel Saeed Anam Group#rfc_7493BE8|Talk:Hayel Saeed Anam Group]] expired 2025-12-18 21:01 ===
* Id: 7493BE8
* User: Hudsonvalleyedits
* Date: 2025-11-18 20:04:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|1323480761|ECON 1323480761}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|1328263494|ECON 1328263494}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
 This wiki page is pretty thin, compared to other large multinationals (Nabisco, eg: [[Nabisco]]), so I'd like to suggest adding additional sections with well-resourced information about the organization's work. Food security is a key focus for the organization, so suggest starting here. Below is a draft section with third-party source. All factual / cut and dry. Thoughts? 

Suggest adding new section food security with suggested language and sources below:


Food Security in Yemen: HSA Group leads several efforts to strengthen food security in their home country of Yemen, where more than 17 million people are estimated to not have enough food to eat. (source: https://reliefweb.int/report/yemen/mr-tom-fletcher-under-secretary-general-humanitarian-affairs-and-emergency-relief-coordinator-briefing-security-council-humanitarian-situation-yemen-15-september-2025). HSA Group plays a leading role in assuring that stocks of food like flour, sugar, wheat, and dairy products remain at adequate levels and are distributed to communities in need. (source: https://www.ifc.org/en/stories/2022/yemeni-company-feeds-millions-despite-relentless-challenges) To support these efforts, the International Financial Corporation (IFC) made an investment that provides and mobilizes up to $75 million in debt financing for HSA operations in the country. (source: https://pressroom.ifc.org/all/pages/PressDetail.aspx?ID=26564, https://www.ifc.org/en/pressroom/2021/ifc-partners-with-hsa-group-to-bolster-food-security-in-yemen) The financing package includes a syndicated loan from FMO, the Dutch Entrepreneurial Development Bank, of up to $20 million. (source: https://www.ifc.org/en/stories/2022/yemeni-company-feeds-millions-despite-relentless-challenges) HSA Group is a key driver of the stability of Yemen's private sector, which constituted 50 percent of GDP and provided employment for around 69.4 percent of the total employed population, prior to the civil war. (source: https://www.ifc.org/en/stories/2022/yemeni-company-feeds-millions-despite-relentless-challenges). Over the last decade, HSA has partnered with UN agencies, including the World Health Organization (WHO), the UN Office for Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (UN OCHA) and the World Food Programme (WFP) on a variety of initiatives and aid programmes that benefit millions of Yemenis. (source: https://www.proparco.fr/en/article/towards-food-security-yemen-hsa-group-concert-un-dfis-and-international-ngos) Its work with the WFP has included milling flour for distribution across Yemen, manufacturing high-energy date bars for school feeding programmes and distributing emergency food baskets across Yemen. (source: https://www.cgiar.org/news-events/news/towards-advancing-childrens-nutritional-intake-taking-stock-of-evidence-based-effective-school-feeding-programs-in-the-middle-east/) Most recently, HSA Group has been partnering with Tetra Pak on a new initiative in Yemen that will serve as a pilot for introducing fortified milk in school feeding programmes. At HSA Group, we remain committed to working with our partners to address Yemen‚Äôs food security challenges. (source: https://www.tetrapak.com/en-us/insights/cases-articles/yemen-school-milk-programme-shows-positive-results) Results of the school milk program include higher child cognition scores, improved children's learning, improved household food security, and enhanced mental health among caregivers and children. (source: https://www.tetrapak.com/en-us/insights/cases-articles/yemen-school-milk-programme-shows-positive-results) [[User:Hudsonvalleyedits|Hudsonvalleyedits]] ([[User talk:Hudsonvalleyedits|talk]]) 20:04, 18 November 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:2025 Bondi Beach shooting#rfc_4F4CF09|Talk:2025 Bondi Beach shooting]] expired 2025-12-19 01:01 ===
* Id: 4F4CF09
* User: Rambling Rambler
* Date: 2025-12-15 16:26:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1327674591|BIO 1327674591}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1327674595|POL 1327674595}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1328131889|POL 1328131889}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1328295412|BIO 1328295412}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Given that reporting on both the alleged perpetrators and the bystander who intervened has now become consistent at this point, with authorities identifying the former and the latter's family undertaking press interviews, I feel that it is now appropriate that the question be put formally given continued fragmented discussion over this matter. As they are currently restricted under different aspects of BLP ([[WP:BLPCRIME]] and [[WP:BLPNAME]] respectively) I feel multiple options are appropriate.

Should this article include the names of the alleged perpetrators and/or the bystander who intervened?
{{ordered list |list-style-type=upper-alpha
|Both the alleged perpetrators and the bystander who intervened
|<s>Only the alleged perpetrators</s>
|Only the bystander who intervened
|<s>None at this time</s>
}} [[User:Rambling Rambler|Rambling Rambler]] ([[User talk:Rambling Rambler|talk]]) 16:26, 15 December 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of oldest universities in continuous operation#rfc_2AD0447|Talk:List of oldest universities in continuous operation]] expired 2025-12-22 14:01 ===
* Id: 2AD0447
* User: Tinterest
* Date: 2025-12-14 00:00:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1327352208|POLICY 1327352208}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1328906531|POLICY 1328906531}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the University of New Brunswick (UNB) be included in this list of oldest universities in continuous operation, with a Note distinguishing between (a) its predecessor institution‚Äôs founding, (b) the 1800 provincial charter granting degree-conferring authority, and (c) the earliest documented university-level instruction in the 1820s?

Some editors argue that inclusion is inappropriate because documented university-level teaching begins only in the 1820s. Others argue that, consistent with existing table precedent ('''founding versus charter versus formal university status''', e.g., Harvard, which is included based on founding and charter despite later formal university status), UNB may be included with a clarifying Note reflecting charter authority and documentation limits, without asserting undocumented instruction.

For clarity, multiple draft phrasings of the proposed Note have been discussed above; the RfC concerns whether UNB should be included at all with a clarifying Note of this type, not endorsement of a specific final wording.

Input is sought on how [[WP:V]], [[WP:BURDEN]], and table precedent should be applied.[[User:Tinterest|Tinterest]] ([[User talk:Tinterest|talk]]) 00:00, 14 December 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:The Age of Disclosure#rfc_76CC1ED|Talk:The Age of Disclosure]] expired 2025-12-22 18:01 ===
* Id: 76CC1ED
* User: Chetsford
* Date: 2025-11-30 20:34:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1325029534|MEDIA 1325029534}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1330333856|MEDIA 1330333856}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
'''Q1:''' Should every person who appears in this film be listed in the cast list? 
*'''Yes'''
*'''No'''

'''Q2:''' If No, who should be listed? 
* '''A:''' Verifiable cast who have standalone [[BLP]]s
* '''B:''' Verifiable cast who have standalone [[BLP]]s '''''and''''' whose appearance is meaningfully cited (i.e. more than appearing in a list) in at least one [[WP:RS]] 
* '''C:''' Verifiable cast who have standalone [[BLP]]s '''''or''''' whose appearance is meaningfully cited (i.e. more than appearing in a list) in at least one [[WP:RS]]  
* '''D:''' "X#" (e.g. 5, 10, etc.) of the most central cast members as determined by subsequent discussion
* '''E:''' Other
[[User:Chetsford|Chetsford]] ([[User talk:Chetsford|talk]]) 20:34, 30 November 2025 (UTC)}}

Should data table captions be required only for screen readers? If yes, the first sentence of [[MOS:HEADERS]] would be changed to remove "and used on all data tables." === [[Talk:Israel#rfc_EF95696|Talk:Israel]] expired 2025-12-24 05:01 ===
* Id: EF95696
* User: &#126;2025-42743-62
* Date: 2025-12-24 03:33:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1329166120|POL 1329166120}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1329172097|POL 1329172097}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the article "Israel" use the term "genocide" to describe current military actions in the absence of a final legal ruling by the International Court of Justice (ICJ)?
Some editors argue that using this term as a factual descriptor violates WP:NPOV (Neutral Point of View) and WP:V (Verifiability), as it represents an ongoing legal debate rather than a settled historical fact. I propose that the term should either be removed or strictly attributed to specific organizations (e.g., "X organization has accused...") rather than being used in Wikipedia's own voice. This request aims to ensure the encyclopedia maintains an objective tone and adheres to policy WP:NOTCENSORED by documenting claims accurately without adopting them as definitive facts. [[Special:Contributions/&#126;2025-42743-62|&#126;2025-42743-62]] ([[User talk:&#126;2025-42743-62|talk]]) 03:33, 24 December 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:W?adys?aw Sikorski#rfc_995709C|Talk:W?adys?aw Sikorski]] expired 2025-12-26 01:01 ===
* Id: 995709C
* User: Pjurby
* Date: 2025-12-24 06:43:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1329269251|HIST 1329269251}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1329269254|POL 1329269254}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1329416246|HIST 1329416246}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1329416247|POL 1329416247}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
== General Wladyslaw Sikorski case reopened and investigation is under way '''

{{edit restricted}}
'''Recent Re-investigation (2025)''' On July 2, 2025, the Polish Institute of National Remembrance (IPN) officially reopened an investigation into the 1943 death of General W≈Çadys≈Çaw Sikorski. This development followed testimony provided by Peter Urba≈Ñski, son of Bronis≈Çaw Urba≈Ñski, a wartime operative and KOP officer. Official Case number is already available to Australian and Polish Government and Police sections involved.

The investigation, led by Polish Prosecutor Marcin Go≈Çƒôbiewski (IPN), has formally designated Peter Urba≈Ñski as a key witness. On September 10, 2025, the Polish Consulate in Canberra formally registered the case with the International Crime and Cooperation Authority (ICCCA) and the Australian Attorney-General‚Äôs Department to facilitate the collection of evidence and testimony.

This new inquiry explores the role of specialized units within the Polish Underground and British Intelligence, specifically regarding the "White Ghost" (Bronis≈Çaw Urba≈Ñski) and the logistical circumstances of the Gibraltar crash. Further documentation and research regarding these claims are maintained by the witness at [http://www.tolivewellistohidewell.com/ www.tolivewellistohidewell.com] [[User:Pjurby|Pjurby]] ([[User talk:Pjurby|talk]]) 06:43, 24 December 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[User talk:Athanelar/Identifying AI-generated text#rfc_08DBF24|User talk:Athanelar/Identifying AI-generated text]] expired 2025-12-28 01:01 ===
* Id: 08DBF24
* User: Athanelar/Identifying AI-generated text#rfc_08DBF24
* Date: 2025-11-28 00:19:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1324516260|POLICY 1324516260}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1329794320|POLICY 1329794320}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This has been up for a bit over 24 hours and has had a fair few eyes on it with no strong objections and some good tweaks, so I'm moving forward to RfC.

The RfC closer for [[WP:NEWLLM]] stated that a community consensus on identifying AI-generated text would be necessary in order for that guideline to be properly enforced.

The question for this RfC is thus: should this proposal be accepted as a supplementary essay to [[WP:NEWLLM]] (and future AI-restricting guidelines) to serve as a consensus standard for how to identify AI-generated text? [[User:Athanelar|Athanelar]] ([[User talk:Athanelar|talk]]) 00:19, 28 November 2025 (UTC)}}

* User: RatMan7108
* Date: 2025-11-30 15:42:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1324984006|HIST 1324984006}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1325506544|POL 1325506544}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
 Hello, regarding to this article. Should we use the infobox historical era layout instead of this infobox country one? Since Fascist Italy can be a broad concept, it can be referred to as the Kingdom of Italy from 1922 to 1943 (this article) and the [[Italian Social Republic]] from 1943 to 1945, something like a disambiguation. Although the article's main point was about the Kingdom of Italy under Fascism, it was a historical period within the state. Note that our article on [[Vargas era]] previously used the infobox country template, but now they changed it to the infobox historical era one. I think this article should follow suit. [[User:RatMan7108|RatMan7108]] ([[User talk:RatMan7108|talk]]) 15:42, 30 November 2025 (UTC)}}

=== [[Category talk:Canadian sportspeople by country of descent#rfc_E50275F|Category talk:Canadian sportspeople by country of descent]] expired 2025-12-31 10:01 ===
* Id: E50275F
* User: Crowsus
* Date: 2025-12-01 09:55:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1326281380|SOC 1326281380}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1330429772|SOC 1330429772}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Following a CfD for categories relating to British sportspeople in 2023 [[Wikipedia:Categories for discussion/Log/2023 December 28#Britsh sportspeople by descent|'''here''']], followed by those for several other groupings nominated by myself in September 2025 [[Wikipedia:Categories for discussion/Log/2025 September 3#American sportspeople by country of descent|'''here''']], all of which resulted in upmerging apart from the Canadians and French, I submitted a deletion review in November '''[[Wikipedia:Deletion review/Log/2025 November 21|here]]''' which endorsed the no-consensus closure. I have no problem with that, my purpose was to seek a logical global consistency on the suitability of this intersection - it was suggested that RfC was the best place for that, so here I am, again. 

Of course there are valid sources discussing the ethnic origins of many competitors in many sports from many countries, but that would suggest that it would be of more benefit to expand on the specific subject(s) in an article or a series of articles, and similar evidence did not prevent almost all of the other categories being upmerged, resulting in these two groupings being retained in a completely illogical manner; either this is valid for a categorisation fork across the board, or it isn't, because 20 years of this project have shown that the proliferation and maintenance of categories is not adequately patrolled and policed to have narrow, particular forks without 'siblings' being created and populated for similar matters.

There is no evidence that [[:Category:Canadian sportspeople of Slovak descent]] has specific sourcing for its individual importance, and also nothing to prevent [[:Category:Canadian sportspeople of Czech descent]] being created if half a dozen qualifying biographies were found (by the way, glancing at [[:Category:Canadian people of Czech descent]], about half of the 68 articles there look to be sportspeople, so in that respect it would be perfectly valid), regardless of sourcing. On the French side, there is no evidence that [[:Category:French sportspeople of Portuguese descent]] has specific sourcing for its individual importance, and also nothing to prevent [[:Category:French sportspeople of Spanish descent]] being created if half a dozen qualifying biographies were found (by the way, glancing at [[:Category:French people of Spanish descent]], perhaps 100 of the 336 articles there look to be sportspeople, so in that respect it would be perfectly valid) ‚Äì because that's not the way categories work in practice and never has been: it is assumed that the source exists in the article if there is already a category present which prompts another to be added.

Finally, the deletion of other groupings has left a silly imbalance for certain intersections: [[:Category:French sportspeople of Turkish descent]] is still present but [[:Category:German sportspeople of Turkish descent]] was upmerged, somewhat farcical for any reader with a passing interest in German/Turkish culture and/or sport in the past 50+ years, and of course that complex relationship is a published topic of relevance (see [[Turks in Germany#Sports]]) but that did not 'save' the particular category at the earlier CfD.  We are not discussing whether the topic exists independently but whether it is relevant for the continued existence of this entire intersection of categorisation. And in that regard, there is no difference between the surviving Canadian / French groupings and the deleted American / Australian / British / Spanish groupings other than one or two people contributing to the CfD. The principle is identical, either those should be restored or these other 'survivors' merged too. 

PS I'm not certain if the RfC type I have selected is the most suitable, please change it if not. [[User:Crowsus|Crowsus]] ([[User talk:Crowsus|talk]]) 09:55, 1 December 2025 (UTC)}}

. After reviewing your comments, I‚Äôve decided not to initiate an RfC at this time.
::Given your subsequent remarks on the article talk page ‚Äî particularly that World Press Photo, the Center for Creative Photography, and the Smithsonian Institution are respected, independent institutions, and that awards or institutional recognition from them are ‚Äúan achievement and worth mentioning‚Äù ‚Äî I wanted to ask a narrow procedural question.
::In light of that assessment, do you think the current maintenance tags on the article (general notability under WP:GNG and the BLP sourcing caution notice) remain appropriate, or would it now be reasonable for those tags to be removed pending further editorial review?
::I‚Äôm not seeking to escalate or reopen disputes, only to ensure that the article reflects consensus-based application of policy. I appreciate your guidance on this.
